reviews.text: I fell in love with the avocado rolls and now we get Cheesecake Factory as our safe meal whenever traveling. The menu is huge and I&#39;ve often gone to work lunches as a safe option for those with dietary restrictions and just picky eaters! The cheesecake is always great to take home later and you are often too full! Give it a try you won&#39;t regret it. Service is always fantastic as well!

Rarely do I consider writing a one star review, but this restaurant was certainly a deserving exception. There is actually nothing wrong with the food here, it&#39;s pretty standard and consistent fare for what you would expect at a Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>The reason for this review, and the lowest rating I could possibly give the restaurant, were the extraordinarily rude individuals we encountered at check-in and throughout the seating process. Goodness, if you have a choice, I&#39;m not sure why you would come here. In addition to simply not caring at all about their customers, one gentleman who seemed to be overseeing the seating even accused us of lying. <br><br>Thankfully there are plenty of choices and we won&#39;t be back. We&#39;re being diligent as well as forwarding our concerns to CCF corporate in Calabasas.

We stopped by Cheesecake Factory for my very favorite dessert and it&#39;s not cheesecake surprisingly. It&#39;s their Linda&#39;s Fudgecake! It is by far the best chocolate cake I&#39;ve ever had. Make sure to ask for extra whipped cream! Other great things about Cheesecake Factory is the ambiance and the yummy bread they give you at your table. The menu is very large, but it has something for everyone. This location is great being right near City Creek Mall so you can do some shopping after dinner. The underground parking is free for the first 2 hours.

It&#39;s crazy that I have been to cheese cake factory numerous times but never felt the need review because none of my experience has been review worthy. And even this review isn&#39;t about what I had ... <br><br>Lol but what my boyfriend ordered. &#39;Cajun Jambalaya Pasta&#39; ... Oh my the chicken and shrimp was so tender ... Someone please kiss the cook for me!!<br><br> It was so DELICIOUS and DID I MENTION TENDER!! I ended up digging into his food instead of mine....<br><br> My &#39;Evelyns pasta with salmon&#39; was good, a little bland, I always love all the veggies, in my opinion it needs some sort of sauce to make the pasta a little more moist. But that Jambalaya Pasta THOUGH!!! and here we are with this review. <br><br>I just wish that all my future Cheese Cake Factory experiences are as good as my last visit.

I did not feel safe . I ordered on line well in advance and although there are many staff walking about no one at the on line pick up room and the website response says you have to stand in line for cake . Not well marked for on line when you get there . I finally had to ask the hostess ( actually two ) while three of us in line for far too long and more people waiting for cake notified someone to help us for pick up . We waited again . You go in and out the same doorway vs arranging a pass through or evening outside pick up . You stand in line with Door Drivers drivers . <br><br>I would not go here again . I&#39;m a Cheesecake Factory fan and they don&#39;t have it figure out in SLC .

Let&#39;s be honest.. does the Cheesecake Factory even need any publicity? Of course not! <br><br>Honestly, I&#39;ve never had anything less than a fantastic experience here. What you see here are the beer-battered fish tacos with cilantro lime rice and black beans.<br><br>If you&#39;ve never been to the Cheesecake Factory, stop what you&#39;re doing and go now. Their menu is a novel but their portions are large and food is fantastic. Don&#39;t leave without a slice of cheesecake!<br><br>Tip: though the appetizers are wonderful, fill up on their complimentary bread beforehand
Great customer service and fantastic food!! I absolutely love this restaurant. Five Stars

More tacos and other things... tacos this time overdone,  no salsa, 2 out of 4 tacos no guac. Had to spread it around. That&#39;s weird. Uhm... this isn&#39;t consistent. The asparagus was burnt char and didn&#39;t taste like asparagus. The other day it was cooked differently and not charred. The steak wasn&#39;t seasoned either but bland. Disappointed this time. <br><br>Tuna tartare was amazing according to my guy.

I missed Chicken Madeira in the Seattle CKF for far too long. Drove to SLC for that reason in December. Not an expert in how it should taste like, but I found nothing to complain about. Would order again if back here.

Ahhh. The Cheesecake Factory. What is there to say that hadn&#39;t been said and said again here, there, and everywhere? I find the decor stunningly beautiful and the menu deliciously expansive--and I mean the food menu. The cheesecake menu variety is off the charts! Everything I&#39;ve ever had at The Factory has tickled my tastebuds in all the right ways--appetizers, entres, desserts, drinks. I&#39;d probably eat here once a week if I could afford it! Remember to get validation when you park in the garage! I&#39;d give them six stars if I could.

I usually don&#39;t have a problem with Cheesecake Factory, as I love the food. However this time I came during dinner, and was given a buzzer that would alert me when there is a table available. After 30 mins, my buzzer alerted me. I went back in and was called to wait in the area to be seated. However, after waiting for 20 minutes they still haven&#39;t called my name. I talked to the desk and asked them why I haven&#39;t been called. They disregarded my question and only responded to me minutes after. After checking, they told me they had called my name previously. I was certain they hadn&#39;t as I was right by the desk. They blamed me after so I was not happy! <br><br>However, the food was good as usual. I love the avocado roll starter, especially the dip (My favourite appetiser!) I also love the bread they give you once you sit down. I would definitely recommend coming for the food if you&#39;re ready to spend around 50 for an appetiser, 2 entrees and a cheesecake! (The cheesecakes are my favourite). Just make sure that you come earlier to get a table, and make sure the people at the front desk don&#39;t accidentally skip your name and make you wait for 20 more minutes!

I absolutely love cheesecake factory! My bad review is for their reservation process! This is the 2nd time they have messed up our reservation. We always call a week ahead bc its usually for a special occasion, and they we had 8 people on the reservation. They told my husband that he had to make 2 separate reservations with 4 per table and they would sit us all together when we got there. The day of our reservation they called to ask us why we had 2 separate reservations....my husband told her that its what he was told to do. She basically said he was lying . That is super unprofessional. They need to figure out their reservation system. Its kind of a joke!

The last few times that we have eaten here have not been awesome.  The food was just so so and I have ended up with a stomach ache after. BUT this time was delicious!  Everything we ordered was fantastic!  And our waiter was fast and very attentive.   I think I&#39;ll give this location another shot after this visit.

Oh Cheesecake factory, what a place. I can never decide exactly how much and to what extent I like the cheesecake factory. I&#39;ve determined that it&#39;s a jack of all foods but master of none. Our waiter was super super nice and thoughtful and really helped us enjoy our time there, also the barrista who helped me get my cheesecake, Lindsey Shrum, was also very thoughtful and sweet and you could tell how hard she was working. I honestly love the vibe of the cheesecake factory but I just feel like the food just isn&#39;t up to par with the ambiance. Most of the food here is pretty good but not great and the presentation is usually pretty mediocre. This time around I ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes, a side of potatoes and some orange juice. The pancakes were actually very filling and pretty delicious, the potatoes were pretty normal compared to everywhere else, and I really appreciated that the orange juice was freshly squeezed. I feel like if the cheesecake factory could pick one type of food they would do it very well but since they do soo many kinds only a few of their plates actually end up tasting and looking to the level they seem to want to cater too.

I&#39;ve visited this cheesecake factory twice now. Both times the staff has been prompt, accommodating, and friendly. The food has been delicious and the cheesecake is out of this world. I&#39;ll be back for sure.

Came here for my birthday Saturday evening. Was told we cannot have more than 6 per table due to COVID. So we split our groups into two, tables were far apart. As we sat down, a table of 11 were sat right in front of us. Pretty odd. Either they were not following healthcare guidelines or we were not being told the truth. Our server was barely around. We were there for an hour and a half &amp; rushed eating our food because we had plans afterwards. All 12 of us were not happy with the experience. Probably will never go there again.

My only issue with this particular Cheesecake Factory location is the attitude of the girls at the check-in desk. They treat entry to Cheesecake Factory like you are trying to get walk-in reservations at Atera or Sushi Ginza in NYC. I get better customer service browsing at Louis Vuitton.<br><br>Every single time I try to get a seat they are uninterested and rude. They are usually pre-occupied talking about each other&#39;s drama or on their personal phones instead of helping customers. Asking for a parking validation is like you are taking it from their personal stash. Major attitude adjustment needs to happen.

This is a beautiful location. My favorite dessert is cheesecake so I will never have a bad word to say about The Cheesecake Factory (God forbid).  I had the crab and artichoke dip. It was good but next time I think I would request it be served with the soft pretzel rather than the French bread slices as they were a bit tough.  I also had the egg roll sampler. It&#39;s plentiful and diverse. My favorite is the southwest one with the green dipping sauce. I apologize for not knowing its proper name but if it helps, it has a sweet tang to it.

I realize that with the Covid restructuring you can expect a little bit of a difference but this was extremely unexpected....this is my favorite place and I haven&#39;t gotten to go in almost a year at this point...drove 45min down there to meet a couple friends. We ordered our food, their appetizers came quickly and then our food took almost 45min to come out after that. The bread was stale, my food was so cold it felt like it was in the refrigerator and the sauce I was served with the lettuce wraps was not the chili sauce at all it was a watery teriyaki sauce! my friends basket was burning hot on one side and cold on the other...unfortunately it was the cold food side that was hot &amp; the hot food side that was cold. I couldn&#39;t have been more disappointed with this place and will not make the effort to return. The only saving grace was the pumpkin pecan cheesecake, it was delicious.

This restaurants deserves a 2. It is modeled to be a 2. Cheesecake Factory is not a bad option, but it&#39;s not a great option. The food is mediocre, the ambiance is mediocre, the cheesecakes are delicious, but not enough to make up for the food. <br><br>My wife orders the same meal every time and I&#39;m tempted to ordering it as well. It&#39;s the only thing that I&#39;ve had that I could see myself ordering again. The chicken bellagio. The meat is actually fried really nicely, with a tasty arugula salad with prosciutto, on top of a bed of noodles with pesto. It&#39;s simple and good, all the ingredients work. I&#39;ve tried a multitude of players at CF, I&#39;ve friend bang-bang chicken, I&#39;ve tried multiple salmon dishes, chicken piccata, burgers, and pastas. At the end of the day I&#39;m disappointed by the food I&#39;ve gotten. The sauce of the chicken piccata was the worst, it tasted like mayonnaise. <br><br>The things that save this meal were the appetizers, the great service (even on a holiday) and the cheesecakes. We ordered the fried Mac and cheese balls and they were delicious. We ordered the chocolate hazelnut cheesecake, and the mango key lime cheesecake. They were really good.<br><br>I know it&#39;s not going to happen but I actually think the Cheesecake Factory could be a great franchise if they removed 175 items from their menu. The menus is over 20 pages and there are over 250 items. Slim the menu down and focus your food.

The food was fine and the waitress we had was great.<br>The hostess or whatever her job is at the front was very disrespectful and bitchy. <br>She had told us it would be a 30-45 minute wait and that time passed. We went to check &amp; we weren&#39;t even rude or upset or anything- but she gave the ugliest look and with so much attitude said &#34;I told you 45 min TO AN HOUR!&#34;<br>Well, you obviously don&#39;t need us to come back. <br>La comida estaba bien y la camarera que tuvimos fue genial.<br> La anfitriona o lo que sea su posicion en el frente fue muy irrespetuosa y malintencionada.<br> Ella nos había dicho que sería una espera de 30-45 minutos y ese tiempo pasó.  Fuimos a ver y no estábamos ni rudos ni molestos ni nada, pero ella nos dio la mirada más fea y con tanta actitud dijo: &#34;¡Te dije 45 min A UNA HORA!&#34;<br> Bueno, obviamente no necesitas que volvamos.

Cheesecake factory is located at the City Creek  center.  <br><br>We walked in there was a 25 min wait for a table but open seating at a bar. <br><br>Of course we sat at the bar :-)<br><br>Bartender Devin was very nice and efficient    great customer service<br><br>We ordered the breakfast burrito as usual the portion  was huge.  Thank baby jesus we shared it unfortunately neither one of us were able to finish our portion<br><br>Cheese Cake factory delivered as usual

My go to for any gathering, date night, or just after a day shopping. Everything you are craving could be satisfied within the menu. Healthy options as well. Of course the cheesecake never disappoints!!

Not Impressed from the first part of house i see very poor Hostes Customer Services  the service was good but also should have checked to make sure the silver ware flatware i got was not filty like it was so did have to flag someoen else down for new flateware  the flatbread pizza i had was hit or missed like every other slice had mozeralla and basil on it sorry but that is something that each cut should have one of each on it not every other  the host didnt even seat me just said down that way is a open table lol
Cheescake was a little dry but other than that everything was perfect. Y&#39;all gotta order rice cheescake, it&#39;s the best

This place is pretty straightforward good food, however, every time I come here, I leave feeling like its never worth the way too long wait. They really need to do something to remedy the 1-2 hour, plus, wait every single evening. More often than not, we attempt to eat here, change our minds because of the long wait, and end up finding a better, yummier, less crowded restaurant. Though, if you&#39;re down for the wait and really need that cheesecake, this is the place for you.

Good thing we have kids that like Cheesecake Factory. Good thing said kids don&#39;t have to pay at Cheesecake Factory. Otherwise I could never justify paying such inflated prices for what they offer. This location is nice and all but can&#39;t get past the crazy prices they charge.<br><br>I guess the fact that we keep going back and paying for their food means they&#39;ve got us (and others) figures out.

This is seriously the BEST restaurant ever! If you haven&#39;t been to a Cheesecake Factory before you are truly missing out! This places menu is so huge, so before you come in, come in with a mindset to be decisive otherwise you&#39;ll spend too much time going through this! I&#39;ve tried so many different things here, I&#39;ve never had a bad dish!

Considering the week I visited it was Young Living Convention week in Salt Lake City and there was about an extra 35-40k people in the area. They were very helpful with wait times and the big party we had. The service was was slow at times but completely understandable due to the crowds there at the time.

We came midday for a slice of cheesecake. The slices are a decent portion size and over 1,000 calories each, so we ate half and took the rest home for later.<br><br>Tried the low-carb cheesecake with fresh strawberries... blesch. Cheesecake isn&#39;t a low-cal food, so either don&#39;t eat it or suck it up and get a regular because the low-carb I had was dumb and gritty. Not worth the saved calories/carbs.<br><br>The S&#39;Mores chocolate mousse middle is delightfully creamy and rich with flavors.<br><br>Check out the confetti slice! If you need cheering up, that one will do the trick!
Service always good. Food options endless, food quality was good. Got on list and was actually seated faster then told.

The male manager that night was a power tripping douche bag. Just trying to comply with their stupid rules for the bf&#39;s bday party and he too busy threatening to cancel our rezzie because my ridiculous mask was moving while we were talking. Chill dude. Food was fair as usual, our server worked hard but I&#39;ll likely never go there again if I can help it.
Amazing food!!! Keep going back to this place tho the line is normally crazy and we always have to wait to get in.

Everytime I go to the cheesecake factory I always plan or waiting to get seated. For a Friday night that was just what I did. And that was totally fine. And the menu is always overwhelming. But everything is usually great. But tonight...<br>Slow slow service. I got the lasagna verde and it tasted microwaved, my husband got the orange chicken and it was AMAZING and of course the cheese cheese is always great. The bread was never refilled  and was slow to refill our drinks.

Cheesecake Factory, a solid place to go when you&#39;re either 1. in the mood for cheesecake, 2. it&#39;s Sunday in SLC, or 3. you&#39;ve got a big group and want lots of options.<br>Kind of pricey.<br>They have good bread. Had the Chicken Bellagio recommended by the server, great dish, but if you&#39;re looking for something with big flavor, you might wanna try something else. My sister goes here a lot and gets the Grilled Steak Medallions.<br>There&#39;s so many options for cheesecake it&#39;s beautiful. Out of the ones I&#39;ve tried, Mango Key Lime is a consistent winner. Fresh Banana Cream Cheesecake is probably a close 2nd. Oreo cheesecake is good too, but I&#39;m a sucker for anything with Oreos.

Stopped in here yesterday with family.  Was not disappointed .Went to Cheesecake Factory all the time in California and this is the first since I moved to Utah.<br>Service was great and food delicious as always. I had the chicken lemon piccata, my favorite! Family had a lunch salad (ha ha, it was huge!) and spaghetti and meatballs.  We all loved our meals and had to take some of it home as it was more than we could all eat<br>Wish this restaurant was closer, like Farmington or Ogden.

Amazing service employees go out of their way to serve you. The wait for food is long however the quality of the food outweighs the wait time.<br><br>Our waitress was amazing and helpful the menu items were amazing the restrooms were clean and well maintained.<br><br>Overall from start to finish was flawless and amazing.

Don&#39;t try to go for a special occasion.<br>They ONLY take reservations for 6 or less, WHAT???<br>I made a reservation for 8 people on Yelp, a week prior to my daughters 16th birthday. <br>The morning of, they text and say they cannot honor it. More than 6 people.<br>Its too HARD to move a table to accommodate 8 people. <br>TERRIBLE policy, DUMB policy. <br>They just like for their customers to WAIT.

December 24 2017 Sunday - 3:45 PM for Linner (Late Lunch and Early Dinner together)<br><br>3 Adults and a teenager<br><br>Atmosphere - 4 stars<br>Food - 4 stars<br>Service - 5 stars<br><br>Background - The plan was to shop for board games at the shopping center and find dinner.  Well the shopping center was closed so we went to dinner early.<br><br>Atmosphere - A very grand looking Cheese Cake Factory<br><br>Food<br>  Drink - I had the Uinta Cutthroat Pale Ale.<br><br>  Appetizer - Avocado egg rolls, they were tasty.<br><br>  Linner - Stuffed chicken tortilla, my basically said it was enchilada without the sauce.  The meal also came with two corn cakes and black beans.  The black beans were a miss for me.  Loved the corn cakes but they were small, could have had four of them.<br><br>Service - On point.  My garage parking ticket was validated at the hostess station as I left.  The garage gate was open so I did not need worry about it.<br><br>Future - Sure.

The service is always great here but the wait is not. I&#39;m pretty boring and get the same plates every single time. The menu overwhelms me a bit, so it makes it easy and I&#39;m never disappointed. If you haven&#39;t tried their Avacado Eggrolls you have not lived! Their Pumpernickel bread is to die for! My meal is one of the best salads I&#39;ve ever had, The BBQ Ranch Chicken Salad and its huge! For a cocktail the Pineapple mojito!

Update: decided to give them a second chance for my birthday, and it official, we won&#39;t be going back. I ordered the Thai lettuce wraps and all the lettuce was browning. They barely put any sides. Maybe three little pieces of pickled cucumber. My daughters spaghetti was SO spicy. Even for us adults. And the piece of cheesecake was TINY. We ordered it for pickup so there was no getting them swapped out. We&#39;re done with this place. I&#39;m so sad. It used to be awesome, I don&#39;t know what happened. <br><br>Food was amazing as always, even though the place was packed, the wait wasn&#39;t bad at all. The reason for the low rating is for two reasons. Our waiter WAS SO SLOW. And just didn&#39;t seem to care about his job. He didn&#39;t write our order down which is fine, except he got it wrong. And my husband spent half the time picking onions off his tacos. We didn&#39;t want to send it back because we didn&#39;t want to wait another half hour on our food. We also didn&#39;t get our bread, that we asked for several times, until after our food came. Also, the restrooms were FILTHY. And they didn&#39;t give an option for paper towels, just the gross Dyson hand dryers which breed bacteria. I think this is the last trip to this location.

The wait was 45 minutes to get a table but Holly and Jessie were set on dinner at The Cheesecake factory so we waited. 30 minutes later we were seated. <br>I split the Madeira chicken and shrimp scampi combo with my daughter Becca and it was fantastic. <br>The bread was also delicious. <br>Our server was prompt and attentive. <br>I will be back.

I hate to give way any of my trade secrets, but I will because I love The Cheesecake Factory significantly more than the masses, and I think Yelper criticism stems mostly from the long waits. <br><br>Here it goes: If you want to go to The Factory, and don&#39;t want the lines you&#39;ll often find, come for Sunday Brunch. We arrived today around 10:30 a.m., were greeted by a near-empty parking lot and a zero minute wait. That&#39;s right, all the yummy CF offerings, none of the crowds or noise.  <br><br>To me, The Cheesecake Factory is the only national chain that is a Jack of All Trades, Master of ... All Trades. <br><br>They make great Saturday and Sunday Brunch-specific meals. I love the Green Chilaquiles with carnitas, slow-cooked pork (you can also choose chicken), roasted Poblanos, cilantro, tomatillo chile sauce, sour cream, cheese, onions, and corn tortillas. Their Monte Cristo is amazing .. the Monte Cristo is my favorite sandwich and only a few places in town make it right. The Factory&#39;s is my favorite. And the Fried Chicken and Waffles Benedict ... a Factory original mashup of poached and Hollandaise-covered poached eggs with deep-fried chicken strops on top of a Belgian Waffle. And their maple-butter syrup ... man, I could drink this glorious stuff.  <br><br>On our most recent brunch, we cheated a bit and ate off of their lunch menu. We started with the Egg Roll Sampler: Crispy Cuban (AMAZING, my favorite!), Firecracker Salmon, Tex-Mex, and Avocado. They make epically good egg rolls.  <br><br>For the main course, I got the Crispy Pineapple Chicken and Shrimp. It&#39;s a little sweet, a little savory, and a lot of yummy. My wife got the Chicken Parmesan &#34;Pizza Style&#34;: Breaded chicken covered with marinara and cheese; it has a big serving of angel-hair pasta with creamy Alfredo sauce.  Both are awesome, but my wife&#39;s Parm has the advantage of being real filling ... the lucky girl gets another meal out of it.  <br><br>Oh, yeah, they make cheesecake! Faves are a matter of personal taste, but I&#39;ve never had one that is meh or bad. I love them all, but the ones that have a special place in my heart are Adam&#39;s Peanut Butter Cup Fudge Ripple, Reece&#39;s Peanut Butter Chocolate, Craig&#39;s Crazy Carrot Cake, Tiramisu, and Peppermint Bark. <br><br>Again, go for Sunday Brunch ... a relaxing way to enjoy The Factory.

At 3pm I tried to make a reservation for 7 people for Friday night at 6pm. I understand that is the prime time for people to go out. They told us it would be a 4 hour wait until they could get us in after 6pm which is basically closing time! It was for a big graduation celebration, so disappointing ):

I know the covid-19 craziness has changed how restaurants have handled things, but tonight was far less organized than a month ago when we came last time. <br><br>Previously we called and had food brought out to the car, and it was a smooth process. Tonight was a joke! The line was backed up out the door and around the corner, mixing door dash pickups with online/call in orders. We waited a half hour past our promised pick up time and finally got our food. <br><br>This location does not have the capacity outside to handle this many cars, and the pickup was understaffed and chaotic.

So me and my hubby made a reservation at 7:30. We get there and check in and the receptionist says it&#39;ll be a 5-10 minute wait and theyll text us when theyre ready.. So we&#39;re like cool. Then 30 mins go by and  we figured it got super busy or whatever. Then and hour goes by and we are tired af. Whats the point of making a reservation if you&#39;re going to wait that long. So i go insjde and speak to the front desk lady and she says she thought she ping&#39;ed everyone and somehow our message didnt go through  oh and also by this time it was about 8:40pm and they close at 9pm. We felt super rushed to leave and our waiter brought us cocktail menu&#39;s and then when we were going to order a cocktail it was too late to do so.. just not a good experience all around. ‍‍definitely the food was not worth the bloody hour and half wait...

This location was pretty good, but not perfect. <br><br>When we entered the restaurant the dessert line and the line to be seat down meshed. The lines were indistinguishable from one another. Many customers were confused where to stand, and there were A LOT of people. The entrance was cluttered. I suggest roping the lines and putting up some signs, so people know where to go. <br><br>It took us five minutes to be seated. I had a party of 3. It was late on a Saturday night. We ordered the veggie burger, impossible burger, and old-fashioned burger. The veggie burger and impossible burger were not in stock, which is ridiculous. In fact, MOST of the burgers were out of stock. I understand that the weekends are extremely busy for this restaurant, but whoever orders the ingredients should already know that and should plan ahead. <br><br>So we ordered different burgers. While we were waiting, we were given French rolls/bread that were tasty. The meat from our burgers was tender but cooked thoroughly; We ordered the meat to be well cooked.  It wasn&#39;t over cooked. The bread of the burgers was soft but didn&#39;t fall apart. The salad that came with our burgers was fresh. Everything was fresh and made well. <br><br>Our waitress was incredibly sweet. I can&#39;t remember her name, but she was kind! I gave her a $20 tip.
They said they accidentally forgot about our reservation. We waited an extra hour to be seated.

This used to be my go-to place to eat. I came here a few nights ago for my anniversary, I order a gluten free burger and specified twice very politely that it really needed to be gluten free (bc they had messed up the last two times I came in). The gentleman brings out my death burger so I asked if it was gf and he said no can&#39;t you just take the bun off?.. So as usual they offered me their gross side salad. Then to really top it off we found a baby cockroach on our table. <br><br>p.s they used to have a GF coffee and cream cheesecake but now they only have one and it&#39;s way too chocolatey to me.

I just got to this place. So far I&#39;ve been met by some of the most rude, arrogant hostesses ever. I&#39;m really not sure if they actually want business because they are so full of themselves. &#34;We are only seating parties no larger than 5 people&#34;. Hmmm seems quite discriminatory on the surface for any family larger than 5. They then tell you it will be even longer if you divide into groups. They were surprised when I took their tracking device. It was almost as if they expected their discriminatory practices to deter me from eating at their restaurant. I hope the food somehow makes up for the sheer rude, discriminatory behavior. I doubt that it will though. These kind of behaviors leave the door wide open for competitors to offer a superior product and service. I for one hope that the Cheesecake Factory has their a** handed to them on a silver platter.
Omg. My kids just waited over 2 hours to pickup their take out order and even thought they had a confirmation they didn&#39;t have their order <br>DO NOT ORDER FROM THIS PLACE

They have great cheesecake and lemon drops.  The entrees are over-priced.  Service was a little slow.  No reservations.  I would go here a hundreds times for cheesecake and lemon drops but eat dinner somewhere else.  Parking was a nightmare.
Their Shepard&#39;s pie is the best! I ordered through DoorDash and I had my food within 30 mins and it was so good and still warm to eat!!

The wait time is absolutely ridiculous. We were here for 3 hours. Yes three hours before a show. We came 3 hours early so we would have time to eat. Each time we approached the front desk they increased the time by another 20 minutes. We had to order their soups which took another 15 minutes to get to us. I doubt we will ever go back.

I love the Cheesecake Factory! We made a reservation and only had to wait like 10 minutes which was awesome. The only negative things is all of the portions were smaller including our appetizer. With our meals being on the more expensive side you just expect the portions will stay the same. Still delicious though and the cheesecake is always perfect!

Doesn&#39;t everyone love Cheesecake Factory? Besides the wait, the food is always worth it. Quick tip is to hit up the bar area if you don&#39;t want to wait and have a smaller party. For starters, the brown bread is insane. For meals, we&#39;ve tried so many and never really been disappointed. The flatbread pizza (with honey) is good! Chicken costeletta and four cheese ravioli are some of our go tos. Lettuce wraps, and pot stickers are great appetizers and I&#39;m not a fan of cheesecake so I typically skip on the dessert, which is fine because I&#39;m stuffed by that point anyways!

I&#39;ve only been to a cheesecake factory twice.  The menu was very daunting the first time and I felt intimidated. I also felt the portions were so huge.  I came back with my in-laws while we were waiting to take them to the airport.  There were 7 of us and we were seated pretty fast, less than ten minutes.  Everyone enjoyed their food and the service was great.  I will say that I&#39;m giving only 4 stars because at the end of my sister in laws sandwich was a hair.  It happens and she was basically done so it wasn&#39;t a huge deal, but still not great to find in the middle of your sandwich.  My husband loved his kale and salmon salad, ate the whole bowl! I got the farfalle pasta with chicken and roasted garlic.  I thought it had great flavor and I loved the peas and carmelized onions so much.  The pancetta and tomatoes were also nice.  I wasn&#39;t a fan of the mushrooms, but I have a hard time with mushroom texture and the pieces were big.  I just picked around them so no big deal.  I loved that I could get a lunch size, even with that size I couldn&#39;t finish it all so I have some nice leftovers.  I do wish they allowed for a half/lunch portion available always because even though it was smaller it still was a lot and much more manageable for me and it left no room for cheesecake.  I felt the wine menu was decent.  We will definitely check this place out again.  I wanna try the brussel sprouts because the description sounded scrumptious! Just know that this place seems pretty popular and there were tons of people dining and waiting.  It was kinda hard to leave the restaurant. I still think it&#39;s worth the crowd

Great atmosphere but a little loud when busy. Almost endless choices on the menu! Really busy when concert or event at Galavan center! Tons of kinds of cheesecakes, deserts, and drinks! Must come at least once, then your hooked.
If the bathroom is any indication of what&#39;s in their kitchen then run! One word FILTHY, two words F*Cken Filthy!
Always great food.  If it&#39;s not right, they will make it right.  Great customer service.  Try the Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp - Incredible!

It was easy and convenient to make a reservation online.  Once we arrived, we were greeted and given a virtual copy of the menu to look over while we waited.  When our table was ready, we received a text and enjoyed an absolutely amazing meal.   I wish everything was this easy!
When i moved here in utah from california, I was happy to find out that there is a cheesecake factory near at my place. Same menu.

The cheesecake here is of course, unbeatable.  But the food is much too overpriced for the quality.  Had a burger here recently and I&#39;ve had better burgers at a fast food joint.   Clever plating can&#39;t compensate for a thick, juicy burger that&#39;s seasoned well, with fresh pickles and onions and sauces.   The fries were also &#39;cute&#39;, but boring.

We had a wonderful lunch, best one so far in Salt Lake.  Agent 940 took great care of us.  The Avocado and Chicken salad was wonderful, shared the lunch serving with the Combination pizza.  Should have ordered the lunch size, ended up with 1/2 to go.<br><br>Staff was welcoming and friendly.
I always take my family from out of town. My go to order is the Falafel Salad and lemonchello cake.

Worst experience at a Cheesecake Factory ever.  Waited over and hour to be seated, went through 4 items on the menu that were all sold out until we found one, food took almost an hour and it was cold.  Never again.  Avoid this one.

the cheesecake factory is one of the better chain restaurants out there and has been one of those places that I&#39;ve been going too since I was a kid. i&#39;ve been to multiple locations in multiple states, and the food is always consistently good, and the cheesecake here can&#39;t really be matched anywhere else. <br><br>we ate here last night for dinner with a group of 9, one of the only downsides to this place is the long waits. my friend who works across the street arrived at 8 and was told that it was anywhere from 30 minutes to an hour of a wait. the rest of our group arrived at 8:30, we waited outside until 9 then were finally called in. we ordered fairly quick, but we didn&#39;t get our food until 9:45, everyone was starving at that point so everyone at pretty quick and ate nearly everything. <br><br>i ordered the shrimp bistro pasta which included battered shrimp, mushroom, arugula, and spaghetti noodles in a butter cream lemon sauce. it was tasty, but definitely not the best thing I&#39;ve tried here. my husband ordered the jambalaya shrimp pasta and said it was just alright, it wasn&#39;t as spicy as he&#39;d hoped. we split the celebration cheesecake for desert, it was good but didn&#39;t really taste like a cheesecake, more like a boujee birthday cake. <br><br>overall, I&#39;ve never been disappointed in a meal here, it can get pricy pretty quick, but it&#39;s usually worth it more times than not!

I went here for my birthday for some family nostalgia. The employees are helpful and happy. Lighting is dim and annoying at times but you get over it once you try the food. Mock tails for kids and cocktails for adults. Great service great food endless menu. Love this place. Would come again.
No words can really describe what my wife went through. We were lied to over and over about being seated and then once we were seated our food was cold and had hair in it. <br><br>Very disappointing!

Tried to get a reservation and called them. The girl had no comprehension of what I was asking. I told her 4 adults and 5 children. Said it couldn&#39;t be done. Tried to do it on line. Said only up to 6. So we went there to split up our tables and then they said &#34; oh we can sit up to 10!&#34;  What the hell!!!! Then say it is a 3-4 hour wait!!!!! When I called in the first place they couldn&#39;t sit us and only a half hour to hour wait. I have worked in the restaurant business and I will tell you .... that is NOT how you treat customers. You try to accommodate. And not sound stupid!!!! They just lost a huge party that was gonna spend a lot of money!!!

Amazing service. Great food. Took my fiance their as a birthday lunch. Made reservations on Monday December 30, yelp was excellent at reminding me about the reservations. The server we had was beyond amazing, our drinks were never empty, she was great friendly aand attentive.

Back at it again with 5 stars. I love this place. I go pretty often and it&#39;s just one of my favorite restaurants I can say. Yesterday I went with my brother and aunt. The service was quick, considering a Tuesday night at 6. It was awesome we were seated quickly and our waiter was so amazing. I can never complain about the service. <br>Now for food, I have to first mention... I LOVE THE BREAD here ! Like ugh, yesterday it came out so fresh and warm. I always want to eat like 5 loafs but the portions here at the Cheesecake Factory are huge so if I ever ate that much bread, I can forget about the entree lol. Now onto the real stuff. <br><br>My brother got the lemon chicken I believe. The portions came out nice with potatoes and a side of veggies. His chicken looked great. He told me that it&#39;s a great burst of flavor in every bite. So if you&#39;re a chicken lover. This would be a good choice, as long as you like lemon too. <br><br>My aunt got the pasta carbonara, but with shrimp instead of chicken. She really enjoyed it. Finished the whole thing faster than me and my brother eating. She said it was flavorful and the amount of food was more than enough. <br>If you love pasta, this is a good one to try. <br><br>I got the skinnylicious enchilada. Which I&#39;ve had before, and I love. It&#39;s low in calories but tastes just as great. The side salad it comes with is just wonderful. I absolutely love the cheese and the amount of chicken they place in each one. I think it&#39;s a good healthy dinner if you&#39;re not looking for a basic salad. It&#39;s a must try. <br><br>We didn&#39;t try cheesecake but I&#39;ll have to next time cause it looks so great! I&#39;ll be back again !

I drove out from Ogden to Cheesecake Factory for my Birthday... I made an appointment for 7:30 and called when I was getting off the freeway saying I was going to be 5 minutes late. The lady told me I could be 5 minutes late and be okay... I show up at 7:35 EXACTLY. They told me it was too late and it would be 1 hour and 30 minutes to get a table AT LEAST. I find it hard to believe that being there right at 7:35 would inconvenience anyone working there or anyone waiting for a table. ESPECIALLY if the wait was an hour and 30 minutes. Way to be Cheesecake... thanks for being understanding.

The Cheesecake Factory at City Creek is hectic with lots of people everywhere. We had to wait 70 minutes for a table. You can technically walk around while you wait, but that&#39;s still a long time. Besides the wait time, the food is good. There are plenty of food options. It definitely caters to every taste bud. My favorite dish would be the Miso Salmon. Any of their cocktail drinks are tasty too. I like their food, but for how overwhelming and popular it is it&#39;s something I wouldn&#39;t choose myself. I go anytime a friend or family chooses the restaurant for their birthday. Their prices are on the higher side as well. I always spend about $35+ by myself. Special occasions only for me due to overall experience.

The Cheesecake Factory is a great place to go for dinner lunch or simply a snack. The wide variety of different foods on their menu shows how pleasant and enjoyable  your visit can be. The service is fast and the host is very quick to make sure you are seated promptly.
Nothing special!  The wait is disgustingly way too long in Utah.  Not impressed one bit.

Wasn&#39;t too happy to come in and find out there was no complementary bread. The Cheesecake is so famous for that wonder bread they serve while customers wait for their main meal and sadly management did absolutely nothing to compensate nor replace it.

We heard all the hype, but it didn&#39;t live up to it. My wife had the chicken tacos - they were good but the accompanying rice and beans were flavorless. I ordered the famous meatloaf - the meatloaf was burned on one side (you guessed it, the side that was down) and I couldn&#39;t taste anything but char. On the bright side, the mashed potatoes were delicious. The corn was terrible though. I sent back my order. When my wife was done eating and I still didn&#39;t have my food, I told them to cancel the order. At that point, I would have assumed the meal might have been comp&#39;d - wrong. I was offered a free piece of cheesecake. So, ~$24 after arriving, my wife had some good tacos. Very unlikely to return. JC

its been a year or so since we&#39;ve eaten here and we felt like it was a completely different restaurant and experience. The quality that the restaurant used to have just isn&#39;t there and it makes you wonder how they&#39;re staying in business. Definitely won&#39;t be returning. Why? Who wants *brown* avocado egg rolls? The chicken costaletta looked so sad and boring and it tasted the same. The chicken was rubbery and there was very little sauce that used to punch. Oddly, the only thing that was savory of this whole meal was the mashed potatoes. <br>the service was fine, ambiance was typical...the food just sucked and unfortunately we&#39;ll be letting others know to spend their $100 for night out elsewhere.

We showed up for dinner and were seated quickly but sat for 15 minutes and no one came to our table. We got up to alert a bus boy to help us and then the waitress showed up. We ordered water and a drink. Then waited 5 more minutes and no one came back. Then the waitress came to the table behind us with a piece of cake but did not even bring our water or drinks. At this point we got up and walked to the hostess stand told the manager who expressed no concern and no apology.  We went to Tuscan Brio.  Now enjoying a fabulous meal.  I still like cheese cake factory and go to the one near me in California. It&#39;s now September so I&#39;m moving the starts up to 3.
This place is one of our favorites to eat! I am not a fan of pineapple, but the pineapple upside down cheesecake is to die for! Amazing food, amazing service, you really can&#39;t go wrong here.

Food was okay. Service on the other hand was seriously lacking. Dylan, our server, practically ignored us almost the entire time. Our drinks sat empty more than 3/4 of the time we were there, to the point we repeatedly had to ask for the one refill we got. And then when he actually did bother to come by he was obviously not paying attention, my husbands salad was wrong, my sons drink was wrong and when we asked him to a switch it, he said he would have to charge us. God only knows what kind of sauce he brought with the cheesecake we got to go, it definitely wasn&#39;t the strawberry sauce it was supposed to be. My steak was undercooked. It was a huge disappointment and honestly quite ridiculous. We typically go to the fashion place location and absolutely will go out of our way to go there rather than the city creek one from now on. Even though he was one of the worst servers I&#39;ve had, anywhere, we still tipped him almost 15%, as he grabbed the check he dramatically shook his head and was obviously annoyed with what he got, well bud, if you want a better tip, DO YOUR JOB BETTER.

Thoroughly disappointed with my take out order - Ordered a $19 salad and they forgot the avocado and the lettuce was browning. The 1 piece of bread they provided was rock hard and inedible. Completely unacceptable from a restaurant that charges so much.

Extensive menu. Friendly staff. Highly recommend the miso salmon! Very busy in the afternoon. Bar seats are usually available. They also have tables in the bar area. Usually no waiting for the bar area seating.

Big fan of this place, and only giving 4-stars due to the quality of some of the food. Most of their stuff is great, with phenomenal service.<br><br>Can sometimes suffer from long wait times and terrible parking being right in the middle of Fashion Place. Overall, it is a really great experience that could use some tweeks.

It was an amazing place to eat. The service was amazing. My water was never empty, so that was nice. The cheesecake was absolutely amazing. I had a great sandwich, it was probably one of the best I&#39;ve ever had. Well worth your money. And if I could suggest a cheesecake I suggest The Salted Caramel. It&#39;s a classic.

I was in SLC and decided to eat at this cheesecake factory yesterday. I was very disappointed.  I ordered a Greek salad and the Brussel sprouts off of the small plates menu. The waitress returned to let me know that they were out of the brussels sprouts, so I ordered the Nashville hot chicken from the same menu. The waitress returned again to let me know they were out of that also. By this time I was so frustrated, I just had the salad. When the salad came I opened my silverware that had been wrapped up in the napkin. I was disappointed to see that the knife was dirty. But I&#39;m not the type to freak out over small things, so I wiped it off really good with my napkin and began eating my salad. When I was almost to the bottom of the salad, I found a hair in it. In retrospect, I really should have complained to the manager, but I was in a hurry because I was about to be late for an appointment so I simply paid the bill and dashed off.
I really enjoy the food here!  Love the huge menue too. Service staff are nice

First timer here. There was a convention, so it took about an hour to be seated. The waiter introduced himself and brought us drinks and then said he would be back soon, 20 minutes later we ordered. We weren&#39;t too upset since he was super swamped running around helping his other customers. We ordered buffalo blasts, chicken Alfredo and the blackened salmon. The buffalo blasts were awesome, but the rest of the food was unfortunately not. My husband was told that they ran out of mashed potatoes and my chicken in the Alfredo was cold. Overall my experience was just ok. Disappointed that the quality of food, didn&#39;t match the high price they were charging. Total time at the restaurant was a little over 2.5 hours with the wait time for seating, ordering and receiving food. I would recommend the buffalo blasts though!
I used to love the aloha salad and they have completely removed it from their menu. Bring it back!!!!

My wife and I went to the Cheesecake Factory today. We were able to get a table in the bar area. However, my ID wasn&#39;t able to get scanned due to my dog biting it. They were nice enough to move us to another table without a hassle. I&#39;ll tell you the food was so good. I got the Mac and cheese burger and my wife got the avocado salad. Both really good. Burger so big I couldn&#39;t finish it. To top it off we got a key lime cheesecake. Did not disappoint.

We love the Cheesecake Factory! The SkinnyLicious menu is great! I got a shrimp dish and it was just the right amount. My husband always gets the Shepard&#39;s Pie &amp; it&#39;s the best! We each got a piece of cheesecake (of course)... I got the raspberry lemon cream cheesecake &amp; it was fabulous! My husband got the tiramisu &amp; it was also great!

Oh Cheesecake Factory...how wonderful your desserts are but your food is always surprising me every time. If you want a quick delicious dessert fix, this is the place to be. If you want to get it quickly...depending on the time and day you can be waiting for 45 mins for a seat or immediately seating...I don&#39;t think there was ever an in between for me. If you want just cheese cake I would recommend take out. The food court (or during nice days they set up chairs and tables outside) is near by so plenty of seating there and there isn&#39;t much of a wait for food court seating/out door seating.<br><br>My coworkers and I came here on a Friday afternoon and there wasn&#39;t many people, so we got seated immediately. I decided to go for something new and ordered the spicy cashew chicken. Boy was I wrong to do that. It was one of the saltiest dishes I have ever tasted. After two bites I was just over it and I couldn&#39;t eat any of the rice. The brown rice I got soaked up every bit of sauce. I felt like I was putting spoonful of salt in my mouth. I picked some of the proteins off that wasn&#39;t covered in the sauce. Good thing they kept refilling my cup of water cause I was really thirsty with the saltiness of the food. <br><br>Another great thing was the bread. Idk if I was just hungry cause all I could eat was two bites, but the chocolate looking bread was delicious. The other bread was just meh. The saltiness of the food and all the water I drank I didn&#39;t feel like ordering dessert.<br><br>I would totally recommend the desserts here, but do be careful on what you order cause of them are really rich and sweet. Food wise...it&#39;s Russian roulette. I had some that are good but a lot of them which horrifying. The staff here was friendly though...
Top notch. I highly recommend the steak diane or the chicken madiera.

I typically give Cheesecake 3 stars for the decent, high calorie food. However, this location deserves only 2 stars. I ordered a Mexican Tortilla salad from the Skinny menu. While the portion of the salad itself is huge like all Cheesecake portions, the amount of chicken was completely unproportional. There were 6-7 thinly slices of chicken breast. I was still hungry afterwards!<br><br>The restroom is also tiny compared to the size of the restaurant. There was a long line for the women&#39;s room.

Excellent food and service! We highly recommend you eat here while shopping in City Creek Mall. <br>Bread served first, a large list of wines and cocktails even skinny cocktails and we tried Mamosa and I tried skinny Long Island Ice Teas it was very good not too sweet. <br>For lunch-We shared two unique Appetizers;  Avocado Rolls and Chicken lettuce wraps both truly delicious!

I understand that Covid causes restaurants to be slow seating people... I was told 45 minutes to wait. It is now 2 hours. You are probably asking why we are waiting- it&#39;s my birthday, my 3 boys and husband are here with me &amp; they told us 45 minutes. We checked to make sure they had our right number. Yes! We checked to see if we are close.. cleaning your table right now. It has now been 30 minutes from that check-in. Be honest! Don&#39;t get our hopes up! We would&#39;ve left-- once we got in it took 25 minutes for our waiter to greet us and we had to ask for one. We had him take our order right when we got there. The bread took 20 minutes because they didn&#39;t have any ready. All the food was good, but we will never return. We all had empty cups for our whole meal. People go to eat for a relaxing experience, to celebrate an event or so they just don&#39;t have to cook.  it&#39;s sad this place has changed so much. If I could give it 0 stars I would.

I&#39;ve never had nothing but a good experience at Cheesecake Factory, but tonight made me bummed. I made reservations for mine and my husbands Valentine&#39;s date(to beat the rush of tomorrow) we were seated within 10 minutes. Our waitress didn&#39;t come for at least another 10, which seemed long. My husband ordered a soda which he didn&#39;t receive until later after he received his meal and when he reminded the waitress.. then I was told twice that the food item I wanted &#34;was all out&#34; so I settled with the Asian chicken salad. They brought our food out and I was brought the wrong salad. I get it was busy tonight and accidents happen, but we didn&#39;t receive any refills on our drinks, except for one on my water that she only filled halfway because the pitcher ran out and she never came back. It just sucks when you pick a place to have a fun night out and have a crappy experience at a restaurant that isn&#39;t the &#34;cheapest&#34; when it comes to dining out. Hopefully next time will be better.

Lots of negative reviews, we must have came on an off night. The server was awesome, so attentive, drinks, appetizers, meals all came out very fast and tasted delicious. We even got some cheese cake to go.<br><br>I think I like this location better then the one at Fashion Place mall.

The Cheesecake Factory is great. <br>Whether you&#39;ve been to one in another state or to this one, don&#39;t be fooled by the name! <br>This place has a huge menu, and no, it isn&#39;t all Cheesecake! <br><br>They offer about everything as well as vegan options and gluten free options. <br><br>Service is great and there buildings are always so fancy and nice inside you can go casual or dress up. It is a nice mix for whatever you are in the mood for. <br><br>They also have every option for Cheesecake nearly, so make sure you save some room for dessert! <br>The best part, of course!

I ordered Miso Salmon. I&#39;ve had it several times before and enjoyed it but this time it was way overdone and crusty. The rice was a big lump like it hadn&#39;t been drained. Service was good but a little slow.

We got cheesecake to go and we were highly disappointed with the portion size of the slice for the price.  They have really gotten small compared to years passed.  The taste was good but don&#39;t expect it to be the same sharable size it has been in the past.

We ate there for my mothers birthday last Thursday. Amazing food and the waiter was amazing. Went the extra mile on everything. They of course boxed our left overs, and they were great a second time. Great folks.

This week, two friends and I went to dinner at the Salt Lake City location.  They were both initially hesistant, because their prior experiences there were not great.   After a little persuasion, they agreed to give it another try.   <br><br>When we arrived we checked in and were told there would be a 15 minute wait.   After 30 minutes and seeing several parties who arrived after us get called, I decided to ask how close we were.  I was told they called us and would need to wait awhile longer since we had missed our chance.   I know this was not possible because we were literally at an arm&#39;s reach from the hostess table.   <br><br>Next after we we seated and taken back, they pushed two tables for single people together and we were seated.  By that time we were so hungry, all we cared about was getting bread.  When the waiter arrived we asked for a coke and some bread.  The second time he arrived we asked for bread again.  After he walked by the fourth time and would not acknowledge us, we asked a different waiter for bread, which was kindly brought to us in a minutes wait.   My friend, who was not a Yelper by any means,  was so frustrated that she CREATED a Yelp account with the sole purpose of writing a bad review.<br><br>Our waiter never acknowledged that we didn&#39;t get bread and when we asked him a fifth time he finally brought it out.   The rest of the night was mediocre.  I do love the food but the service was really not up to par.  I especially felt bad for vouching for the company and then to be disappointed and proven wrong.

The Cheesecake Factory seems to offer a premium dining experience. You&#39;d expect so after paying what you pay for what you eat. The food is great for the first couple of mouthfuls and then feels bland. The bread is incredible and the cheesecakes of course are famously good. I&#39;ve rarely had a good experience with the food and I&#39;ve never had a personable waiter/waitress.

I tried to call in an order yesterday, they were understaffed at the bakery and I was left on hold forever. I gave up and ordered onlIne, while on hold. When I arrived, I stood at the bakery while the hostess ignored me and a server waiting for a drink for her customer was textIng on her phone and completely ignored me. The girl working the bakery was clearly in need of additional help. The food was ready as ordered. I just can&#39;t with the milllenials and their lack of social skills. I won&#39;t be back.

I love Cheesecake Factory! The only reason I&#39;m giving it 4 stars is because when I was here a couple days ago our waitress was not very good. Every other time it&#39;s 5! Sometimes the wait is longer than other days but it&#39;s usually not very long. There is a car valet service right outside so we used that for the first time and it was very inexpensive. 5$ and we tipped a little on top of that. I usually get the four cheese pasta here &amp; I&#39;d recommend that to anyone who likes pasta and doesn&#39;t know what to get! I also get the caramel macchiato which sounds like an odd mix with pasta, but for me it works. Delicious food, moderately priced. Love this location!
Cheesecake Factory is a staple in my family!  We try to go there for most of our special events and even though it is a little expensive, we love the food and the time we spend there.

*******This is an update*******<br>The guys at the cheesecake got back to me and convinced me to give them another try.<br>Well, they managed to win me back!<br><br>Everything we ordered was amazing! Seriously, the best I have ever tasted there! The cook that prepared our meal is really talented. Even dishes we tried and loved before were even better!!!<br>The service itself was great too.<br><br>I must add that the guys at customer service asked me to ask for the manager when I&#39;m there, but since I wanted to try them again without favoritism, I didn&#39;t, so this experience is the same as every other person that was there on that day.<br><br>Definitely going to go there again!<br>Thank you for making things better.

Don&#39;t understand the low reviews. It&#39;s a chain and it&#39;s consistent. Can&#39;t ask for more. <br><br>Food: chicken, mango and avocado salad, kids pepperoni pizza and crispy pineapple chicken and shrimp. Original cheesecake. All tasty and delicious. <br><br>Service: busy as expected on a Saturday night, so the wait was 1 hour. No surprise there. Our waitress was great, very attentive and met expectations. <br><br>Location: at one end of the City Creek Mall near the food court bordering 100 S.

Jared M was  our server tonight, not only was he adorable, but he was very personable. I loved all of the gluten free options which I&#39;m not used to, so I asked him what he recommended. I have to say that was the best pasta I&#39;ve had that&#39;s gluten free! Thank you for having incredible servers and hostesses!

Terrible experience. Waited almost 15 minutes to even be greeted by the waitress. Mind you, we went last night and were immediately seated so I&#39;m not sure the exact issue. The server never apologized and had an attitude the whole time. We were literally nothing but nice as I used to serve and understand sometimes things happen. But she continued to honestly just suck. Checked up on us once. The bread she brought was one and half loafs (when it&#39;s usually 3).. and clearly old. The food was below average. Overall just sucked. We&#39;ve been to this location many times, we have a weird love for Cheesecake Factory but have always just sat in the bar. Honestly, I&#39;d pass on going to this location.

Have been here a few more times since the negative review I gave this location a few years back and the service has been great and food was good. My go to&#39;s are always the calamari appetizer &amp; thai lime coconut chicken :) Always satisfies my cravings. They also validate at the front so don&#39;t forget to get your ticket stamped.

I was really excited to try Slc Cheesecake Factory, however I was sadly disappointed. I ordered the shrimp pasta and was served a huge plate of sauceless pasta with 4 shrimp. The plate ran $20. Definitely could have gone anywhere else and got a tastier shrimp pasta for much less. Cheesecake is delicious. Only reason to eat here.

Warm, filling comfort food with a great ambience and very friendly staff. We got the Louisiana Chicken Pasta which is super filling and flavorful, as well as some tasty flatbread. Great for a special occasion!

The Cheesecake Factory&#39;s desserts are out of this world. But in the few dining experiences that I&#39;ve had a Cheesecake Factory your food is really overrated I&#39;m sorry to be so blunt but for what you get fed and what you charge for it, is very poor.<br>The service I had today in your restaurant was very good the appetizers were excellent the bread was great the cheesecakes wonderful of course. But then my entree comes and it was highly recommended the bang bang chicken and shrimp. Most of the flavors were there but I would think with the name bang bang they would be able to eat somewhere also the rice was like chewing up I knew it was maybe a little bit too much al dente he can&#39;t feed people that stuff the service I had today in your restaurant was very good the appetizers were excellent the bread was great the cheesecakes wonderful course. but then my e n t r e e came,  and it was highly recommended to bang bang chicken and shrimp. most of the flavors are there but I would think with the name Bang Bang the would be a little heat somewhere also the rice was like chewing up pine needles maybe a little bit too much Eldon. My hat is off which happens to be a chef hat that place filled up pretty fast today and your kitchen staff was probably slammed as well as your front of the house once again the service is great appetizers were wonderful you can&#39;t beat those but your food sucks do something about it
SAFE GLUTEN FREE FOOD! Like.. safe safe. This is definitely one of my favorites places to eat, great price for the quality and level of service!

I am a black doordash driver. Who felt like I was discriminated against when went to this  establishment. I have been to CCF 5 or 6 times to pick up deliveries and have never felt welcome. The CCF downtown SLC is one of those resturants as a Doordash driver you want to avoided at all cost. The food is never done on time and they don&#39;t have a place for DD drivers to sit, your just in a hallway close to the cooks and waiters, in the way. It is a very uncomfortable and unprofessional environment. <br> Knowing this location and Cheesecake Factorys&#39; in general take a long time to get orders out I waited for my pickup time that I was given by DD of 1108. I go to the top door to and to my surprise the door is locked. I go to the other door it is lock as well. I see a Latin lady looking at me from  inside CCF. I see a couple (a boyfriend and girlfriend or husband and wife) walking to the door I just walked to and walk away from it. (Like I&#39;m some sort of criminal)  The Latin lady sees the couple of people  walk past the door and doesn&#39;t tell them to open the door for me. She walks down opens the door and starts getting an attitude.  She said WE ARE CLOSED!!  I said, IM HERE FOR JOHN. DD pick up.  She said that I need to leave the establishment. I say why. Because your being rude. (I&#39;m in shock because she&#39;s the one who gave attitude first) I leave without the food.<br> I get on the phone with DD and let the know that the customers order isn&#39;t going to be pick up. I then call CCF and see if I can talk to the manager. To my surprise this Rude Lady is the manager. (It was like that pop copy skit from the Dave Chappelle show first season) She starts out telling me that she saw me at the first door, and that she came outside to let me in but that I had left. I counter that, by saying if that was true why wouldn&#39;t you say something to get my attention. She was stuck. I then say if you saw I was walking to the other door why wouldn&#39;t you go and open the other door where you saw I was headed. Or why didn&#39;t you tell that couple to open the door for me since you new what I was there for. She was speechless and just hung up the phone. <br> I truly feel like I wasn&#39;t treated right maybe because I&#39;m not white. Idk. But if she&#39;s the manager of CCF I would never dine with them.<br><br>I have come to the conclusion that doing CCF deliveries are a waste of me time and energy.

Just went to eat at the cheesecake factory and asked for a shot of vodka told him I had my own sugar-free flavored water I want to put in to , he told me it was illegal in Utah which is a lie I&#39;m a bar owner In Utah and I know better and were really rude about it I told him if it was his policy I could respect as a diabetic I suggest not eating at the cheesecake factory for many reasons John general manager was quite rude so we just left<br>Considering I&#39;ve been a good customer for many years we&#39;re going to have cocktails and appetizers and a main course to bad for them  They just lost me customer

Excellent service, I brought my one year old and our waiter served us a small plate of sliced bananas and some bread for him which was SO perfect!  Also, I tried their Vegan Cobb Salad and DIED!  It is so good and very filling. Perfect summer dish!

Great food, great service from the wait staff - Manager was passive aggressive.<br><br>My wife and I stopped by the Cheesecake Factory on 16DEC2016 at about 2pm for lunch at the City Creek Mall in SLC, Utah.<br><br>She had the chicken and couscous and i had the Kobe burger (which was outstanding).<br><br>Our server was knowledgeable and promptly answered our questions about the dishes we placed under consideration before we ordered, and when we did order - they were out in a very reasonable amount of time. I never had to ask for a drink refill: Be proactive on this servers, and you will be well compensated for your efforts.<br><br>During our meal, the manager came out to our table  and asked me if my 360 camera (that was mounted in a tripod and sitting on the table so I wouldn&#39;t kick or sit in it) was recording video. I told her it wasn&#39;t and she said that she didn&#39;t care...but corporate would. I found this odd that Cheesecake Factory corporate doesn&#39;t allow recording video inside the restaurant. One would think that recording memories and events would be encouraged. I assured her that I was not recording video and showed her that the camera was off by turning it on, showing her the blue LED&#39;s and then turning it back off. I told her that I could place the camera on the floor under the table or on the chair next to me if it was a concern. She said it wasn&#39;t her...it was &#39;corporate&#39; that had the problem, and left. After this interruption by the manager, we went back to conversation and enjoying our meal. <br><br>A few minutes later, 2 of the waitstaff started taping pieces of paper on the glass separator (level with the camera sensor and lens) apparently to attempt to &#39;block the recording&#39; that the manager had insisted I was doing. My wife got pissed off and grabbed the camera and shoved it under the table. The wait staff (a very nice young woman and young man) said they were tasked by the manager to, &#39;block the recording of how we cook our food&#39;. That is paraphrasing, but she seemed embarrassed that she was tasked to carry out this objective. <br><br>To be honest - I was embarrassed for her. When I asked her (the wait staff) why the manager didn&#39;t object that the camera was on the table after I asked her if she would feel more comfortable if I placed the camera under the table, she said, &#34;Oh my God, the manager said you were trying to video record how we prepare our dishes, I&#39;m so sorry!&#34;<br><br>I had the Kobe Burger. It isn&#39;t rocket science how to cook a hamburger. You cook it, flip it, cook it then eat it. I&#39;m not sure why Kobe burger flipping is a secret at Cheesecake Factory...but it was a pretty damn good hamburger.<br><br>While we won&#39;t be coming back to Cheesecake Factory...it isn&#39;t because the food is bad, or the wait staff is incompetent. <br><br>It is because Cheesecake Factory &#39;corporate&#39; hired a passive aggressive &#39;manager&#39; that believes people are trying to record how the food is made, and is not genuine when interacting with customers.<br><br>**UPDATED Monday Dec 19 (a few days after my last visit to Cheese Cake Factory)**<br><br>I added +1 because as you can see below, CCF responded to my review. It is my opinion that CS on social media is an important part of the Customer Experience. This shows me that CCF&#39;s digital strategy team is willing to pick up the ball after it was dropped by the City Creek restaurant manager. I replicated my initial review on G+ (where they indicate they had responded) but I haven&#39;t read it yet. <br><br>Validation begets validation. +1 to CCF digital strategy for acknowledging and addressing my concern in a timely manner. I&#39;ll admit I was not expecting a response.
Came here late and unannounced. Great food and service. $25 for bottle of very good house cabernet. Newfound appreciation for this franchise.

So this can be a tough place to eat, mainly b/c of the wait time, the shuffling, the noise, and the cost of food. With that said, I still like to go there. I plan on at least a 30 minute wait and make sure I&#39;m going with someone I want to talk that long with! The food was good this time around. We got the crab cakes and the Korean fried cauliflower. I didn&#39;t think the cauliflower would be good (not a huge fan), but it was the best thing I had! The picture shows a half eaten cauliflower dish b/c it was going that quick between 3 people. Definitely try that out. I had the pear flat bread and that was good. I like the light menu options. I didn&#39;t see those when I was there a couple of years ago. We, strangely enough, didn&#39;t get cheesecake as we were so full from our entres.

This is a nice Cheesecake factory.  They are all pretty much the same. I had my favorite Grilled Chicken and Avocado club sandwich.   <br><br>The location is nice situated at the City Creek Mall in SLC. Decor is basically he same as every other CF I have ever been to. <br><br>Employees were friendly and service was good.

Cheesecake has gone so far downhill. Some of the food was barely edible last night - the salad was bland with wilted lettuce and the pork belly in the sliders was burnt to a crisp and completely inedible. <br><br>Gone are the glory years of the chain - late 1990&#39;s and here to stay is blandness and low quality. <br><br>A very disappointing experience and we will most definitely not be back.

Horrible. I order food then cancel my reservation at another restaurant.  <br><br>Cheesecake then cancels my order after accepting it. <br><br>Now no food no place to eat. Good job Cheesecake Factory way to do nothing.  If you can&#39;t deliver on what you promise to your customers you will be out of business soon.  <br><br>And per your suggestion I voice my opinion on your corporate site.  Twitter, Insta, FB, Snap. You ruined an evening because you didn&#39;t care about the customer.

I have been to many Cheesecake Factories. All over the country. This has to have been the worst experience (along with some terrible food) that we&#39;ve ever had. It was like we were in the Twilight Zone.<br><br>First, I have always been satisfied with Cheesecake Factory&#39;s food. We typically order the same dishes. California Omelette and White Chicken chili. <br><br>We sat in the bar and waited for a good 20 minutes (which is fine-they were busy) but it was the food that killed the drill. They got the order wrong. The omelette was so bad it wasn&#39;t finished. Then we had to ask for ketchup (apparently it&#39;s been rationed) and we got about a tablespoon in a jar. We were also served some sort of &#34;butter syrup&#34;? with the pancakes that was straight oil. <br>They ran out of brown bread and we never heard about that again.<br><br>We are still shaking our heads about it.<br><br>The manager did come up to us by the end of my review and apologized, which was nice...but they didn&#39;t comp us for any of it. So...

We had a lovely time at City Creek Center. I was a little disappointed that it took nearly 8 minutes for anyone to notice us after we were seated. It was a very nice day &amp; I could see there were many patrons dining outside but I wanted to be inside because it was breezy. The food was amazing! I ordered the stuffed cheddar burger in lettuce &#39;protein style&#39; &amp; my man ordered his usual of Shrimp &amp; Chicken gumbo. We were so impressed &amp; savored every bite. Thank you!!

Wow, it took 3 hours from start to finish. At first the manager was amazing. We had food that wasn&#39;t out in, a broken glass that one of us cut their lip on. Food was cold, and the waiter wasn&#39;t great. The manager did comp us considerably but one of the worst experience I have ever had. Oh and to say, here&#39;s all your checks, pass them around! Not okay!!!

Well I can&#39;t give less than one star but the staff was incredibly ignorant that I was standing there for five minutes. I asked a question and was referred me to another area. Went there and waited a couple minutes while the staff laughed and cajoled with no help until I asked. I was then referred back to the original area. I told them that &#34;they need to get their shit together.&#34; And was later confronted by the manager. She did not take the Customer is always right stance with me and only defended her lackluster staff. Also the food is overrated and overpriced.

White peoples&#39; Mecca. Over promised, over charged, and under delivered. My fiancé took me, as she loves this place. I had never been. I ordered the chipotle chicken. I make this sort of fish all the time and was curious to taste a professional version. Not enough chicken, the sauce was burned , and the cook apparently doesn&#39;t understand how to use chipotle in their cooking. My fiancé&#39;s dish had a watered down sauce, it tasted like weak tea. I didn&#39;t send it back because who wants to eat spit?  And then we got into an argument because I shared my thoughts and she said it wasn&#39;t normal. To have such a large menu and to fall short on two noodle dishes is an indication of mediocrity.

Took a total of 2 hours to be Seated, served and paid. <br>Food was overpriced and did not taste great. The bathroom reeked of urine.  <br><br>This was my first, and last trip to the Cheesecake Factory. (the kids&#39; French toast was good though)

Calamari appetizer was good, not great. Ceasar salad though was great-crispy, right amount of cheese and the dressing proportion was perfect. The Orange Chicken was great as always. The Jambalaya, which is usually the best was off the mark. All around not as good, from the noodles to the spices and everything in between. <br>The service was, per usual, outstanding.

We had a great dinner. We both enjoyed our selections. We chose to order couple of cheesecakes to go. Key lime mango for me and my husband&#39;s Hershey&#39;s Choc. <br>We were very much disappointed that both cheesecakes are foamy, not much of chocolates like it used to be and mine is foamy too and there&#39;s not a tinge of mango and cheesecake. We are not coming back here; the looks are deceiving but they&#39;re not as good as they were before. There are other cheesecakes around the area which are reasonably in price and the real<br>Cheesecakes. Very disappointed!

horrible service from the hosts no one wanted to sit me and my fiancé idk why?? ruined my life made us wait forever for a table racist service too<br><br>update: i do like the cheesecake poptory. honestly it has saved me when i been hungry so i changing my one star review to a 4 star

We always love Cheesecake Factory! It was a super long wait like normal especially on a Friday night. We were super impressed with our waiter, Jonathan H! Shout out to a good waiter in a crazy crowded setting. He went above and beyond for sure!

We love this place. You can&#39;t go wrong with anything you order plus hello the cheese cake is awesome. We only give it 4 stars because of the price. We feel like it is a little over priced. But we love it so much we keep going back. This time we got burgers. Americana burger, skinny licious burger which I love everything on the skinny menu and 2 kids meals. We shook it up a bit and got a chocolate moose cheese cake instead of the Godiva one.

In comparison to the fashion place location, this location is much better. We were at city creek and craving for pasta so stopped in. They have a huge menu and I ended up ordering miso salmon instead. Before 5, they offer a lunch menu. I noticed it was pretty much $5 off the dinner prices. Miso salmon was very tasty! My boyfriend ordered chicken Alfredo, it was full of flavor compared to when I ordered it at fashion, which tends to be bland.

I just wanted to let everyone know about the terrible experience I had at the City Creek Cheese Cake Factory. Our waiter was terrible. Fred (waiter) seemed disinterested, snappy, and irritable. He would leave for 30 minutes at a time, didnt want to answer any questions about the menu, and ruined me and my families night. The restaurant was also out of several things. <br><br>At the end of the night we left, thank god, but unfortunately i left my card there. So I come back and ask the hostess if she has seen my card to which she replies &#34;the managers need to search their office&#34;. I waited for over 5 minutes with nothing. I presume that the office was so dirty and disorganized that they needed 10 minutes to even search for a card. I then see my waiter and ask him if hes seen my card. He replies with &#34;no&#34; and runs off without any further explanation.
