They tell me to call tomorrow because there is nothing they can do, even though I had told them I thought it was in one of the black check books. <br><br>Overall terrible experience, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone I know.

I had the Mac and Cheese burger. It was nothing to write home to mom about. That being said, there are other dishes that I seen on other tables that people got and they looked really good. I&#39;m strictly basing my review on my meal alone. I will try something else in the future and may update my review based on the next meal I get. <br><br>The various cheesecakes are delicious so you definitely should try one of the many selections they have.

Eh. I&#39;ve never liked cheese cake factory. The food is all bland, and over priced. The service is always slow, because it&#39;s so freaking busy. I can see why people like it, there is everything on the menu, so you can please a crowd. However, if this is date night, pick somewhere else. The only reason I&#39;m giving two stars is because the cheese cake is actually delicious, it&#39;s the ONLY thing they are good at. It&#39;s too bad they don&#39;t serve fresh made whipped cream with it...

The good:  the food we finally got was good, the server was pleasant. The bad:  it took 50 minutes for the server to come back and tell us they were out of calamari. Then came back to tell us they were out of pretzels. They ended up giving us bread to go with the cheese and mustard.  Then they were out of the first two entrees one of us tried to order. Then my chicken Costello did not have lemon sauce so I had to ask for that. Then they didn&#39;t put the lemon sauce in my to go box!  We were comped a piece of cheesecake but good grief. It shouldn&#39;t be that hard.
Very short wait server was very nice excellent food they got it out to us very fast would definitely recommend

Disclaimer: I&#39;m a happy person who is infinitely in love with food. That said, I&#39;m falling out of love with The Cheesecake Factory. The CF has reached it&#39;s peak during my prom years and this will be forever where high schoolers take their dates to woo them into a false sense of grandeur.<br><br>Let&#39;s highlight some good things. Service is always fast, friendly, and waiters/waitresses always have genuine smiles on their faces. The Cheesecake, I mean come on, it&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory and I will give it to them, still to this day the Dulce De Leche, Snickers, Oreo, essentially all their creations are delicious. And that&#39;s about it.<br><br>Come on guys, I&#39;ve seen some college publications shorter than the menu at CF. I somehow always manage to spend 30 minutes reading the biggest menu on the planet. Why? Why the need for so many options? Think of it this way. You&#39;re trying to impress a date. Would you wear a dashing tuxedo? or would you wear a tuxedo, a suit, your funeral suit, your wedding suit, your prom suit ALL at once. Why? What are you trying to hide? It&#39;s simple, their absolutely mediocre less than impressive food. It&#39;s really not that good. Just a lot of it on a plate in a dimly lit restaurant so you can&#39;t really see how bad it is. <br><br>However, what were we expecting? It&#39;s a chain, their focus is essentially the same as McDonald&#39;s, VOLUME. Their intent isn&#39;t making the best mac and cheese burger, or pineapple chicken and rice, or chicken curry, or the best spaghetti there is. They stuff you with volume and trick you into thinking it&#39;s the best thing you&#39;ve ever had. Don&#39;t be fooled. Skip the tom foolery and go straight to dessert. No pretense, you can&#39;t hide a bad cheesecake (or maybe you can).

The only complaint I have is the wait!!! Consistently great food, top notch, knowledgeable servers, love the bread, and my favorites which I have converted many friends to is the miso salmon, perfectly prepared on a bed of rice and covered in a miso Asian type sauce. I love to get the small plate of Greek salad, and crab cakes.  You really can&#39;t go wrong here!

Love this place so much. I always get the same thing and usually never stray. Chicken mandera (spelling error) is the best. All their meals are good for two meals because of the size. The service is ok. I feel like they could do better at bringing more bread without me having to ask every time. But that&#39;s probably for less waste. Always love this place and it&#39;s a great when I get to visit this restraunt.
Very delicious food I really like the spicy Caesar salad and the tomato basil pasta was very good I cannot remember the cheesecake that we had but it was  great.

Came here with my niece and nephew for dessert. The staff was very nice and presentable. I went during lunchtime so there were a lot of big groups because of the many businesses located nearby. My nephew and I went with the regular cheesecake with strawberries on top. So delicious and of course I ate too much. My niece had a chocolate flavor cheesecake. Our server was awesome. He was never M.I.A.  The managers were also walking around making sure everyone was doing their job. Tables were cleaned fast once the guests left. Overall great experience.

Our waitress took forever to take our orders. She didn&#39;t get my order right after I told her twice that it was supposed to be gluten free due to an allergy. The food was very mediocre and a small cockroach crawled on our table. I used to get takeout here all the time and never again.

Unfortunately, this was a Terrible experience for my gf and I. First we were seated at too small table to be comfortable located right next to the bathroom, and waiters order computer. Our waitress was nice and attentive and checked for satisfaction.  The food was very good, avocado egg rolls, pasta nepalotana, and the crusted chicken. All great dishes would recommend. <br>However, back to the table being small.... The food runner brought our appy, but the problem was we had our drinks, menus and small plates on the table....so what does he decide to do, he just starts at the end of the table between my gf and I and pushes from the edge until all the other utensils, drinks, bread basket were pushed every which way. My gf and I had to play a cute game of Tetris but made it work. <br>Food runner couldn&#39;t care less.<br><br>Conclusion<br>Waitress great<br>Food great <br>Food runner inconsiderate and rushed.<br>Table terrible for an intimate time between two people who wanted a booth to share side by side.<br>I&#39;m 6 feet 4 inches, sitting in a chair that sticks out next to the bathroom and order station and having the waitress having to turn sideways to get between us to serve each table was rather uncomfortable. <br>It&#39;s ok CF we will go again however, I won&#39;t settle for anything less than a booth or a table larger than what we had. I need to hear my date and be able to have everything I order from the bar and kitchen fit the table.

I love this places &#34;Bar Section.&#34; Always able to get a spot no matter how crowded the Restaurant is. Table for #1 please. I even got a booth this time. What a lucky man I am tonight. Now if only I can get the number of the hot number sitting at the bar in the black &amp; white sweater.  Humm, that&#39;s a different review.

Party of one: I was sat at a table for two in a section of about 5 other tables. Once seated the waitress dropped off the check to the table beside me. She looked at me and walked off I figured she would return after closing their tab and greet me. When she came back to the table she dropped off their check and went to another table in her section checked on them and walked back out of site. Finally she returned to the section checked on one other table and then decided to make formal contact with me asking for my drink selection. It took a long 10 minutes to ever be waited on or atleast greeted by the wait staff then another 5 to get my drink. This being said it isn&#39;t a busy evening just a moderate Thursday crowd. Service thus far is very unimpressive.<br><br>After the relief server came over to let me know she was now taking care of me the mood changed and she was very polite and helpful. Her service was a nice change to how the dinner started
Great food and service! Heather was wonderful and my burger was very tasty! I will definitely be back to this location, Heather deserves a raise her work ethic was flawless

Good food but it&#39;s expensive as fuck and that&#39;s why I give 3 stars cause I don&#39;t think the food is worth the price. Always a cluster fuck when getting a table and it takes forever to get a table.

As much as I love to support local restaurants, sometimes I just can&#39;t help going to a mega chain like Cheesecake Factory. Don&#39;t judge me. Is it worth the 30 minute wait? Not really... But when you&#39;re feeling kind of basic, the ahi tuna tartare small plate is always a good go-to dish for me, and the cheesecakes are always yummy. Plus, their vast cocktail menu is full of fruity and deliciously sweet options if you didn&#39;t get enough pina coladas on your last vacation.

We love the Cheesecake Factory, who could wrong with cheesecake? I love the Thai lettuce wraps and seek them out as often as possible. My husband had the chicken Madeira and steak medallions last night, he said they were both something he would recommend. Raspberry white chocolate cheesecake is a winner in my book.

Its an average chain with decent food and generous portions. My interactions with the staff have been pleasant, despite it being off the hook busy. Because this place is right at the mall, and for whatever reason I keep ending up there on a Saturday; but the never ending stream of teens keep this joint packed! If you choose Saturday, then give yourself at least an hour. If you have a large party, then get there about two hours early. This way if you get seated in ninety minutes you will be that much elated. The parking garage is close by. Come up through Macys and its just outside the doors between the food court. A plus is that valet parking is right out front. And if you&#39;re staying at a motel with a shuttle, they drop you right at the door. You can buy cheese cake right up front if thats why your there.

Probably say this TOO often but this place is at the top of my list. If you know me, I like plenty of options and this place offers quite the variety.<br>First time at the City Creek location.  They&#39;re pretty busy during lunch time.  Outside dining is an option on a nice day just like the Murray one.  We were a group of about 15 but the service was still quick and attentive. <br><br>My choice was the Bistro Shrimp Pasta ($18.95). Holy, flavors.  Shrimp was small but great.  Spagettini noodles, Mushrooms, basil, tomatoes, all included.  The sauce was a basil-lemon base which I really enjoyed.  Something I would definitely order again.  I&#39;ve tried almost all of the pasta dishes they offer and I don&#39;t remember disliking any of them.  Chicken Piccata and Chicken Bellagio are also some of my favorites.<br><br>Don&#39;t forget to end your meal with a cheesecake!  It&#39;s a generous slice of sweet-goodness. I usually go for Red Velvet or Dulce de Leche.  They also have no problem with packing it for you to-go.

This is by far the worst Cheesecake Factory experience I have ever had. I have gone to several CFs in other states, but this one gave the well known popular restaurant a bad name. <br><br>I had a fairly large party and we were celebrating my brother in laws graduation. We understood reservations were not taken at a certain time and by the time we got there it was 8 pm. There was a high volume of guest and parties already waiting to be seated so our wait time was 3 hours. We decided to wait. After about an hour and a half we came back a checked with the host on the wait time and she stated it went down 30-20 mins instead. We were so relieved considering many of us were already so hungry. <br><br>Across the waiting area there is a dining room. As we waited the remaining time there was a large table that had not been cleaned for at least 30 mins. Once they cleaned it they sat the other large party ahead of us. Half our group are from Vegas and we were surprised how long they waited to clean the table considering that large party probably waited longer than us. At the CF in Vegas they would clean the tables right away. CF staff are quite known to be diligent.  <br><br>Before we were seated my sister asked the host if our party was gonna be able to sit together or visible to each other and she said yes. Once we were seated we were taken to 3 booths. Two were right next to each other and the other table was four tables away from ours. You can imagine our confusion. I can understand if the booths were right next to each other but to have a third of our party sat on the other side of the section did not make any sense at all. My sister asked the host if there was any way for all of us to sit together and the host said, &#34; I don&#39;t know right now this is the best option &#34; and then walked away to attend to other guest. My sister asked another question and the other host kept saying, &#34; I don&#39;t know, I don&#39;t know...&#34; The responses were not helping at all. <br><br>We sat down and ordered our drinks. My sister who was very uphad to go up to the podium to speak to the host again about the table arrangements. Eventually the table that was very far from the others was moved to a much closer table. This also meant the servers had to switch. There were great confusion with the seating and our server already seemed flustered and irritable. My sister asked for a plate from the server and he yelled at her and asked if she needed anything else. They took one of the dishes from one of the guest in our party (who did not move at all) to a different table. This person had to watch us eat and when his food came we were already done. We tried to make the most of the dinner. <br><br>Although the dinner was not what we had hoped would be I appreciate the staff for trying.

This place used to be good and now its losing its luster for being once a good place to go to. Maybe it&#39;s this location but for my experience of this location I was left with a sour taste instead of taste of great food. First off the wait to order was 25 mins and granted it wasn&#39;t that busy. Bread wasn&#39;t even served to us in that time but cant complain as it is complementry. After finally ordering it took them another 30 mins to just bring the food out which by the way is the real reason why I&#39;m giving a 2 star. Out if the 4 of us being served, two were given food as me and another friend waited about 10 mins for ours. When we finally got it the food tasted and looked like it had been sitting for awhile under a heat lamp. The cheese was starting to rubberize. And the bread was hard from sitting in the air for awhile. The waiter was ok and and the manager tried to help but my appetite had already depleted and was to the point of not being hungry. In conclusion I probably wont be coming back to this location at least. Poor service and attitude. Poor coordinating of getting food out to the customer. Maybe its poor communication but this needs to be addressed and looked into.

We were visiting Temple Square, dropped in to have dinner. The Q was 20mins and the dinner took a little while to arrive. They have good crowd in there. <br><br>We ordered the Herb crusted salmon, pasta chicken scampi, and a meatball spaghetti. The salmon is slightly plain, but the pasta chicken scampi was surprising good. The 3 meatballs were pretty good. <br><br>On the whole experience, the food was good,the service was prompt and cheery. The price is reasonable for the location and ambiance.
They are completely unable to do their jobs. It took them two hours to say they were out of something. How is that even possible? What are you doing while getting paid? Completely unacceptable.

So tonight stopped in to have dinner and of course during a very busy, upcoming holiday weekend only had to wait about 20 minutes. We were seated and introduced to Carson our waiter and got drink order started. After looking for a few minutes we ordered our dinner. It was perfect timing when our dinner was delivered and I ordered the Chicken Parmesan &#34;pizza style&#34;. My dinner was undoubtedly the best chicken parm I have eaten anywhere. The Mac and cheese side dish was perfectly cheesy tasting as always.<br><br>Carson was a little busy with bigger tables but he did he best he could that evening and was very nice. We then ordered our cheesecake to go and paid the bill and headed out for the evening.<br><br>We got back to our hotel and munched down on the dessert and it was a perfect non-alcoholic nightcap.

Food was good the service terrible. The waitress took 20 min to bring water and coffee and the place was empty. When I asked to speak to the manager I learned where the issues started. Nice guy but not a leader. Our eggs did not come out hot, we were offered noapology for the wait, the manager did offer to move us. An hour an 10 minutes to get breakfast utter failure.

Went on a date here. We usually wouldn&#39;t go to places like cheesecake factory, because honestly, the food is only decent but greatly overpriced. We only came because my boyfriends mom gave us a $50 gift card. If we didn&#39;t have the gift card, we&#39;d most likely not eat here. It&#39;s just not worth it for us.  It&#39;s supposed to be a fancy restaurant with amazing food, but my food has never been more than just alright, at any location. <br><br>What I do love about this place is I&#39;ve always had good service, and my Pina colada is always consistently  delicious. <br><br>The restaurant&#39;s appearance doesn&#39;t please me. It&#39;s too dark.

The Cheesecake Factory is one of the most overrated restaurants. If you are going simply for the cheesecake, there is no better place to go to. If you are going for dinner, there is a plethora of better options downtown. Any restaurant that has a nearly 20 page menu can&#39;t do any of those dishes phenomenally (except of course their cheesecakes, I&#39;ve had many and all have been excellent). As far as actual food, this place is very overrated. None of the entrees I&#39;ve had have been that great. They do have some really good appetizers though. The Asian lettuce wraps are really good, but messy. I also really love their grilled artichoke. I always get the artichoke to share with friends when we go here because my friends seem to think this place is really great, so we go here with a certain level of regularity.<br>I came here the first time ever on Sunday for brunch. I ordered the brulee french toast. I will say that that was done very well. My service on Sunday though was not great. My server kept the water full, but he was not a good listener when we asked for things and he didn&#39;t take my leftovers to box them like they always do here. When my boyfriend took me here for my birthday, our server was phenomenal, so it was frustrating not having great service on a very slow morning (think, it&#39;s City Creek, which is closed on Sundays, so not busy at all), compared to the very busy night we went a few months back for my birthday dinner. If you have a large group with different tastes, this is a good place to go because they have everything, but nothing is top  notch here (except the cheesecake).

We came in for the first time. I had read through the reviews and I must say, this was a very good visit. It wasn&#39;t busy. Got seated very quickly. Our waiter, Carson, was very nice, patient and answered all of my pretentious questions. Food was amazing. <br>I recommend coming in early or calling way ahead. We will be back in.

I visited this location today with my sis. We both enjoyed the service and our seating location outside in the shade. The quickness of drink refills, the server was nice and our food was good except for one major issue: I HATE warm lettuce. Hate is actually too nice a word, warm lettuce ruins any sandwich/food it touches. I was very clear when asking for no lettuce anywhere on the burger or even on the plate, we also had a joking laugh about it as I quickly told the server about the vileness of warm lettuce. Food comes, looks great! Just as I&#39;m ready to take a bite I see it...a long piece of lettuce hanging off the bottom of the burger. I took the bottom bun off and there was a huge pile of warm lettuce mixed in with some sauce on the bottom. Talk about lunch ruined. I scraped it off but the damage was done. I couldn&#39;t eat the bun and whatever the sauce was on the bottom was ruined. Sadly, even getting off all the lettuce, the flavor was still there. I Drenched the burger in the plain BBQ sauce (description also stated it was a bbq-ranch) but I could still taste the lettuce. I told the server, he apologized and went on his way. That&#39;s where I have the problem. This burger was WAY to expensive to have it ruined with the nasty that is warm shredded lettuce, when I simply asked for it to not be anywhere on the burger or plate. Mistakes happen, it would have been nice if he had offered to have it remade, which I would&#39;ve turned down because I&#39;m not a (total) bitch or wasteful. He could have offered anything to make it better but just went on his way. I have eaten here before and usually enjoy everything. I believe this: the burger would&#39;ve been fantastic had it not been for the lettuce lurking under the patty, soaking it&#39;s juices into the meat. ;) I&#39;ll post about my next experience, which I know will be 100%!

Great service, decent food. Seating feels alot like a cow must feel lined up for chow time. Just a little tight. If your looking for somewhere to have a private chat with your date, go somewhere else. UPDATE : The Honey Truffle chicken was terrible. More like two chicken strips from Maverick with an old packet of honey squeezed into the plate. Truffles? MIA. service started out great, went downhill fast.

It&#39;s my first time in Utah and I&#39;m staying up the block so my family and I decided to have dinner at the Cheesecake Factory. They had vegan/vegetarian meals for my sister which was lovely, another plus. I ordered the rib eye, medium rare with mashed potatoes and green beans. Our food arrived and it was all very flavorful and amazing. The meat cut so well and was very easy to eat despite how rare the meat looked. I ate about maybe a fourth or a third of my meal before asking for a box to take home (I don&#39;t eat much so I was expecting leftovers). Our server, Richard, comes over and as I ask him for a box and he stares down at the meat I had cut and asks me if i wanted it heated up more because it looked really pink. He took my plate back to heat and package it but came back and told me that him and a few others decided to remake my whole meal because the meat I had ordered wasn&#39;t prepared the way I asked (medium rare). The meat itself was fantastic and I had no problem taking what I had not finished but they decided to send me back to my hotel with a fresh steak knife, fork, and a whole new medium rare rib eye with mashed potatoes and green beans!!!! Living in San Francisco my whole life I have never received this kind of treatment from anyone. Absolutely wonderful. The people are easy to talk to, the food is beyond amazing, and most importantly the people working to make your customer experience really care for you. If I ever visit Salt Lake City again, I am DEFINITELY coming back here. Thanks again Richard!

If you receive a gift card for The Cheesecake Factory, I highly recommend it. If not, I would recommend somewhere else. There are so many good restaurants in downtown Salt Lake, you could throw a dart at a map and find a better one. I&#39;ve eaten here three times. The food is much the same each time. It&#39;s okay. I go back because wonderful people in our life gift us. However, I would recommend the cheesecake. I had it once and it was terrific.
Always good at this place.  The food was great and wait for 4 guests was only 20 minutes.

The Cheesecake Factory has always been a solid and dependable place. They stay pretty consistent with the quality of their food. Probably one of the better chain restaurants out there. There is a wide variety of comfortable options. While the dishes aren&#39;t very adventurous or extraordinary, they are familiar. There&#39;s usually a SUPER long wait, and they don&#39;t do reservations. Good service and friendly atmosphere.
We made a reservation on Yelp and where Straight away. We had a great server and the food taste amazing. The salted caramel cheesecake was great.

We had an excellent experience! Our group was very diverse, food wise. Meat eaters, vegetarians, vegans... everyone was happy. Our server, Keith O, went above and beyond the call of duty to answer questions and make sure everyone was happy.

The appetizer and side dishes are the only reason that I gave this place 2 stars. They were AMAZING. Sadly, the star of the plate (the steak) came very rare when I ordered it medium. They took it away, and it came back burnt to a crisp. Completely inedible. The waiter (who was actually a good waiter) asked why I didn&#39;t eat it. I told him it wasn&#39;t cooked properly. He told me he would show the chef. I thought that maybe one would be brought to me prepared correctly, or I would be accommodated. Instead, I was given my check. Very sad, because the rest of the food was so good.

Sometimes getting a table at The Cheesecake Factory in a timely manner can feel as impossible as getting an audience with royalty. I didn&#39;t have high hopes that on the first night of FanX we&#39;d be able to get a table in less than three hours, but they shocked me when they told us the wait would only be thirty minutes. I was even more pleasantly surprised when thirty minutes only ended up being about fifteen.<br><br>I&#39;m sure because of the event there was a lot of traffic throughout this establishment this evening, but have to compliment the entire staff for remaining professional and high on positive energy. Nothing but good vibes here this night, considering how many oddly dressed people (my party included!) might have passed through.<br><br>As far as food goes, I&#39;ve mentioned it for another location. I feel like there is something for everyone here; the menu is huge and can accommodate all tastes and even appetite sizes. And if you&#39;re looking for something to help you keep your waistline trim, they&#39;ve got that, too. <br><br>My friend and I split a pasta dish that she selected; it sounded just okay, but was ridiculously tasty. The wine was really evident in the sauce, and the pasta was cooked to perfection. The chicken was moist, too, and didn&#39;t taste veiny.<br><br>Our server, Andrew, was extremely professional and rolled with the punches, even when presented with a very odd request. My friend JJ and I don&#39;t get to see each other all that often, and we both have seriously quirky personalities. We decided we wanted to recreate the scene from &#34;Lady and the Tramp&#34; after we were joking about our shared pasta dish and if we only had a meatball and one strand of spaghetti. Andrew graciously accommodated our request, bringing out one meatball and one strand of spaghetti so we could act the scene for a few laughs with our friends. I loved that he said in his ten years of being in the service industry that this was the first time he&#39;d ever had anyone do this particular iconic movie scene. This is the type of service industry professional I&#39;ve always attempted to be, and this is the type of server that I love having when I go up. Keep it up, Andrew!

I&#39;ve been here three times and love it. I didn&#39;t have high expectations, since I felt like it was probably overhyped. True, it&#39;s pretty dang expensive ($15-30 per person, not including drinks or dessert) and the wait is often bad but the quality of food has made it worth it on special occasions. The chicken and biscuits are my favorite, but also loved the steak diane and shepherd&#39;s pie. (Get something with mashed potatoes, because they&#39;re great here. And trust me, that is not a recommendation I usually make.) There are SO many choices, I&#39;m not sure you can go wrong. Well no, I take that back. Though I haven&#39;t had anything bad, the artichoke dip and raspberry lemonades were both forgettable. The main dishes, however, have yet to disappoint. Portion sizes are massive and your caloric intake will be through the roof, so plan on getting a doggy bag. <br><br>I&#39;m not typically a fan of cheesecake (which is bizarre, since this place is called the Cheesecake Factory) but this place does it right. I honestly just stick to the original, plain jane cheesecake, so I can&#39;t vouch for the others, but it was really good. (The first time I got it, an employee scoffed at me for not being more adventurous and it was kind of rude, but that was an anomaly in otherwise pleasant service.) <br><br>My only other complaint is that it&#39;s pretty dark in there. The guy next to me was using his cell phone as a light to be able to read the menu. It&#39;s annoying in Hollister and it&#39;s annoying in a restaurant, too.<br><br>Overall though, five stars. If you have plenty of time and a wad of disposable income and you&#39;re starving, go here.

Will not be back to this Cheesecake Factory location - ever! Fool me once, shame on you! Fool me twice, shame on me! <br><br>Hesitated to come to this location after finding a hair in my takeout about a month before. <br><br>In a time crunch to get to a play across the street we snagged a table by the bar. Three people said hello, brought plates, napkins, bread etc. Waitress came and basically kicked us out because not everyone in our party was 21. Said some off-hand remark about the &#34;Zion Curtain&#34;!?!?<br><br>However, just to my left, 10 feet away, there was family of 5 with 2 young children that could clearly see the bar. Just because we didn&#39;t order alcohol on a Saturday night doesn&#39;t give you the right to ask anyone to leave. <br><br>WILL NOT BE BACK!

Came to have a nice dinner with a co worker.  During dinner, on the clock waitress Tara Jones decides to take our picture and send it to her aunt Jill Jones who then sends it to my soon to be x husband. While I am eating dinner with my male friend I get nasty texts from family members that I am lying and cheating all because Tara Jones decides to invade my privacy and take pictures. Meanwhile she has no idea what is going on in my life and she&#39;s just trying to start drama. I thought I could come to Cheesecake and feel safe and not feel violated by their working employee that&#39;s on the clock! Unbelievable!  All Cheesecake management did was apologize and send me a gift card for their rude unbelievable unacceptable joke of an employee.  I will not be back to this location and am extremely disappointed .

Well let me just start by saying this is a chain. With that comes both good and bad perspectives. Food is usually tasty and consistent here. Catch them at an off time but definitely not during rush hour. No reservations taken. Staff is friendly and pretty on top of things. Cheesecake as always......amazing. Definitely a huge variety of foods for every palate and diet. Valet parking a plus. Again though, it&#39;s a chain, so you get what you get lol.

Best restaurant and service in the Salt Lake City area. This was my first time in Utah and we had the best service here! Our waitress was prompt, friendly and very helpful! Thank you Brenna! You and the cheesecake were the best part of our trip!

I would say this is a very decent place for a chain. Great atmosphere, good food. However, this place is always packed, so I recommend you to avoid their busy hours.<br><br>I went here on a Saturday noon, waited for about 10 min for the table. What I don&#39;t like about this place is that the space between each table. It seems to me it&#39;s getting narrower each time I came here. The service were pretty slow that day, it seemed our waiter had forgotten us from time to time. That&#39;s why I didn&#39;t give it the fourth star. <br><br>I got the lunch pasta-Evelyn&#39;s Favorite, and lunch favorites- Famous Factory Meatloaf. The pasta was a bit tasteless at first, without chewing with the sundries tomatoes, it was flavorless. The meatloaf was enjoyable. It was tender and perfectly seasoned and cooked. I love how they put onion on top of the meatloaf to bring out even more flavor. We ended our meal with the Limoncello Cheesecake. It wasn&#39;t as sweet as the other. I always think that their cheesecakes were too sweet, but this one was unlike the rest, it had a freshness taste in it. I would recommend this cheesecake to those who want something lighter than regular cheesecake.
JEN thanks you for all tips where to hang out, cause I can&#39;t hang out here all night with you. Awesome service. No bar but you can go down to the high tables without waiting in line for 1 hour

I sat down and the first thing I noticed was my spoon had old food on it. Huge turn off and very unappetizing. Next, my cloudy water glass had a slow leak that started to make the table wet. Got my food. Food was fine but the sweet potato fries were over cooked and mostly little crumbs.  For the price of the meal, I can honestly say I was disappointed.
The food is really low quality at such price, aweful customer service and i still have no idea why some people like it.
The food was excellent, and so was the cheesecake (of course). I booked online and got right in when I arrived. The atmosphere was comfortable and spacious.

It was my first time here and it was amazing. The warm bread they brought in was probably the best bread I&#39;ve ever had. Jesus. Our server was simply amazing. Shoutout to her. The huge appetizer nachos was huge and no one could finish it. Mind you, there were about 5 people. I ordered the mushroom burger and it was great!!!!!!! My sister ordered the chicken fingers and WOW huge. She loved it.

It&#39;s average food, way overpriced, and way too busy to wait in line for.  <br><br>Seriously, has anyone seen a wait under an hour?  Even on weekdays it&#39;s awful.  I&#39;m not sure why the long wait either.  The food is decent, but not great.  Obviously the selection is good, but if you can narrow down your selection then pick one of the local, non-chains that have way better food for less of a cost and no wait.<br><br>I don&#39;t know what else to say.  I guess if you&#39;ve still decided to go, go for the Chicken Bellagio dish.  The Factory Burrito isn&#39;t very good.  Cheesecakes are good, but when have you seen someone mess up a cheesecake?<br><br>I would take any local place around the town over this, and maybe some gelato for desert.  You can do both in less time than it will take for you to get a seat here.

I am very unsure how people still eat here. I have been to this location 3 times now. Every time, terrible service, forgotten food, cold dishes, and a stupid long wait. I&#39;m not sure how they keep all that stuff on the menu &#34;fresh&#34; and ready to go, but what the heck a 32 page menu will suffice. I also hate that a chain restaurant is that close to central downtown and people frequent it so much, when there are more amazing LOCALLY owned restaurants around. That is all.
The chicken Parmesan sandwich was one of the best sandwiches I&#39;ve ever partaken of!  This place is pricey - but a good change every once in awhile.
Went to this Cheesecake Factory again in April 2019.  And again, a great experience.  Great food and service.  Thank you Salt Lake City Cheesecake Factory!
Brevin (employee 246) was fantastic! Loved his cheery attitude, sweet smile, and quick service. Such a good dude!!! Also, a rad tie

Service was prompt and good , I ordered filet mignon medium but I received an overcooked well done steak. If you serve steak and ask customers how they want it cooked then it should be done as ordered. Don&#39;t order steaks here, waste of money!

Such a large menu, that it&#39;s hard to get bored eating here. A little pricey, but the portions are huge so keep that in mind. Appetizers are big enough for a meal, and entrees are large enough to take home lunch for the next day. They have two pages worth of cheesecake selections, and everything I have tried has been delicious. If you just want cheesecake, they have a walk up counter at the entrance.

I was so disappointed with this place that I will make this short and sweet.<br><br>Pros: Convenient location. Parking validation.<br><br>Cons: Overpriced. Average food. Slow service. <br><br>Took 40 minutes to bring our food (which were lighter fare pasta dishes) and our waiter disappeared. Did he clock out? Did he take a smoke break? I dont know but we had to flag down a different waiter to find out if our food was ready. <br><br>Had to rush to eat our food in 10 min to make it to our show.<br><br>Terrible experience.

The food is always good.  The hit or misses are the waiters.  The waiters here are like a box of chocolates; you never know what you&#39;re going to get. <br><br>One week I can have an awesome waiter who is on the ball with refilling drinks, clearing empty plates and has just enough personality to make the conversation light and short without being annoying.  Another week you can have the worst possible service ever where your waiter disappears behind the cash register and you spot her eating food and on her cell<br>phone when you&#39;ve already asked for a refill. Three times.  <br><br>Consistency in service here gets a C- but the food is always satisfactory.  I dislike change so I order the same things over and over again but I&#39;m not upset.  Each dish comes out better than the last time<br>I ordered it. <br><br>Drinks: tequila or Asian pear martini <br><br>Apps: firecracker salmon, ahi tuna tartar<br><br>Mains: pasta lovers get the Pasta DaVinchi. <br><br>Carnivores: hibachi steak with garlic potatoes, tempura asparagus and a delicious sweet sauce to top it off.  Did i mention the meat is fork tender? <br><br>Dessert: the portions are so generous here that I hardly ever have room for a slice of delicious cheesecake but you can&#39;t go wrong with the classics like strawberry and turtle.  If you&#39;re feeling fancy and want a stomach ache that hurts so good, get the white chocolate cheesecake. Just don&#39;t look in the mirror afterwards bc you won&#39;t like the gut you&#39;ve created.

The food is sometimes hit or miss, and on occasion they have been out of the food my party has wanted to order, but the Salted Caramel Cheesecake makes up for it 100% and always makes the trip downtown worth it. The staff has always been friendly and professional, never rushing us out and getting our orders out in a good time. Love coming here to decompress after a long week with friends!

We made a reservation for my sisters birthday for 8 pm. We arrived a few minutes early and were seated within 10 minutes. Our server gave us his recommendations. Our server was fantastic, filling up our bread a couple times and always making sure we were happy and if he could do anything else for us. They were out of a few dishes that we wanted that were out of stock, however we were all pleased with our food. Good experience, I still think the price is a little to high, however, the food sizes are quite large.
I&#39;m done with this place. It&#39;s always a long wait and the Hostess is always rude. The only reason I gave it 2 stars is because the food is ok.

Every time I go to the Cheesecake Factory at city creek I get the WORST service and tonight was no different. First the front table stated they had said our name after we waited 30 minutes for the &#34;15&#34; minute wait although we had been sitting next to them the whole time. Second, our waiter helped all the tables around us except for mine. I would not recommend going here and spending the obscene prices on mediocre food and terrible service.

I had my birthday dinner here. There was a 30 minute wait on a Wednesday! If you don&#39;t want to wait, see if the round tables are available since those are open seating. Our server was great. We enjoyed our time there. I don&#39;t ever have anything bad to say except the wait times can be long. They are always so busy but the service has never lacked. They even sang happy birthday to me!

I think the cheesecake factory is delicious. Their bread is soft and tasty and every cheesecake I have tried has been to die for, my favorite is the lemon raspberry.<br>Every meal I have had had been good, not out of this world, but really good. My favorite is the chicken bellagio. The raspberry lemonade is also one of the best drinks I&#39;ve had with free refills. We have always had great service!

Love this location. They have great service and the best chefs. I&#39;m always happy when I leave. Definitely would recommend! <br><br>My only advice... Since it&#39;s such a busy location, the wait time sucks, so if you&#39;re going on a busy night, plan an hour or two as buffer. Worth the wait though!

Took my son for his 24th birthday we had a server named Jordan he was amazing he was on it great personality great Style everyone that the downtown restaurant was amazing and I thank you from all of us it was a great time!

I am sorry to do this but I feel it has to be said. This was one of my worst dinning experiences I have ever had. My husband and I went to this Cheesecake factory with his parents and man did things go horrible awry.<br><br>First off, I want to point out that we are big fans of the Fashion Place Cheese Cake Factory (will review later) so we have come to expect a level of service from this franchise. Our dinner started off with an extremely long wait to be seated (to be expected at any Cheese Cake Factory) the major issue was the fact that the restaurant was not very active the night we were there (Sunday). After finally being seated we were shoved into what seemed to be the back of the restaurant. The lighting at our table was extremely dim and we were hardly able to read our menus. All things up to this point were forgivable. <br><br>Things went terrible down hill when our two year old son was playing with his drink. The cup he had seemed to lose its integrity as he was drinking it and decided to give way all over the table (not there fault). Dripping with drink we began to try and scramble to find some type of help from the service at the restaurant. This is where our nightmare continued. After many failed attempts at gaining the attention of multipule waiters and waitresses. I decided to ask the help of a waiter and his response was that he would come immediately after he finished the table he was working on. But after completing the table he completely forgot the promise he had made and even after our attempts to draw his attention he acted as if we were invisible. After he left I tracked down a bus boy who finally came and helped us clean up our table.<br><br>Next, I feel because we were stuffed in the back of the restaurant our waiter seemed to have forgotten about us. He never seemed to come and check in on how things were going and even after we complained about our lack of drinks his remedy was to bring each of us triple drinks to make sure we were satisfied (which took up to much space on our table and created a new problem with our two year old) the best part was he brought us the wrong drinks. <br><br>Lastly, the time on the food took an exuberant amount of time longer than expected. Normally I would plan on one hours worth of time but our food took double (solidifying the feeling that we had been forgotten). I know that there is more that I have forgotten but I truly have to give this Cheese Cake Factory a thumbs down. I will not be returning. I recommend you save your money or make the extra drive to Fashion Place.

This is by far the worst cheesecake service I have ever had and possibly the worst dinning experience ever. <br><br>Waited 15 minutes for a table on a Tuesday night no big deal. Waited another 15 minutes for our waiter to acknowledge we exist. Still no big deal. <br><br>Finally ordering. My partner 23 ordered a blue moon and he has a HI drivers license. The waiter examines it quite thoroughly and hands it back saying thanks and &#34;I&#39;ll be right back with your drinks.&#34; <br><br>Cut to 10 minutes later the waiter returns saying that he needs to take my partners id because he honestly has never seen a Hawaii dl and his manager now has decided they need to verify his id. We hand him the id and he disappears. <br><br>Add another 5 minutes on that when he returns to tell us he is sorry it is taking so long but his manager is verifying the id in a book because she needs to make sure it&#39;s not a fake id. <br><br>I then at that point told him &#34;No! no she don&#39;t. Go get the damn drivers license now we are leaving.&#34;<br><br>Not 2 min later here comes the manager with the id. I honestly couldn&#39;t make out half of what she said but something to the extent of &#34;what&#39;s the issue here? I&#39;m the manager&#34; I told her there was no issue and asked her name as I gathered our belongings to leave. Fire this person now because she is costing you business. <br><br>We had before tonight eaten at cheesecake often. This was the last straw I don&#39;t believe that we will be returning for some time.

I&#39;m a fan of cheesecake. I have a few favorite items on the menu, such as the herbed salmon and baja chicken tacos. There is definitely a lot to choose from, and not everything (in my opinion) is good, but it is a good place to go to so everyone&#39;s palate can be satisfied! <br><br>At this location, Noah was our waiter and he was sooooo nice and friendly. I made sure to tell his manager that because he deserved it! <br><br>Since there are only two cheesecake factories in Utah there is usually always a long wait, so make sure to go during non rush hour times!

More like 2 1/2/stars.  Idk why but this location is not as crowded.  Maybe its the massive food court down the way but its easy to get a table.  I like this location better then Murray because how tall the ceilings are and it feels like Vegas.  Service is hit and miss.  Today Jessica was great and handled our salty soup problems.  For lunch I always order the Renne&#39;s Special.  It comes with half a sandwich, salad, and soup.  Today the soup was french onion.  It came out luke warm and like a bucket of salt had been dumped in to it.  Jessica told us it was her least favorite soup because of that reason.  Wanting soup real bad i was disappointed in lunch and for $35 without tip, I too should have gone to the food court.  I ordered a pizza for my son in which he didn&#39;t eat.  The pepperoni&#39;s are like linguisa and have a strong smell and taste, i could see why a 3 year old would have a problem eating it.  Jessica didn&#39;t ask how the pizza was as it hadn&#39;t been touched.  Im surprised a manager didn&#39;t come by and apologize.  I had 3 containers of food to go, obviously our food sucked.  Overall, this place isn&#39;t cheap, food portions are huge, but you never know service wise what your going to get.  If you feel like dropping some doe for average, this is the place!

We only came here for the desserts after shopping in the City Creek mall.<br><br>The location is nice, which is very closed to the mall and when we came, we requested to seat in the bar, as we&#39;re only getting desserts.<br><br>The waiter provided us with bread and butter, which is OK and serve our drinks.<br><br>As I came here before, I knew that their &#34;Deuce de Leuce&#34; (something sounds like this, basically, it is caramel type) cheesecake is delicious, so I ordered this ... we also added with Tiramisu cheesecake.<br><br>We like the caramel one better (5 stars) ... it is just tasty &amp; delicious while the Tiramisu-one is average (3 stars), nothing really special.<br><br>Their service is good and attentive, she made some short conversation that entertained us.

City Creek Cheesecake factory has great food. Enjoyed their service. My daughter cannot have gluten and it&#39;s frustrating trying to find a restaurant that works for us. Their menu is great for that. It shows all the Gluten Free items.. Great choice for us!

Pretty disappointed in today&#39;s visit. Me and my boyfriend came here as a late birthday dinner. I ordered the chicken Madeira and the other dish ordered was the pasta with shrimp and sausage. The chicken Madeira, when I first tasted it, the temperature of the food felt like it was sitting out for 10 minutes or so. It was not even warm, and my chicken barely had the wine sauce. With the pasta, it was was undercooked and it came out with chicken instead of the shrimp so we had it sent back. I&#39;m sure they took someone else ordered cause they said they made him a &#34;new&#34; plate but it wasn&#39;t even five minutes. I also felt bad because a couple next to us were here first before us and we got our food before then.

Eating here right now and the service is AWFUL!! The hostesses were rude and non-communicative. Definitely not a great first impression. Then the waiter has the personality of a grinch. I wish I could ask for a new one. <br>I wouldn&#39;t come back to this place even if it was free! Too bad because it&#39;s my daughters b-day. What a HUGE disappointment....
The food is pretty good. We were told the wait time was 50 minutes but it as closer to 90 minutes. I&#39;ll avoid Cheesecake Factory in the future. It&#39;s over rated.

For almost $90 for three of us I would have liked the meat (Black Pepper Chicken/Shrimp) not overcooked and fried plantains to be plantains, not bananas. (The sauce was tasty.) And the Steak Diane not to be served overcooked (from med-rare level requested) with a proper dijón-forward Diane sauce--not a derivative of a basic mushroom wine sauce. And the third dish (Asian-style fish) we ordered was so-so. Maybe I&#39;d try again if just making a dessert visit. We liked both cheesecake styles we tried. (German chocolate with vanilla layer and macaroon crust; and a mango key lime.)

There is something for everyone. No matter what you want they have a little of everything. They excel at cheesecake but don&#39;t forget the fried mac n cheese. Easily the best food they have. Tuxedo cheesecake is my favorite cheesecake.

I waited at the cheesecake counter for almost ten minutes. There were two employees working back there, one walked back and forth several times as I stood right by the register waiting.  Then four other employees gathered behind the counter. And I still waited... 6 employees ignored me ?

I have eaten here more times then I would like to admit...and I have had so many different experiences. <br><br>I will just start by saying that for the most part the food is always decently good. I had the best lettuce wraps I have had here one time. I also had one of the worst cheesecake factory salads I have ever had at this location. <br><br>But what has been really hot or cold has been the service. <br><br>On a recent visit our waitress was hardly a waitress at all. It took over 10 minutes for her to come and introduce herself or give us water. After about another 10 minutes, she came by again and said &#34;Sorry I don&#39;t have any time I have other people I have to help that are very needy&#34; so... maybe the Queen of England was also there and we were just chopped liver compared to that? Not really sure what that was about because we were paying customers too. <br><br>OH WELL. We finally ordered. I ordered a lunch size chicken salad... well they brought out a huge salad and I asked if it was the lunch size and the girl who brought it out assured me that it was the lunch size. Well they forgot the dressing, and it took another 5 minutes to flag down a worker to get dressing. So okay I was a little upset but I got over it. The salad was fine, nothing amazing. I have had better at other locations. Well fast forward to the bills... and they had charged me for a full dinner salad. I told my waitress I only had a lunch, and she said that they gave me a dinner size. I protested and said it was unfair to charge me for something I didn&#39;t order. She eventually agreed and only charged me for the lunch size, but it wasn&#39;t without a big hassle and without her making me feel like I was the most demanding person in the world. I really just wanted to pay the price for what I ordered. So that experience wasn&#39;t good. <br><br>BUT the next time I came a few days later, I had one of the nicest workers serving me ever. He was so attentive and checked on me the perfect amount of times. He made sure I always had water and that I had all the things I needed. I had the mushroom chicken lettuce wraps and they were simply delicious, fresh, and a great deal. It was about a 100 times better experience. <br><br>OVERALL..... I mean I think the food is pretty good or I wouldn&#39;t keep coming back. It isn&#39;t the best food ever, but it is open late, and there is a huge menu so it pleases pretty much everyone you come with. I just have trust issues because of the variety of experiences I have had here.

My family and I checked in to Cheesecake Factory at about 6:25pm. We were there to celebrate family members who were going away for 1.5-2 years, doing service work. The representative told us it would take an hour to get a table (on a Tuesday night), and it was fine. Our ringer notified us at about 7:45pm that our table was ready. <br><br>We initially asked for a table for 15, but ended up asking for 18. When we got to our table, it was pretty tight, so my brother cleaned a table and a few chairs and added it to ours (so we could fit). We ended up with 20 people. After this happened, one of the waiters came up to our table and told us that we weren&#39;t supposed to do that. Then, he told us how wrong we were to do that. He, then, went to tell a manager named Josh who came out and yelled at us in front of everyone. So embarrassing! He yelled, &#34;You guys said 18 and now there&#39;s 20! What you&#39;re doing is making another family wait longer! You&#39;re also taking a table away that should&#39;ve been cleaned up for someone else!&#34; EVERYONE who was in the restaurant just stared at us. He was so unprofessional at handling a situation under pressure, and both of these guys (Josh and the male waiter with glasses) treated us like we had stolen money out of their cash boxes! <br><br>I sat there feeling uneasy about the situation, and I went to find the General Manager (Mike). As one of the managers at the restaurant, Josh should&#39;ve felt good that we were bringing in business! We were buying dinner and desserts for over 20 people so we were paying for the service charge as well. Since I don&#39;t believe in paying people (or a business) to treat me like crap, yell at me, and embarrass me in front of other paying customers for a SERVICE (and the GM wasn&#39;t there), I went looking for another manager. I found Cindy and she was amazing! She told us we were ok to sit there. In fact, she cleaned up another table and moved things around so my entire family could all fit. Our waiter (Ethan) was truly kind and easy going. He was aware of the situation and did his best to make it better! He delivered the best possible service that a waiter could offer. If it wasn&#39;t for Ethan or Cindy, the night would&#39;ve been HORRIBLE!<br><br>Between the horrible interaction we&#39;ve had with Josh and an unknown waiter, and the wonderful help and true customer service from Cindy and Ethan we&#39;re giving this restaurant 2-stars.<br><br>UPDATE (2 weeks later 8/25)<br>I contacted their GM (the next day) to inform him about Josh&#39;s actions, and he apologized and said he&#39;d send a letter to me as a &#34;formal apology.&#34; Well,  2 weeks later and still no word. Their customer service isn&#39;t about the customer. It&#39;s about their bottom line! Don&#39;t spend your hard earned money here. Their GM doesn&#39;t care so I can see why their manager wouldn&#39;t either.

This visit was probably the best experience we had. My family was visiting Utah and we decided to play it safe with dinner. The wait on a Saturday night was 65-85 minutes. Thankfully I suggested we eat at the bar area since it&#39;s first come first serve.<br><br>Our waiter Ron is the highlight of my review.  Ron was very professional,  observant,  and had a great personality. We enjoyed his jokes and his suggestions.  The hibiscus lemonade was &#34;off the hook&#34; as Ron said. During the service he made sure all our drinks were filled. He checked on us when we were eating and also had time to share a few things about himself.<br><br>We can not wait to go back to cheesecake factory in utah! It was definitely worth the long line.

I love this place, the food is amazing. I order the shepherd&#39;s Pie and it is terrific. on my last visit with my family we were seated near the door which left us in a breeze each time someone entered the restaurant. Also we were directly behind the waiting area so little children kept peering over the divider at the 6 of us while we ate. Other than the chocolate milk my 11 year old ordered being not very chocolate (it was barely a tan color) the food was exceptional. My 16 year old commented that his burger was the best he had ever eaten. As for the service, it was a little slow, but with the restaurant being crowded I can forgive that. Yes its a little pricey, but if you know that going in there won&#39;t be any surprises.

The food at every Cheesecake Factory is consistently good but the service here in Salt Lake City was pretty dismal.   Also, the strange thing about almost every one we have been to is that it is a huge hassle when you ask for more bread.    This restaurant was no exception.    They act like it&#39;s a very bi
Awesome selection of food,  but for the price paid,  the food, while good, wasn&#39;t all that!  We did love the cheesecake though.

I love this place cheesecake factory is the Ultimate if you want to go have a great meal with your family  just with a Q day every time I come here the customer service is always on point and the food is always on point as well.

I try to avoid &#34;chain&#34; restaurants when on vacation; but a member of our party wanted to go here, so I caved in.  And was so sorry later.  The best part of this place was the personality of our waiter; however, when the fried shrimp I ordered came out BURNED, he said &#34;Yes, I saw that coming out&#34;.  Okay, if you saw it, why did it come to my table.  After it was taken away, I went to the restroom and the others in my party said the manager came and offered a soup or salad complimentary.  Thank you, but no, I wanted shrimp.  By the time I got it, the rest of my party had almost finished their dinners, so I didn&#39;t finish mine.  <br>This just reaffirms why I avoid chain restaurants.

Great selections on the menu. Food was good, I got the Fish &amp; Chips and my wife got the Chicken Avocado Sandwich. The fish was cooked well, but the breading was pretty greasy. More so than what I&#39;ve had at other places. <br><br>The White Chocolate Raspberry Cheesecake was great. My thoughts summed up: Good place to eat, maybe $2-3 overpriced per plate. But I&#39;ll definitely go again.

The food was mediocre a.k.a okay. Not sure about the service there though because our waitress didn&#39;t seem friendly and too happy to serve us.  She didn&#39;t even bother to ask if we wanted some refill of their complimentary breads and she wasn&#39;t attentive. Not sure if this is typical of their behavior being that it&#39;s a Mormon state therefore pple there seem sort of racist, rude, and very snobby.  We had the same experience at the airport, other restaurants and from Uber drivers.  We&#39;re from California which is more of a diverse cultural state so it was an odd experience for us visiting Salt Lake City, UT with pple&#39;s unfriendly behavioral there.

This is one of the nicer Cheesecake Factory restos out there. Staff are nice and courteous even if they&#39;re not the ones assigned to your table. Food is excellent. I had a burger with mushrooms and it was delicious. Appetizer salad was huge. Fish taco was yummy. I like how it&#39;s not dark in the restaurant during lunchtime. Bathroom was super clean, too.

This is a good place to take a break from shopping to eat and relax. There is usually a long wait since they don&#39;t take reservations. But their cheesecake and Parmesan crusted chicken Romano are worth it!! We usually fill up on their hot brown and sourdough breads with butter before our entrees, but we plan on taking some home because you have to get dessert too!

I love their cheesecakes!!!!<br><br>Cons: Their menu is huge!!! Makes it hard to go through it all and decide what you want to eat. Their food is also a little bit more on the pricey side, but the food was delicious. I got the Smokehouse BBQ Burger, it was affordable and delicious. They come with your choose of salad or fries. A No-brainer decision for me to choose fries.<br><br>Their list of cheesecakes are huge. It took me over 5 minutes to decide which one to get. Whichever one you decide, you will love it! But be warned... its about $7-8 a slice and its loaded with calories... I wouldn&#39;t be surprised if we are talking about 1000 calories a slice. But I love it!!!

I&#39;ve been to Cheescake Factory so many times, I&#39;ve lost count.  This, however, was my first visit to the Salt Lake City downtown location at City Creek.  <br><br>As with all Cheesecake Factory&#39;s, the setting is nice, the food is good and the overall experience is relatively positive.  I would have to agree here too; however, the service here was below average.  Overbearing waiter at first and then he disappears.  Some things forgotten (i.e. dressing with the salad).  Service issues could definitely be addressed here.<br><br>Also, minus a star for discontinuing the Salmon Genovese on the menu....that was my favorite thing!  I can&#39;t believe they got rid of it.  Bring it back now!!

So I&#39;m giving cheesecake factory a 5 star solely because​ I love their cheesecake. I&#39;ve eaten here on several occasions and haven&#39;t been too impressed with their food, but man, their cheesecake is perfect. At this location, their service is really quick and all the waiters and waitresses are friendly and on top of things. If I&#39;m ever craving cheesecake, this is definitely the place that I go to.

I love the Cheesecake Factory, but I was a bit disappointed with this one. To be fair, we came during Comicon, &amp; the festivities really put a damper on good service in a reasonable amount of time anywhere in downtown SLC. With that being said, the employees here seemed exhausted by anyone that they came in contact with. We opted to grab cheesecake  &amp; some hot chocolate &amp; return to our hotel given the long wait. Considering we had a flight the next morning, it ended up working out for us. Had we wanted to spend some time in downtown SLC, the lack of customer service might have been further disappointing.

I really like the location of this restaurant, minus the parking!! I don&#39;t know anyone who likes to park in that area,right?!  The customer service is always great at this location, I have always had a great experience at this location.  <br><br>Food wise, I am a big fan of the Chicken Little&#39;s, although the portion they put is not so little, but who is gonna complain about them putting too much food...NOT me!!! Leftovers are great!!  I have tried different pasta dishes that they have, and I wasn&#39;t wowed, but the chicken little&#39;s always wins with me. The chicken is cooked well, yet moist which wins a lot of points with my belly. haha

Aloha, <br>Visited Cheescake Factory on the way home form a yellowstone trip June 10th, 2015...It was crowded, and we decided to the 4 of us, My wife, Baby V and Son Dima decided to wait for an outside Table. When we finally were guided to our seats, we found our baby carriage couldn&#39;t be accommodated! We were upset, as we waited 25 minutes for the seat. The manager came, and introduced himself as Michael. He was super professional and accommodating. Listen, problems occur in life. It HOW they are handled that differentiate a good experience from a bad one. Michael is a professional. He was empathetic and got us seated in a location that would accommodate the babies carriage...What can i say. He solved our issue as best as could be done with minimal drama. The meal was fine afterward....<br>Mahalo Michael!!!
Had a very enjoyable dinner at the cheesecake factory in the city creek this evening. Cody S did an outstanding job regarding service even in an extremely busy weekend environment.

We came on Dec 24th  around 930pm, there was 6 of us ordering 6 cheesecake, 2 coffee. After 30 finally our server came by, took our order. 20 min later my coffee arrive and and other 21 min our cheese cake arrived . It wasn&#39;t that crazy on that night. We waited for 15 min to have our card swipe . What&#39;s going on cheesecake? I have to pick up our own to go boxes.

I used to be a fan of this restaurant, especially for a chain. My last few experiences here have been disappointing enough to want to write this review. We went around 8:30 on a Friday night with a larger group (5 adults and 5 kids, two of whom are smaller). We were told the wait would be 45 minutes, which makes sense on a Friday night. We told the hostess we had a party of 10 and needed that to include two high chairs. They gave us our number and we waited....and waited.....and waited. Finally after an hour an a half we asked the hostess how much longer it would be. She told us we were getting close and that a certain party had to leave before we could be seated. All this would have been fine if the service and food had been decent. When we were taken to our seat we were short both chairs and high chairs. The person seating us said our booking had been listed for 8 people. We told him we couldn&#39;t all sit and he shrugged and walked away. We had to flag someone else down who told us we couldn&#39;t scoot the open table next to us over because they were about to use it. They wanted all 10 of us to sit around two four tops scooted together. We finally were able to get someone to allow us to move the additional table and then they had to go pull two high chairs out of a storage closet to get our kids seated. The waiter then brought us water and we ordered drinks. He shorted us a water for one of the kids so I asked him for an additional water and we ordered drinks besides that. We had enough time during the seating wait to know exactly what we wanted to order, but it was almost another 25 minutes before he brought out the drinks and bread and at that point he still forgot the water for the kid he missed in the first place. I asked him for it again and we were able to order our food. We were on two checks and just on our check we ordered well over 100 dollars worth of food (more like $150). Of that only one of the dishes was even half decent, which was the Buffalitos. We ordered factory nachos and they took so long to come out that the entire plate was soggy and cold. We also ordered Chicken Bellagio and one whole breast was nothing but fat and gristle. There was also some weird colored fat on the prosciutto, which is usually quite good. The worst of the meals was the Factory Burrito. It was old and dry and tasted like it had been made and then sat for hours under a heat lamp. The food took so long to come out that this could have been sitting for a long time. The others who were with us also ordered Apple Juices for their kids which came out after two reminders and once we had ordered dessert. The cheesecake itself we took to go because it was so late. The 30th anniversary was half frozen and put into the wrong container so that it was completely squished. Overall what should have been a fun night out that we saved to splurge on was stressful and disappointing. I actually contacted the restaurant directly about these issues before posting my review on yelp. I wanted to give them a chance to respond directly, but this was the second time in a row we&#39;ve had a poor experience and I haven&#39;t heard a word back despite reaching out.

It was a 30 minute wait on a Monday night. We waited about 20 minutes. Not bad. Our server was training someone, so it took awhile to get our order in. We ordered drinks/food at the same time since we had so much time to look over the menu. The food arrived very fast. In fact, our appetizers and food arrived together which didn&#39;t bother us. All of our food was delicious. My husband said it was the best steak he has eaten in awhile. We had mango/keylime pie cheesecake. It was delicious. We are happy with the service and the food quality.

I ordered through Grubhub, and boy was I disappointed. I ordered the chicken Madeira. I understand that usually getting food to go from a sit down restaurant isn&#39;t as good, but it&#39;s like they didn&#39;t even finish making my dish. It was barely luke warm, the asparagus was basically raw, not to mention the MADIERA sauce was missing from the chicken MADEIRA. Maybe the food is better if you go in, but I wouldn&#39;t bet on it.

Terrible experience! Ordered take-out but so many people were congregating in the main area that you cant breathe. I was told 20-25 minutes and it took 45 minutes. The same people serving the cheesecake have to run to the kitchen to check on hot orders. Salad was terrible and not worth the long wait.  Management needs to control the crowd. Its unsanitary for waiters to squeeze between waiting guests and carry desserts. Who wants dropping hair and peoples sweat in their food?

The food at this specific location and, the wait staff were mediocre to say the least... I thought well, maybe someone has called out or, maybe they aren&#39;t scheduled to the volume of customers they anticipated. I thought this until I noticed our server helping give hugs and creating conversation with several other staff members when, we were still waiting on items we kindly requested multiple times now. Disappointed I wasted a meal at this place. The food was also very &#34;off&#34; the normal flavors of the same items I have ordered at other Cheesecake Factory locations. All around just an unsatisfying experience. Hoping this turns around for other patrons.

This is always a family favorite restaurant for large groups and birthday celebrations!!<br><br>Tonight I had the turkey burger-gluten free and sweet potato fries. It was delicious and for our party the food came out fast and hot!!<br><br>I always have to go with the carrot cake here although it is the cheese cake factory.... The carrot cake is very moist and flavorful that I can&#39;t switch from it!!!  <br><br>Our waitress had a great attitude and was very personable!!

Wife and I go to this place occasionally. As an European I must admit it is one of the better restaurants with an wide variety of choices. One day my mom visited and we thought it will be nice to introduce her to the cheesecake factory. She had a good time, until the moment came we asked for the bill. Well we all know how tipping works. Tipping is an American culture. My mom did not understand that as well waitresses really want tips. The point of this is. That out waitress got into a discussion, educating an very smart intelligent person. That she need to tip because that is how they survive. I was so embarrassed for they way my mom got treated.<br>Please don&#39;t get into discussion that you need to be tipped cheesecake factory, that is very low behavior. <br><br>Hint: we did leave an tip, but much lower we planned after that incident.
My wife does not think the Caesar salad is good. The dressing is not as tasty. Not enough Parmesan cheese. My grill salmon is average. The restaurant is good, waiter has good customer services.

In town for business and found a yearn&#39;n for dinner and cheesecake. I&#39;ve been to this location before and was not disappointed. At 5:30pm I was seated within 5 minutes, and had bread and drink in hand in 10min.<br><br>I went with the chicken stuffed tortillas for a first-time try. A very good dish indeed. Took my favorite slice of healthy super food Godiva Chocolate cheesecake to go as the entree&#39; did me in and there was no room. Great hostess and server!
Food was average. Not really special. The cheesecake was also not special. We expected more given the name the place had.

Had lunch here with my wife. We are regular customers at our nearest CCF back in Fairfax, VA. Seated promptly. Ordered the raspberry lemonade. Even with the sugar coated rim it was too tart for me but my wife liked it. I switched to Coke. We split the Lunch Green Salad with mixed greens, tomato and cucumber. I love their balsamic vinaigrette dressing. She ordered the Chicken Bellagio one of her favorites. It was perfectly prepared. She took half home. I ordered the lunch spaghetti carbonara. A little more saucy than I like it but tasty. We were so full we skipped dessert. Will go back.

Food was very good. 7 people in our party and we each had a different cheesecake and they were all delicious. The only issue was the homeless gentleman sitting next to us who kept begging for our food.

It&#39;s been awhile since I&#39;ve been to a Cheesecake and oh how much I missed this place.  I had forgotten how good the food is and the portions are humongous but you pay for what you get.  The prices are slightly steep at $12-$18/dish at night but you&#39;ll always have leftovers to take home.<br><br>The cheesecake is what I come here for and never fails.  The only gripe (or two) are the wait is at least an hour on weekends and the bathroom gets dirty, fast!

Horrible experience at this location. I called a few days before my birthday to try to secure a spot at one the the large tables in a party room. I had specified that I had a party of about 20 people and they said that it would no problem and practically guaranteed me a spot because &#34;Tuesday nights are always dead.&#34; My party and I arrive to the restaurant and the wait time was TWO HOURS. Very disorganised, and considering it was my birthday was even more disappointing.

I don&#39;t really like the Cheesecake Factory for regular food - just the cheesecake. We headed on over to this location, because we were walking round the fancy mall, and decided it was time for some sweets. I did order an appetizer of stuffed parmesan mushrooms, a long island iced tea, and a tiramisu cheesecake slice. <br><br>The mushrooms were good but I&#39;ve had better and the Long Island was good but I&#39;ve also had better. I topped off the meal with their &#34;elegant martini,&#34; which is another word for &#34;dirty martini&#34; and that bastard did not disappoint! It was strong, dirty, and tasty! Unfortunately I was so full that I could not finish the two blue cheese stuffed olives that were in the drink. I was annoyed but it was my own fault. <br><br>Oh, and the tiramisu cheesecake was to die for. Their cheesecake usually is. <br><br>I can go for a martini right about now, though.

We were there for a late lunch on a Monday. Service was very friendly and the menu is more or less the standard Cheesecake Factory menu  - no big surprises, well prepared good value for the money. We like also the new line with dishes below 600 cal.

Really long wait even after the buzzer went off. Even people after us were seated before us. This is such bad service. Someone should look into it. Manager change possibly?<br><br>Update: so initially I gave one star, however I think the employees are just having a hard day. Let&#39;s bump this up to 4 stars and give them the benefit of the doubt. Our waiter seems like a nice guy.

i went shopping with my mom at city creek and she was getting hungry so we came here for lunch.  i was worried it&#39;d be packed at lunch time, but surprisingly we were immediately seated.  it&#39;s a large restaurant and they also have outdoor seating which is nice.  our server was okay and i wasn&#39;t too impressed.  i felt like he was rushing us the whole time and he didn&#39;t come back to check on our food.  he also brought our bill out immediately without even asking us if we wanted dessert or needed anything else.  <br><br>the food itself was okay.  we got the guacamole and herb crusted salmon salad to share.  the guacamole was okay and there was no kick to it at all, very mild.  i don&#39;t even like spicy, but this guacamole was boring and very bland.  it needed at least more lime juice.  the salmon salad was also just okay.  it was a good portion for two people, but the flavor didn&#39;t really stand out to me.  vinaigrette dressing was too oily and we didn&#39;t even finish our salad.  <br><br>overall i&#39;d skip this place next time.  there are lots of places to eat downtown and next time i&#39;ll convince my mom to go eat outside of city creek.

My family loves this place. The inside is very interesting. My husband only likes the filet mignon, which is actually really good, I&#39;d choose this as well. I usually get the eggplant Parmesan which tastes really good, but it&#39;s pretty popular, so try to find something else just in case they don&#39;t have it that day. Even though their menu is big, there aren&#39;t a lot of good menu items. I&#39;ve tried many things here, and I only like three things. Filet mignon, eggplant Parmesan, and super antioxidant salad. The flavors of the other items are pretty mediocre for how much the food costs. I suggest asking the server more detail of their food. It can be either really good or really disappointing.

The Cheesecake Factory is always a great choice because of several reasons; nice decor, fun ambiance, huge selection for the menu and gigantic portions. We went on July 24th in the evening, we started off and ordered the crab cakes for an appetizer, Wow it was crunchy on the outside and moist on the inside for 13.95 for 3 patties, it was justified. I had the Cajon jumbolya pasta and it was massive with plenty of seafood on top of a hearty pasta noodle. My wife had gumbo over brown rice, it was flavorful and plenty of authentic flavor the gumbo was chunky, full of sausage, lean chicken and spicy . Never would&#39;ve guessed cheesecake would have good soul food. You really can&#39;t go wrong with Cheesecake factory.

My last two times dining here have been terrible. This location is going downhill fast! I wish I took a picture of our food, the portions were so small! It was pathetic. AND our waiter was the worst, very bad at his job! I need to call in about him, because I did not get his name. I used to love Cheesecake Factory, but now I will have to stay away :( I am sad about this, but I guess now I can explore other restaurants instead of always choosing this restaurant first.
I love the City Creek Cheesecake Factory. The staff is so friendly and the food is amazing. 5 star restaurant
Two hour wait and I can&#39;t  order a cocktail... No bar and can&#39;t order from anyone to make the wait a little more enjoyable. Yeah, will never ever come back here.
My grandson loved it here, especially the Hershey cheesecake. I love the mango lime. Main courses are fine

Wow talk about bad service. Our waiter checked on us once but checked on his buddy sitting at the next table about 20 times.
