Never got a refill on water or bread and waited 20 minutes to get our check. Oh wait we didn&#39;t we had to snag him when he was talking to his buddy and just give him our card with no bill. Talk about ridiculous

Everyone raves about this place, but it&#39;s not that great.  The service isn&#39;t that good - when my shrimp came out it was frozen, so they brought me out some more shrimp that was just nasty.  I&#39;m not going to lie, some plates are delicious.  I just think it&#39;s over-rated.
I ordered curbside pickup, and they forgot the cheesecake in my order. So, thanks I guess?

Food and service excellent, large portions. Had healthy offerings at a restaurant that you might think of as just calorie-laden. Very clean restrooms. Enjoyed sitting on the patio and experiencing downtown Salt Lake City. And of course the cheesecake was to die for .

Our expectations were very low.  We visited at 10 at night on Thursday and the only reason we chose CF was because it was one of the only places still open.  We were pleasantly surprised.  The service was great!  We ordered a bunch of appetizers: stuffed mushrooms, parmesan cheesy garlic bread, shrimp spring rolls, potato tots, Greek salad, and warm asparagus salad.   <br><br>We liked all the dishes but the shrimp spring rolls which were a disappointment because we couldn&#39;t taste any shrimp.  The Greek salad was the best I&#39;ve had and Greek salad is one of my favorites. The produce seemed fresh and high quality.  We also liked the chocolate tuxedo cheesecake we had for dessert.  Thanks CF for hitting the spot when we needed it!

So I went to the Cheesecake factory but didn&#39;t try any cheesecake. It was Valentine&#39;s day at about 4:30pm. When we went in, there was about a 5 minute wait. As time went on, I was sure that became at least a 30 minute wait. It was getting packed!<br><br>Anyway, I got the filet mignon. This was actually the first filet mignon I&#39;ve ever had. It was delicious! Such a tender and big cut of meat. It was well prepared. The service here was excellent. Our waiter kept on constantly checking on us by filling our drinks and just asking how everything&#39;s going.<br><br>This place was pretty pricy. I think I&#39;d save it for more special occasions. But I know when I do go here, it&#39;ll be well worth it!

I normally love Cheesecake Factory but our experience at this one was maddening. We went in at about 4:30 or so today (Thursday). We had to wait a few minutes to be seated even though it was not busy at all. But that was no big deal, it was only a few minutes. <br>After being seated in an area where the were no other customers we waited for a server, there were plenty around and, like I said, it was not busy at all. <br>Anyway, we waited...and waited...and waited to be at least acknowledged. But nope. Nothing. Nada. Zip. Tried to politely get someone&#39;s attention, but it was like we were ghosts.  <br>I&#39;m usually pretty patient but this was ridiculous. As I said before, the place was not busy, there were plenty of servers walking around or chatting with each other. If someone would have at least acknowledged us in some fashion, we wouldn&#39;t have been so infuriated.  <br>But we were. <br>Finally, we just got up and left, mentioning that we had been ignored. <br>No excuse for such bad service.

Very good experience, especially if you eat here on a Sunday! There was no wait and the service was efficient and friendly. I ordered the salmon special which was extremely good and reasonable for what you get. It had a sort of plumb glaze and was served atop a bed of rice with a relish of vegetables and a delicious chimi churi type sauce.

We went for dinner before a concert and had a great experience! Our meal was delicious and the service was exceptional. The restaurant was extremely busy but our server McKay was very attentive and friendly.  We placed our order and a short time later found out that the kitchen was having trouble with one of the ingredients in our dish. McKay was very nice and explained it to us. He gave us some great options and even Discounted our meal for the trouble. He was one of THE BEST servers I have ever had. We&#39;ll definitely be back. Thanks for making it a great evening.

My favorite chain.  I&#39;ll admit it, I&#39;m a sucker for this stuff.  Great (albeit extremely caloric) cheesecake.  Huge portions.  The best veggie burger I&#39;ve had at a chain.  Yes, long waits, huge menu, overpriced steak (for the quality).  <br><br>I also don&#39;t get the fascination with the chicken madeira.  You can buy a good madeira wine from the liquor store for $10 and make several servings of the stuff.  Buy quality chicken and brine it and you&#39;re in business.  <br><br>Anyway, it&#39;s not Copper Onion and certainly not Forage, but it&#39;s my guilty pleasure.  I do try to support the local places / Mom and Pop dives, but CCF has always been a favorite.

I got a slice of the Chocolate and hazelnut cheesecake. It was really good, especially with the Nutella on top! <br>My California cheesesteak was instead really really dry...I was VERY DISAPPOINTED.<br>The place is nice and elegant, but I think that they are really overrated and overpriced.<br>$27,87 for a piece of cheesecake and a cheesesteak?!?!? C&#39;mon...

Had dinner here on a Saturday night. It took about 30--40 minutes wait.<br><br>Pros:<br>-pizza--chicken, delicious!<br>-Cajun Jambayan pasta--3/5, could use a bit of spice. Chicken was tender and good<br>-mushroom lettuce wrap--good<br>-complimentary brown bread--reason why I went here--yay---coming back just for it. <br>-decor--inside and outside are great!<br>-family friendly<br><br>Cons:<br>-wait was too long but they have a good system. It&#39;s next to a lot of shops so my friend and I went shopping while the rest of the team waited :)<br>- 1 for the Jambalayn pasta--need more spice for it to be called Cajun! <br><br>Recommend this place for<br>-dates-

Consistently good food and service.  Am knocking down one star for their inability to seat a party of 8 together.  We are talking Salt Lake and Mormans and large families.  Took a group for lunch and without a reservation we had to sit at a table and a booth near each other.

When you have been to one Cheesecake Factory, you&#39;ve been to them all, but I did have a nice dinner experience here on my last night in Salt Lake City.  All of the staff members were polite, our food came out in a reasonable amount of time given it was a Saturday night, and we thoroughly enjoyed our meal.  I would visit this Cheesecake Factory again if I were in SLC.
You can always count on cheese cake factory to do all the things right. Staff at this location is always really nice!

WOW...a ton of negative reviews....  But as far as chain restaurants go... I liked it.  <br><br>The food did come out a little slow, but the server informed me that they had a party of 75 upstairs and it was taking a little longer that expected.  We didn&#39;t mind, we had time (and the manager did come over and inform us as well).<br><br>The crab cakes could have been cooked just a little more (not crispy enough).  The pasta was yummy and I am glad that we have a cheesecake factory closer to my home.<br><br>It won&#39;t be a destination restaurant for me, but when I&#39;m kicking around the mall it will always be one of those places I consider... just because you know what you will get...

Not a fan of chains, but while in the City Creek Center area, we were starving and decided that this looked appealing so we ventured in.<br><br>If you&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory before, you&#39;ve been to this one. The one addition I will add that was a plus was that it had more of an elegant atmosphere, less family style atmosphere, which I can appreciate. <br><br>I had the veggie burger, which I had not ever ordered from Cheesecake before. It came with a side of fries, and I ordered a margarita which were all wonderful! The veggie burger was firm, not too mushy, but perhaps the best part of it was the side of spicy mayo that came with it. Holy crap, this was like crack in a ramekin! <br><br>Our server was awesome, on top of his game, without being pushy or cheesy. We got cheesecake to-go to eat later at the hotel. I got my fave, the Godiva cheesecake, but there are a million options to choose from. I&#39;ve never met a cheesecake I didn&#39;t like.
We went on a Saturday night at 9:30. The line was out the door. You should probably plan on dinner somewhere else in SLC. I usually love this place, but go to another location.
This is the pinnacle of chain restaurant hell. I am humiliated that I have to eat here. No restaurant should be frequented that tries to serve every style food under the sun.

I&#39;ve never gotten something from Cheesecake Factory I didn&#39;t enjoy. That was until last night. We told our waiter we didn&#39;t like our meal and he was very kind and quick to bring us something else. I&#39;ve never experienced bad customer service AT THIS LOCATION. Cheesecakes are all wonderful.
Vomit in the urinal. I watched a table stay dirty for 15 minutes after guests got up. Male host was incredibly rude. I left.

Horrible Service!!! We waited at least 45 mins to be seated then we sat for another 30mins before we got our drinks and it was 50mins from when we were seated before we had bread. Finally 30 mins later we had our food. The food was cold and multiple orders were wrong. When we talked to the manager all he could do was make excuses and defend his cook. Total lack of customer service!!! The manager finally took one item of our bill after a 10min discussion of why it wasn&#39;t his fault!! I guess they don&#39;t want my business!  I highly suggest finding a different restaurant that has good food, warm food and who cares about their customers!!!
The chicken madeira is exceptional. With all the variety of food on the menu I wish I could try everything but I feel as though I am cheating on perfection if I choose something else!

Went on a Friday night close to Christmas.  Fagettabout the Line.  Way too long of a wait.  I hear it is typical on the weekends at this location so we went elsewhere.  Since we were staying at a hotel at City Creek we tried again on Sunday.  One of the only restaurants downtown that was open.  No line!  We were seated promptly and had a great server.  The meal was to die for.  I had steak and chicken that was incredibly delicious. Mashed potatoes oh soooooo good.  You can&#39;t leave the place without having a slice of cheesecake.  The best on the planet!  Server, Gabriel is outstanding!

We went to dinner with friends and always enjoy the decor and atmosphere is fine, except it is always crowded and loud.  Make sure to request a booth as the tables are so close to each other it would be hard to have a halfway private conversation.   Our server was pleasant and attentive.  The menu is so extensive and they were able to accommodate my special requests with food choice.  I think for the price, there are many other local restaurants that deserve your business.  But after a day of shopping with the family or a few friends, this is a good choice.  Just go early and put your name in as a typical wait time after 6pm is 45 min on the weekend.

We always enjoy CF when we have the chance to eat at one... Especially with the kids. <br><br>Everything started off great until we ordered, then the wait began. And we waited... Waited... 20 minutes later our drinks arrived. Another 20 minutes went by, and we called our waiter over to inquire about our starter. &#34;Oops, I forgot to put it in&#34;. ::sigh:: &#34;Ok, forget it we will wait for the mains, but can you put another drink order in for us?. 20 minutes later the mains show up and the drinks have not come yet. Oh, and the kids food was forgotten as well. ::sigh:: guess we won&#39;t try to wait for dessert, which is half the reason we came. Let&#39;s go hit the frozen yogurt stand instead so we can get to bed before sunrise.

Last night we were told our wait would be 50 minutes. It turned out to be about 70. The manager apologized about that without us even mentioning it so that was cool.<br><br>I do love their bread, and the fact that they refill it. I&#39;ve had their pizza, nachos, burgers, and pasta in the past. This still I tried the macaroni and cheese burger. Just average. Buns were toasted almost to a burnt point. The meat patty didn&#39;t have much flavor or juiciness to it. <br><br>I think the main thing you gotta do is stick with the pasta dishes. I feel like their tastiest meals are on the pasta menu. Cheesecake is awesome.

The most awful place to go to. <br>The host was rude and dishonest. <br>I do not recommend you to go to the city creek location. <br><br>It is not the same experience I had in fashion place. It was much better experience. <br><br>I will never ever ever come back. <br><br>I wish you chapter 11.

TL;DR <br>*Service 5/5<br>*Atmosphere 4/5<br>*Food 1/5<br>This may have been my last time.<br><br>Went last night. My date and I came hungry. In fact we planned on going to another restaurant but the power was out in their area so we decided on the Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>*Service was great, 5/5<br>We arrived a little after 8pm and despite seeing several large groups waiting in the lobby they were able to seat the two of us in just a couple of minutes.<br><br>Our waiter was there when we needed and allowed us space to talk and eat.<br><br>*Atmosphere was good, 4/5<br>Our placement wasn&#39;t the greatest but I can&#39;t complain. It would&#39;ve been nice to have a little more room between our table and the other patrons. The dim lighting was on the dark side, but I can see that they were setting it up to be more of an intimate dining experience.<br><br>*Food, 1/5<br>The free bread before the meal was better than the chicken carbonara. Before I ordered I asked our waiter to weigh in on a couple of dishes I was deciding between, they recommend the chicken carbonara.<br><br>The presentation was bad. Before I even tried it I could tell it must&#39;ve been sitting in the window for 20min. It&#39;s possible this was ordered by someone else and sent back.<br><br>The dish lacked flavor, was stale and old, lukewarm at best, and extremely oily. Even if the food had come straight from the kitchen it wouldn&#39;t have made up for the lack of taste. Nothing about the food was fresh, from the pasta to the peas.<br><br>*Wrap-Up<br>I&#39;ve been several times before, generally with a big group. Usually I&#39;m excited to go back and try something else, but this time I left thinking it was my last.<br><br>It was bad enough that after getting home I hunted for food from the fridge and cupboards.<br><br>What happened to the quality of food? Where did the freshness go? Where are the spices and flavor?
Other than being a popular place with a little bit of wait at times we loved the experience and the food and had great service.

Pretty disappointed with this location. Typically the Cheesecake Factory is always at least 4 or 5 stars. But this one really disappointed me.<br>We were seated in the most awkward location. It was just two of us, we were pushed up against a wall and one foot away from us was another table of 4 really loud and obnoxious people.<br>When there was obviously plenty of other open tables.<br>Next, our food was cold! I ordered gf pasta which is normally outstanding. What I think happened was it was made, and then left out. And it cooled, a lot. The only reason we kept it to eat was because we were in a hurry.<br>Our server seemed like he didn&#39;t quite care, once we mentioned we were in a hurry he stopped making eye contact.<br>We also did not get any bread before our meal. Not that I could eat it anyway, but my husband was missing it. Especially when everyone around us had some.<br>Also, our check didn&#39;t come in a booklet. He just handed us this slip of paper and we were kind of confused why everyone around us got booklets but not us.<br>This was probably the worst customer service we&#39;ve ever received from a Cheesecake Factory.

My husband and I both got food poisoning from the food we ordered on New Year&#39;s Eve. The server did not follow the health code and our food was cold. Spoke with the supervisor, he is absolutely rude. Go to other Cheesecake Factory and stay away from this location. Horrible service and horrible food.

I&#39;ve been to this location multiple times and I&#39;m always disappointed. Tonight I order curbside to go. Ordered an appetizer and the shrimp and angel hair pasta. Was about 5 minutes away when they called me to tell me that they were out of the appetizer and offered to make something else which was nice. I get there and food is ready. I get home to find out the pasta was way over cooked. I decided not to suffer through it and I had to make dinner. Looks like I paid 18 bucks for 5 pieces of shrimp and some bread. This was the last time I tried this place. The quality of the food is not worth the price. Gave it two stars because the girl working there was nice and helpful.

The nachos tasted were good and then I felt sick for 2 1/2 days, the Kobe burger wasn&#39;t good either, ordered it medium and it was bloody and very red. Ordered 1/2 sweet potato fries and 1/2 regular fries,  5 minutes after the burger came out the regular fries arrived and were really, really bland and boring and the sweet potato fries kept &#34;being almost done&#34; but never came.<br>Won&#39;t go back, we had a gift card and even for a free meal it sucked

I&#39;m pretty against chain/franchise restaurants... But I can&#39;t be against something that is legitimately good, and tasty, and SO MUCH FOOD IN A PLATE.<br><br>Their location first of all is gold, with not only perfect downtown location, but also in the City Creek Mall. Good deal to go there after shopping, or walking around downtown.<br><br>Their service is always great. Their food is always well prepared, and always impressing with their cheesecakes, which truly are a joy to any human being that likes cheesecake (Which should be everyone).<br><br>I love their nachos with the chicken. The presentation for the nachos is great, but the flavor, the texture... the toppings...! the actual chips!!! Thick and crunchy, but not annoying. Great Guacamole, jalapenos, cheese, creamy cheese, onions. sour cream... and the chicken. SHIIIIIIIII. The chicken is so well made. Perfect seasoning, perfect texture... ahh... I&#39;m pretty in love with these nachos.<br><br>One nice disclosure: They do not validate parking for City Creek. So don&#39;t expect to get your parking paid. They do have a good valet system right beside the restaurant.<br>Also, lots of seating, and nice outside seating too.<br><br>Chessecake Factory is always a safe choice, since their menu is HUGE. And their quality is pretty good for the most part. But it&#39;s not a magical local experience. Or an organic heaven. It&#39;s a multistate establishment, like chili&#39;s and restaurants of that sort, with a bigger menu and &#34;nicer&#34; food.<br><br>ALSO, I would definitely stay away from their lemonades/limeades. They are extremely terrible. But that&#39;s it. Also, Chicken Bellagio is quite the plate.

Honestly i would gave them a zero star if i could. please let me gave you a little background. This was Wednesday, 09/09/2015. my boyfriend and i went there around 5pm, the restaurant had some customers but not like dinner hours packed.<br><br>Let&#39;s just start off with the server. We got a guy server, after we ordered our drinks and food he never came back to us for good 10-15 minutes. then a lady showed up say she&#39;s gonna be our server. I asked her to bring us some fresh bread because the ones that the pervious server brought to us was bit cold and hard to chew. She started to &#34;explain&#34; (in a harsh tone): &#34; all our bread are like that, i mean i could if you really want to but it&#39;s gonna be the same.&#34; i was like, &#34;the bread is very hard and i would like to have some fresh ones. please do so.&#34; She said, &#34; okay fine, i will bring you some!&#34; seriously, your job is to bring what customers want, not to argue with me how i want my bread!!<br><br>Then we got our food, till we finished our food, she never come by refill water/check on us/ anything. few minutes after we finished, she brought us the dessert menu but we decided to just skip it and asked her to bring us the check.<br><br>When my boyfriend got the check, he asked me, &#34; please tell me what does she mean?!&#34; he handed me the bill, the server circled the tips section and wrote a big &#34;thank you!&#34; right next to it. we both felt confused and uncomfortable, &#34;who would just circle the tips section? for what? to tell/ remind us that we need to tip her????&#34; <br><br>so my boyfriend went to talk to the manager, the manager of that night was a hispanic lady, she explained that the server circled it because not everyone knows to pay the tips, they circle tips on every single customers bill. my boyfriend said, &#34; did you check? because i really don&#39;t think she will circle the tips section on American customers&#39; bills.&#34; by the way, my boyfriend and i are both international college students (asians) but i don&#39;t think there&#39;s any communication/ language barriers that we had with the server or the manager. my boyfriend said to her, &#34; well this is not a comfortable situation, i felt that she is asking and reminding me for the tips.&#34; The manager just acted like it&#39;s not a big deal and said, &#34;oh sorry you felt offended, i will talk to her. you don&#39;t have to pay the tips if you don&#39;t want to.&#34;<br><br>We both live in the US for over 5 years, and this is the first time i learned that &#34;it&#39;s a common thing that servers circle tips section to remind customers to pay the tips.&#34; We left the restaurant that night so upset and pissed, not only because of the server but more the manager. Just because we don&#39;t look like &#34;American&#34;, so you just assumed that we don&#39;t know &#34;American culture&#34;?!!!!!!<br><br>WOW I AM SPEECHLESS!!

There were 6 adults, a toddler and an infant in our party.  Hostess said it would be a 20 minute wait to be seated if we would sit in a booth.  Otherwise it would be a 40 minute wait.  We chose the booth.  The booth was<br>in the back of the restaurant which was fine as it provided more room for a toddler and an infant in a stroller.  The hostess then told us we could not keep the infant in the stroller.  When we questioned why as there were other infants in strollers, the hostess said those infants were sleeping!  She said it was restaurant policy.  Had we not already waited 20 minutes we probably would have left.  Service was very slow, but the food was good.  When the infant fell asleep we retrieved the stroller from the front of the restaurant and put the sleeping infant in the stroller.  I would like to add that the sleeping infant and the toddler did not block the way of the staff or patrons.  We won&#39;t go back again!  I gave two stars for the food and cheesecake.

First if all the cheesecakes are great, hence the name of the restaurant. I waited 2 hours to be seated which is reasonable because it was super busy. Once seated, I ordered a filet mignon. Keep in mind this particular filet is the most tender and most expensive as well. Our waiter was great, especially for the restaurant being so busy,  Basically the only reason I don&#39;t give this place one star. After waiting another 40 minutes just to get my food, my filet arrived. First of all, it was super burnt, cut in half, and not even juicy or tender at all!!! 30 dollars for what literally looked like a meteor that hit my plate.  Not even exaggerating.  First sign that the chef sucked was the filet being cut in half. Second sign was the fact that it was already easy to cook since it was cut in half but even then, chef manages to burn the filet still!  One half of the  filet was literally charcoal black. Even a piece I kept staring at because it was just so black and hard that even a starving child in Africa wouldn&#39;t even eat it, not even look at it! The other half of the filet was barely even edible but still dry and had a taste that was 1 dollar worth. Not to be mean but I would bet all my money on McDonald&#39;s, because hell I&#39;m sure they can make a better filet and price it at 1 dollar. So not worth a 30 dollar price tag. I should have been refunded for this pathetic plate

When she told us 45 minutes to an hour wait, she meant to say &#34;we have no clue when you&#39;ll be sat.&#34; this place was good back in the early 2000s. seems like a fancy applebees. i wasn&#39;t impressed. I have a hard time blaming the servers, because I understand how difficult that job can be, and those servers are BUSY! Too busy to give great service, but not too busy to give mediocre service.<br><br>i&#39;ll come back for a takeout slice of cake.

The greeters in the front are especially rude here. But I&#39;m used to it I go to the cheese lake factory in California. The wait staff is always nice and the food is always great. But those front people are always  nasty. If there is a long wait I get my name in and then leave. Maybe they don&#39;t get enough tips. I dunt know

My wife and I with son and daughter in law and one year old grandson went to Cheesecake Factory in City Creek, SLC last night Feb 20, 2017 for dinner. Food was stupendous and I&#39;m a very picky eater. Server was very patient and attentive. I had the Steak Diane. OMG. To die for honestly. And at around $19.95 not even overpriced. Location in City Creek is very busy, but not too bad. The wait was 20 minutes I think, not bad for a busy President&#39;s Day weekend. Wish I could remember our servers name he was really good. Leave time for a wait, food unquestionably worth it. Parking was free for the first two hours but they validate a third hour so really that&#39;s plenty of time. I will definitely be back. - Paul L.

Second time here and terrible service. They were out of bread and understaffed for a Sunday night a week before Christmas. I used to be a big fan of Cheesecake Factory but my experiences with it in Utah have led me to the inevitable conclusion that they can&#39;t handle crowds. I chalk it up to management sucking big time. We weren&#39;t even given water until our appetizer arrived. I will probably never eat here again.

As a generic name, they have nothing special to offer. <br><br>Includes the same dim lighting, same cubicle like seating, trying-to-be-chirpy waiters and their long wait lines. On the flip side,  Service was fast, portions enough for 2 meals, pricey ( dinner for 2-$50). <br><br>Will be a long time before I go there agin. May try, if this is the only place that is open and you are starving for a week. At least you feel a sense of satiety for sure.

Came to this location once before about two years ago and the service was horrible. I thought we would give it another shot and guess what? It&#39;s STILL horrible. The soup was brought out cold; almost as if they opened a can and threw it in a bowl. The food was SUPER bland and after waiting for about 30 minutes for some damn cheese.... We decided to just pack up our bland ass food and leave. Never again. (Not to mention the waitress kept dropping our silverware)

Food was great wait was awful. We were seated quickly, but wait for our food was almost an hour. Then another hour after we were done eating to get our cheesecake slice (which was to go by the way) and ch

Great experience on a Saturday night. New general manager John, seated Us in the newly-appointed open seating in the bar area. The food was as consistently good as everywhere else and the service was outstanding. Cheesecake Factory has a standard from sea to shining sea.
Typical CCF,   but an awesome location ... <br>Right next a great mall.  Great layout and helpful polite staff
Inept service. Every table around us is waiting on something, a check, to go boxes, water, effing bread.

Wow!  What a poor experience!  The server was so incredibly rude,  interrupting our conversations to butt in and try to be a part of them,  thinking he was funny.  He asked a friend of ours if another one of our friends was drunk after one drink!  The food came out after sitting there for at least a half hour.  Crusty and overheated.  The service was slow and we ended up spending more than 3 hours there.

I had arrived at the Cheesecake Factory with my co-worker around 9:30pm. There was a good amount of people waiting to be seated. Luckily for us, since it was just two the wait was 10-15 minutes. I eyed the massive deserts and thought I had died and gone to heaven. The hostess seated us and the waitress greeted us warmly. She brought  warm pumpernickel bread which I gobbled quickly with butter. My co worker ordered the fried chicken sliders and I opted for the chicken Tucson. Grilled chicken with tomatoes, asparagus, broccoli doused with balsamic vinaigrette. The taste was lovely and the flavors married well together. The meal was quite massive for an entree which is normal at the factory. When his order came out he looked surprise as he picked it off the appetizer menu. It was a decent size for an entree ha ha. Any way we left there happy and stuffed. Did not have room for any dessert, and I have a huge sweet tooth:)  I will be back the atmosphere and ambience of the establishment was immensely inviting!!!

Very good service. We had a party of 26(ish) and they were all very attentive, and we got our food (allacard) very very quickly. They even put my ice cream in a separate to-go container so I could eat it then and for easy accessibility. Very,very good and friendly service.

So my wife and I and some friends had a horrible experience at brunch here a few months ago. I thought to myself that I would never come here again...at least for brunch. After some time my memory of how bad it was has faded. Today we gave it another try and SURPRISE it has been awful, the service surprisingly has been pretty good but the food was horrid. My pancakes were runny doe inside that was discussing. Our server asked if I wanted some French toast instead and I agreed, the French toast was bad at best and then when he gave me the bill he told me he went ahead and dropped the French toast off the bill for us...I only got the French Toast because you offered it me to attempt to make up for the nasty pancakes....thanks for dropping it off the bill. Of course the cheesecake is always delicious and we will continue to come here for that tasty treat but as far as brunch goes...run away.

So I was looking for a good place to eat but found everywhere to be up the ying yang busy. The cheesecake factory wait was 10 minutes! Fantastic if you ask me. <br><br>The staff was great. Very friendly and attentive. <br><br>I ordered the Mexican chicken lettuce wraps. The chicken was grilled, it had diced tomatoes, avocado, sour cream and salsa. The food was fresh and delicious. <br><br>Very good especially because it is a chain restaurant.

Having to wait for a table for 1 at 9pm? Sounds strange but ok.. 10min to order ok getting irritated.. 20min for Burger and fries to come out only for the Burger to come out pink when I said Well Done!!  I&#39;m done with this place.

Would you like garlic with a side of noodles?? Then get the fettuccine Alfredo. The dish looked wonderful and the noodles looked fresh. Unfortunately, the sauce was so heavily saturated with garlic I could not taste literally anything else. I ate about 5 bites of my 16 dollar pasta and my stomach was churning from the pungent garlic smell. I love garlic as much as the next person, but I could not stomach this. <br>Why not tell the waiter, you ask? Because he rarely showed up. It took him 15 minutes to fill our drinks. He asked for boxes and I told him I didn&#39;t care for dish and I did not want to take home. He completely ignored my statement and offered dessert. I would have if my appetite and patience were still intact. <br>I have never received good service here. But I continue to go because most of the food is great. However, this just tipped it for me. I don&#39;t think I can return to this establishment.

I will eat here but only if someone else is buying and I have nothing else to do that night. I always get the chicken madeira which is actually amazing, but the long wait times, very poorly lit and lout atmosphere, and poor customer service makes this place such a hassle. One of the worst things about it here is that they are constantly changing the menu. They will introduce really yummy entrees then take them away a few months later, and you dont know its gone until you have waited an hour for your table and have to ask the waiter why its not on the menu. The chessecake is good, and for that I would just order a slice to go and eat it at home where I can actually see what I&#39;m doing and hear the people talking to me.

This review is tough because I actually love cheesecake factory. This location is just sub par compared to other locations. Ordered takeout last night while passing through salt lake city. I ordered the chicken Madeira and a goat cheese and beet salad. Everything was just ok....bland and soggy. About 3 bites into my meal, I found a curly blonde hair....yup....wrapped around the asparagus. I completely lost my appetite and threw everything away. I wouldn&#39;t come back.

I kinda laugh at the notion that Cheesecake Factory is unique fine dining, but I also laugh at the thought that CF is the devil incarnate.  <br><br>The pros:<br>Beautiful atmosphere<br>Conveniently located<br>Excellent waitstaff<br>Huge portions<br><br>The cons:<br>Menu is too extensive<br>Horrible hosts<br>Quantity rules over quality<br>Tables are too close together in certain sections, making private conversation impossible<br><br>To me, CF is on par with Chili&#39;s or Applebee&#39;s. It&#39;s just there, I never crave it, and it&#39;s simply not worth waiting more than 5 minutes to be seated.

Food was good, can out cold.  Waiter seemed very stressed and was not conversational.  Getting drinks refilled was a hassle.  Waiter said Brad was out, but tables next to us with different waiter had several servings of bread.  Bad service.

I&#39;ve never felt compelled to leave a bad review on a business before but I thought I would give a heads up to anyone thinking about ordering to go from here. Don&#39;t waste your time and $$. Ordered from their website online at 6:30 for pickup at 7:20. 50 min seemed reasonable for the dinner rush. Ordered the chicken piccata, kids quesadilla and a slice of cheesecake. Arrived and called the phone number as directed. Was told it would be right out. Patiently waited 20 min, called back and was told that no one had informed them and that it would be right out. Waited another 15 min. Obviously I would of gotten out and got it myself but since I was told it was on its way, I didn&#39;t want to miss them and waste more time. I got my food which was obviously ice cold at this point. The piccata had the lunch size serving of pasta. I specified extra sauce on the side and they gave me a tiny container of a tablespoon of sauce. They did give me the extra capers and lemon though. But the real kicker here is after all of that, I found a long blonde hair in my food. I have dark hair..

Great! Service was good, atmosphere is fun, and the meal is always yummy; I think I get something different every time I go, and I&#39;m always impressed with what I ordered. AND UM LET&#39;S NOT FORGET ABOUT THE CHEESECAKE. The best around town. I am a huge fan of the white chocolate raspberry and their peanut butter one. Seriously y&#39;all, it is the best. It&#39;s fun to just go for dessert or both dessert and dinner. But mostly just dessert;) My only complaint is the times I&#39;ve had reservations, they hardly ever seat right you at your reservation time. When I check in 10 minutes prior to my reservation, often I still have to wait 20-30 minutes from that check in point. So make sure you reserve earlier than you think you&#39;ll need, especially if you have somewhere to go after! It&#39;s also nice that&#39;s it&#39;s so close to Temple Square and other popular destinations in Salt Lake. They validate City Creek parking!

Ok first off, I understand that super big restaurants like this can get super busy especially on the weekends. Me and my husband came in on a Saturday night at about 7 knowing it would be crowded, they said it was about a 50 minute wait and we were totally fine with that. We went shopping, came back 50 min later, and they sat us around 8:15. Our waiter was HORRIBLE....I get that it&#39;s busy and a weekend, but cmon put in some effort girl. She took about 10 min to even come give us some water, we ordered, food came about 30 min later and my rice was not cooked at all and the chicken was pink. So I waited about 20 min for her to come check on us and I returned the meal and got something else and yeah just overall really bad service.

Yummy, but servers forgot about us and half our food. They also didn&#39;t have enough place settings when we sat down. We were outside, so maybe that&#39;s why they forgot about us. Food was also cold.

We had reservations for a wedding luncheon at the Cheesecake Factory in City Creek. As we are waiting right now, the luncheon is supposed to start in five minutes and they haven&#39;t even started setting up. We have many guests coming and they don&#39;t even seem concerned! Never going through them again. So disappointed.

After eating here yesterday I will read review regardless of a restaurant being a chain or not.  Every location is different even with identical menus and this is definitely no exception.  Came between lunch and dinner.  Chose this over Twigs as there was zero wait when we cane in.  And thats where the inly star comes from.  Our party was myself, wife , and two little boys.  After ordering waited over a half hour for food which honestly I expect on a busy Friday night but definitely not at 3:30 on a Sunday.  The table was so sticky needed to put a napkin over it to rest an elbow.  oWaitress changed hands right before food came out (thats new)  all food had obviously been sitting for quite awhile as it was either soggy or rick hard.  My little boys were starving and ate(ish) i had tried something new and decided that was my bad ..my wife&#39;s was so bad she just asked the server to please take it off the bill as she could not eat it.. between oil over the top to the bread so hard she could hardly bite it.  Server asked if she wanted to reorder... we had been there over 45 min at that point ...why wait another 1/2 hr till we were all done so she could get another iffy meal.  I found it interesting in reading review the response from the restaurant was basically say something while you are there..well first why should you have to bring so many obvious issues to their attention and secondly we did and the solution was not impressive... oh and to top it off the only one who didn&#39;t get sick after was my wife... who didn&#39;t eat ...

Just OK. The food was generally speaking ok- not bad but also not good. The pastas we had mostly relied on cream for the flavor. I had to add salt to mine, which is the first time ever I had to do this at a restaurant. The avocado egg roll appetizer was the highlight of the meal. The drink I got was exceedingly weak. The dessert was not that amazing either- got the tower cake. It tasted like a cake mix cake. My husband&#39;s cheesecake was good. The service was good but the timing of bringing dishes to the table was off- everything was rushed. Overall- overpriced for the quality.

We had 8 people over last night to watch TV and thought The Cheesecake Factory would be the perfect choice for appetizers. Using Door Dash delivery, I ordered almost $260 worth of food (6 orders of roadside sliders, 6 orders of southern fried chicken sliders, 2 Asian chicken salads, and 2 BBQ Ranch chicken salads + tax and delivery). There was nothing wrong with the delivery. It was on time. However, when we opened the containers with the sliders, they were on regular size buns, one extremely thin hamburger patty had been cut into quarters, and the chicken was no larger than a quarter (like a very small nugget - completely lost on that huge bun). We had to combine the meat off 4 sliders to make a decent 1.  I was so embarrassed! I doubt any of our friends ever order from there again.  I won&#39;t. I&#39;m furious that my experience, as a hostess among friends trying to do something really nice, cost me $260. We all agreed it equated to about a $20 value meal. Thank goodness for the salads!

It&#39;s just your regular chain restaurant but we had a really good experience here. Our waiter was nice and very attentive. I got a spicy Cajun pasta dish off their huge menu and a mojito and both were really good. I thought their food would be worse since it&#39;s difficult to make every dish superb with such a huge variety on the menu, but I was pleasantly surprised. Of course, the cheesecake for dessert (we shared a piece of peanut butter chocolate) was delicious, but who can really mess up cheesecake? Obviously there are more unique spots to check out in the downtown Salt Lake area but we had a good time at this Cheesecake Factory location!

Poor service. Two of the orders were messed up originally even after the food took a long time to come out. Some of the dishes, such as the salads, were pretty good once corrected but the chicken salad sandwich was not anywhere near its usual quality and the other food was just okay.

I had a great experience here! The staff was friendly and forthright. As always, the food was delicious.<br><br>I ordered a drink that was god awful though. It was some strawberry thing that sounded good on paper, but looked (and tasted) like my little pony princess vomit.<br><br>The manager came over, apologized, and got me a different beverage!<br><br>All and all I was super satisfied!
A laughable attempt at upscale chain dining in Utah.

After a 2.5 hour wait, my food sucked and the waitress didn&#39;t offer to do anything about it. I took one bite, didn&#39;t like it. She asked me how it was, I said I didn&#39;t like it and she said, &#34;oh, okay.&#34; This entree was only chosen after I was told that my first choice was sold out. <br><br>My husband&#39;s entree, on the other hand, was awesome. Good thing the portions are huge because I ate half of his. <br><br>Not worth the wait for sub-par food.

Went with a friend and our three kids. Had good service. Waitress was amazing. I had the shrimp tacos. Although I enjoyed them, I didn&#39;t like that there was very little shrimp, and small chunks of chicken in the mix. Also, I felt like the lighting was to dark and made the environment somewhat unpleasant.

Wonderful service and great food. We had the Farfalle with Chicken and Roasted Garlic and the Bang Bang chicken and shrimp. So far the best thing I&#39;ve had at The Cheesecake Factory. Great dining experience. Tons of food for the price. Cheesecake (Adams PB &amp; Chocolate) was to die for.

Tried their steak tacos for the first time and they are unbelievable!!! I would definitely suggest you get those !!  I really didn&#39;t care for their food that much and that I was a little overrated for the weight but the steak tacos would definitely be worth it!!  If you take a seat at the little round tables (the bar) you don&#39;t have to wait.

This is the worst restaurant I&#39;ve ever been to especially for the price. The food is just simply tastes terrible. Don&#39;t go here you will be disappointed and waste your money. Honestly don&#39;t know how a restaurant with this poor of food is still in business.

Amazing food bread is good and the cheesecake itself is good.  I do some problems with a long wait and some of the waiters at times can be pushy.  Other than that I would recommend this place to anyone who enjoys some good food and cheesecake
I ordered the Cajun shrimp pasta. It was cooked perfectly with the right amount of heat.   The hostess and waiter was great.  No complaints here.

I normally try not to dine at many large food chains if I could help it. But being invited to one, you can&#39;t avoid not going but to make the best of it. With a party of about 10, this particular Cheesecake Factory was near a newly builded shopping mall in downtown Salted Lake City. Actually a Very Nice shopping mall in fact.<br><br>The waiting was average for our party, but we enjoy the out of town guest and in no time, we were seated. I know that almost all entrees are serve in very large portions as well as being high in calories. <br><br>I decided to just stay with the small plates and snacks instead. The Santorini Farro Salad was just right as it had fresh chunky tomatoes, cucumbers, beets, red onions, farro and feta cheese in a vinaigrette. A healthy choice and was to my liking. My second small plate I had was Parmesan polenta fries. It was a decent order of about 9 crispy fried polenta sticks. I didn&#39;t care for the luke warm marinara sauce. I also just share  different cheesecakes between 4-5 other guest. Overall, not bad service, attentive and refills constantly.

If you&#39;re traveling in large groups you may want to chose another restaurant who could handle your party. We were celebrating a birthday and unfortunately for both us and the staff they do NOT take reservations. Obviously this put everyone in a bind. Are party was to large and  clearly they were understaffed. We  had two waiters waiting on us. One whom was pregnant and looked like she was due any minute. Her attitude was not the nicest, but this is to be expected when your 32 weeks and assigned to a party of 40. Clearly my heart went out to her b/c she simply she was struggling. The other waiter seemed overwhelmed and you could tell immediately he was not up for the task. He was all over the place. The drinks, food, checks got mixed up and at the end he was just so rude and not once apologized for all the mixed up. Finally it was dessert time and when  the dessert came out it was placed in a togo box without our request, we knew that was a hint. Lol! Thankfully everyone had a good time and didn&#39;t care about the crappy service we received or the empty drinks that were never refilled, or the snappy waitress who looked like she just wanted her baby out NOW. I was hoping to expect more this time, but yet again I was disappointed with Cheesecake Factory. Sometimes you have to let go and move on. <br><br>P.S. Our wait time went from 1 hour, 1 20 mins to 1 hour 50. This is why you do reservations to eliminate this.<br><br>Tip: Don&#39;t come in large groups because they don&#39;t do reservations. Better yet go to BRIOS next door.

Wow. I think there are tons of people used to having their rears wiped by &#34;the help&#34; writing some of these reviews... <br>Let&#39;s be fair: this place is popular and has consistently tasty food and a menu rivaled by no other restaurant. They honestly have a little of everything you can imagine. Seriously, I challenge anyone to find a better spot downtown which has such a variety! <br>This is also a NEW LOCATION - which people obviously can&#39;t empathize with. Having served tables at three restaurants in my past lives, I can tell you that running a new restaurant location is super challenging - much less one of this size and magnitude. <br>I&#39;ve been here several times since they opened and have had phenomenal service and wonderful food. Wait times for tables have been less than I was quoted, and service was fast and friendly. A hostess even recognized me from two months earlier. I mean, come on people..... If you want it fast, go to Crown Burger. Or better yet, the Mc Donalds inside your WalMart. Otherwise, give it another go and you&#39;ll be pleasantly surprised.<br>I&#39;ll be back here every time I&#39;m in SLC. Guaranteed.

Do you like to read?  The Cheesecake Factory Menu is lengthy...I mean pages and pages of shit.  It&#39;s hard to believe that they have a zillion items on their menu, and people actually pay to advertise in the menu.  You feel like you are looking at a magazine, and cannot decide what to eat.<br><br>I have been to the Cheesecake Factory a number of times, I always order something different...and it&#39;s always mediocre.  It tastes as if it&#39;s pulled out of the freezer and thrown into a microwave.<br><br>With that said, they have a vast array of mixed drink options.<br><br>Today we decided to order a number of appetizers - Crab Artichoke Cheesy Dip, Fried Zucchini, and Firecracker Salmon.  My favorite was the Crab Artichoke Dip.  They rest tasted mass produced and not made &#34;to order&#34;<br><br>My husband ordered a Blueberry Mojito, and our kids both had lemonade.<br><br>3 appetizers, a mixed drink, and 2 kiddie lemonades cost around $40.  Not bad.  But, I could have easily picked up a few things in the frozen section of our grocery store, and made drinks at home for less. - And it probably would&#39;ve tasted better too.<br><br>No kiddie menus (not with crayons, etc.) - and a 55 minute wait. <br><br>For whatever reason I continue to eat here...and I am always disappointed when I leave.
Disappointing chicken n biscuits... biscuits over cooked, skin on the gravy and a crunch on top of the mashed potatoes.  Flavor was ok but the strang part was the server kept reaching over the wall

LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE. <br>My family and I were visiting my sister for her college graduation back in 2014 and we all decided to go to The Cheesecake Factory for celebratory dinner. This was my first time and I was really excited to go. <br>It&#39;s in downtown Salt Lake and was PACKED, but we got in pretty quickly. Our server was phenomenal. She was very friendly, funny, didn&#39;t have a problem explaining menu items to us newbs, and everything came out quickly, considering the rush. <br>The food was spectacular. The Steak Diane was probably the best steak dish I&#39;ve ever had in my life. It was cooked perfectly, the mashed potatoes were AMAZING, and the flavor just can&#39;t be duplicated (I&#39;ve tried, thanks Pinterest). Their coffee is superb as well. I nearly stole my hubby&#39;s caramel macchiato because it was THAT good. <br>Of course, the cheesecake is to die for as well. I mean, it better be, it&#39;s the CHEESECAKE factory. The hardest part is picking which slice to go for. My all time favorite is the Godiva Chocolate cheesecake. It is really rich, so pair it with a latte and you have found heaven. <br>I can&#39;t wait to go back.

Decent spot. My waitress was real nice and I had the Jamaican pepper shrimp and the red velvet cheesecake. I would have made the sauce spicier and served the shrimp over a bed of fried plantains and mango salsa instead of rice and beans. I would have made the bottom layer of cheesecake red velvet instead of chocolate.
Really good!! We had an awesome server and food was very filling!! And the best part was having that big piece of cheesecake with some Sangria!!

We have gone to this Cheesecake several times and not had too many issues. We like the food and the Cheesecake is an obvious. We haven&#39;t ever had amazing service though and tonight was the straw that broke the camels back. We were waiting in line to sit in the self seating bar area behind 2 other couples. One of them got a table after about ten minutes. The couple in front of us continued waiting for a while. Then we noticed 2 girls that had walked in front of us all and looked like they were going to sit in the bar area so the gentleman in front of us let them know that there was a line for the tables and they told him that the restaurant had told them there is no line and that it was first come first serve. I then stepped in and explained that yes it is first come first serve but we were all there before they were. They said they weren&#39;t looking for a fight and it was ok. When a table came open the couple in front of us beat the girls too it. So the girls sat at a table where two people had not even stood to leave yet. I asked the girls to allow my wife and I (who were holding a baby this whole time) to have the table because as we discussed earlier we had been waiting for a good half hour longer than the girls had. They refused to move and told me to talk to the restaurant if I wanted anything to be done. So I talked to a server who basically said tough shit to me and I asked for the manager. Manager came out and said although he agreed it wasn&#39;t right that the girls did that there was no way for him to ask them to wait and that the &#34;corporate&#34; policy was whoever sat in the table first got it. I asked if he really wanted people acting like animals to get tables and he said no but there is nothing he can do about it. Preceded to tell me how I was in the wrong and when my wife realized they were about to kick us out for &#34;making a scene&#34; we ended up just leaving. The management could have done a much better job and should have some sort of &#34;line&#34; for the area they are going to let patrons self govern. I never thought they needed that before because I didn&#39;t realize people would be so indecent but manager acted like it was normal and happened all the time.

I am a big fan of the Cheesecake Factory on State Street, Murray. Last weekend during shopping at City Creek center, my boyfriend and I decided to have dinner at this restaurant at City Creek. I ordered Steak Diane and my boyfriend ordered tenderloin steak. My food is yum but my boyfriend got a bad luck. There were a lot of fat in his tenderloin steak and overcooked for rare medium. It was expensive dinner and he was so disappointed. We won&#39;t come back to this location.

Thank you for being true to the Cheesecake Factory brand! I had such a bad experience with your Murray location that I stopped going to Cheesecake Factory unless I was out of town. But I had a really good experience at city creek and will continue coming here. Beautiful decor, very different from the others ones I&#39;ve been to. Excellent service, fast friendly and attentive. Even your curbside to go was great. I&#39;ve been here a few times and will continue driving all the way here because of it. My favorite dish is the factory combination chicken Madeira and shrimp scampi. My husband loves the steak Diane. Bring back the crispy taquitos please! Great stuffed mushrooms, sweet corn tamales (minus the spicy sauce), orange chicken, banana cream cheesecake, red velvet cheesecake, sourdough bread, fried Mac &amp; cheese. I can go on and on, I love this place!
The food here is good, but pricey. You could probably find cheaper, better food at lots of places nearby.

From reading the Reviews I knew a Saturday would be crazy busy.  I set it up to show up, Put our name down at 3pm.  At that time I was told there was a 2 and a half hour wait for a table of 12.  I totally get it.<br><br>Our group showed up at 5:45.  Still not ready for our group.  Even down sized our group from 12 to 7.  We waited for another 45 minutes before we were seated.  Leaving our wait for 3 and half hours.  <br><br>We sat We decided what we wanted to eat.  We ordered.  1 hour later everyone in our groups food comes.  1 HOUR.  Still leaving 2 people in our group with out food. We had to wait another 20 minutes before our sever showed back up to see how the food was and get the rest of our plates. Which one of the plates were for a Pregnant woman.  You don&#39;t come between a pregnant woman and her food.  <br><br>As we ate we not once saw our server.  The food was amazing.  Our drinks were empty we had to stop the manager just to get water. she finally showed up 45 minutes later asked how our food was and if we wanted dessert.  We ordered a cheese cake and a birthday celebration cheese cake and asked for the checks.  She showed up with the birthday celebration cake and the full cake 10 minutes later (good timing due to the rest of the time was way to long)<br><br>We then waited for another 40 minutes for our checks.  We almost walked out due to the time it was taking to just get anything.  As we sat there we looked around and noticed tables that were seated after us were leaving before us.  in some cases we even saw tables that were seated for the 3rd time.  We had a prior reservation for 8:30 and we lost that due the time it took there.  <br><br>I grabbed the manager and told them of how I felt my first experience was there and all he said was Well I wished you grabbed me sooner.  <br><br>I do not recommend this place at all.  The food might have been great but the wait and service was awful!!

I&#39;ve never been a huge fan of The Cheesecake Factory, but I had to try the new one at City Creek. We went on a Sunday morning and decided to get brunch. I was actually pretty surprised with the prices. With a drink we were looking at just over 20 which from what I was used to from their dinners, was pretty fantastic. I got a normal breakfast with eggs bacon and toast and my gf got lemon pancakes. The lemon pancakes were pretty good, but didn&#39;t come with anything other than 3 pancakes. My breakfast was nothing to rave about, but it was fine. The server was brand new and had no clue what he was doing. Can&#39;t really give him to hard of a time as we all have to start somewhere. I&#39;d recommend trying the brunch if you are downtown on a Sunday, but there are better places in the area.
The manager was less than accomadating and kind of rude. The service was slow, but the serving staff was friendly at least
Just love the cheesecake factory went there yesterday to city Creek in Salt Lake. Very glad they have valet parking, just wish we had one up near Farmington Utah
As always excellent cheesecake.  Slav our waiter was awesome. He was attentive, efficient and pleasant.
Lunch was amazing! I had the avocado egg rolls and a heavenly piece of lemon-raspberry cheesecake! <br>Tip: Take a seat in the bar area to avoid waiting.

Word to the wise...show up BEFORE 11:30 for lunch!!!  I showed up right at 11:30 and was able to get a table immediately.  Within 10-20 minutes the whole restaurant was full with a line out the door!  YIKES!<br><br>Ambiance --  It looks like every other CF that I have ever been to.  Nice decor, warm and inviting throughout.<br><br>Food -- I wouldn&#39;t say that they have the best food but it is consistently good and pretty quick for a sit down place.  The Red Velvet Cheesecake is always a standout for me.  It is insanely good!<br><br>Service --  Our server was Jarret and he was honestly one of the best servers I have ever had!  This is a high compliment considering the amount of times that I have dined out!  He was sincere and attentive without being intrusive.  He cleared plates and refilled drinks frequently throughout our lunch.  Bravo to Jarret for doing such a great job!

Went there with my husband for our 1st year anniversary...definitely not the greatest impression for my first time at any Cheesecake Factory. It started out ok because as for any nice restaurant on a Saturday night we had to wait about 25 mins to be seated. Our primary waiter was nice &amp; took our beverage order &amp; followed though in giving us time before coming back while we decide on an appetizer &amp; any other beverages we may like. It all went down hill as soon as the server who brought us our appetizer came by. The table was really small for 2ppl &amp; it was already crowed from our large menus &amp; bread basket &amp; two side plates. This particular server, whom I didn&#39;t catch the name of, was obviously in a rush &amp; discourteous as he kept telling me to move the items around to accommodate the large platter so he could put it down. He even was telling my husband to move the items as well. I was trying to tell him that without sweeping the plates &amp; beer bottle off the table that I had no where else to put the items id already stacked &amp; scooted to the side. He hastily plopped the platter down &amp; took off, but not before I had asked him to take the beer bottle to toss as I didn&#39;t want to accidentally knock it off &amp; shatter it. He yanked it out of my hand &amp; said, &#34;yeah, it&#39;s that kind of a night.&#34;<br>I work in customer service &amp; that was just uncalled for! When our original waiter came around to take our order we placed our order to go- he was a bit surprised. We explained we did not want to spend our anniversary in an already crowded place if we were just going to be treated like that. My husband said that in the many times he&#39;d been there he&#39;s never had service such as that. The manager was informed &amp; very apologetic &amp; even went as far as paying for our entrees and getting us dessert. I appreciated our original waiter &amp; the manager, Tyler. I feel bad that one servers customer service skills were lacking &amp; that it effected the waiter, so we left a small tip anyhow. <br>Overall it was a sad evening for dining out. Too small of tables, too loud &amp; crowded &amp; the menu is SO big that it takes quite some time to review &amp; decide- it has way too many options. And they really should accept reservations on the weekend. Although it was a rough first experience for me I think I&#39;ll give it some time &amp; try it again on a weekday with a reservation.

Very crowded location with too small of a waiting area. Even at 5:00pm there was already an hour wait. Dim lighting makes it hard to read the menu. The restaurant is 1 floor with the highest ceiling I have ever seen. Seems like they could have made a second floor for more seating, and to increase the size of the waiting area. Tables are all very close so there isn&#39;t any privacy. Good variety of food as is at any Cheesecake Factory. My wife and I shared and enjoyed the bang bang chicken and shrimp. It is made with curry so it has a mild spice to it. Unfortunately there is no raspberry chocolate cheesecake option (only white chocolate which we don&#39;t prefer), so we went with lemon raspberry with fudge on the side. It cost a whopping $9.90. The piece was pretty small and wasn&#39;t anything to smack our lips about. My wife can make way better cheesecake at less than $10 a slice.
They were amazing!!!! The waiter was so nice and are drinks were always full. One meal was not the best so they refunded us. The cheese cake was delicious. This is 5 stars because it was awesome!!!!!

I could not believe the wait we had AFTER our buzzer went off indicating our table was ready. We were a party of 5 hanging out outside, with my rambunctious and tired one year old, when the buzzer went off indicating our table was ready. We went in and was told to stand at the hostess table as we would be seated shortly. It was super cramped at the hostess table but we were expecting to be seated shortly so it wasn&#39;t a big deal. Unfortunately, that was not remotely the case! We waited another 20minutes while other parties (same size as ours, some larger, some smaller) were all seated. It was so incredibly uncomfortable. We kept getting bumped into by both staff and patrons. We asked multiple times when we would be seated and we kept receiving the same answer &#34;soon&#34;. Mind you, we had already waited 45minutes for our buzzer to go off. Needless to say I was not very happy with any of the hosts or the managers who were foreseeing this fiasco with us and with the giant crowd growing inside at the host stand. However, the best part about our visit was our waitress. She was absolutely fantastic, I wish I knew her name so I could give her credit. She did an amazing job regardless of how busy she was. Thank you! Oh and the food was ok--some of us loved ours, others of us, not so much.

Who doesn&#39;t love cheesecake factory? Bang, bang chicken and shrimp, crispy chicken costoletta, cajun pasta jambalaya, and the cheesecake... I could go on. Something for everyone here. If you&#39;ve never been, I recommend it.

I love the food at Cheesecake Factory! This review is more about the service. I give the service 0 but the food 4 so this is in between. We were seated about 6:45 last night and we honestly didn&#39;t have a waitress even talk to us until about 7:15. That&#39;s ridiculous. The manager needs to do his\her job and train these kids. I will not return to this location. MANAGER TRAIN YOUR STAFF! I should be asked for my drink selection within a couple minutes of sitting down not 30.

big portions, mediocre food. nice staff, had us wait for a table even though the place was empty at 5pm on a Sunday! I can&#39;t believe they use plastic cups for water, cheap plastic mugs. come on, I&#39;m paying $17 for an entree. good cheesecake of course.
Haters be hatein.  This place is always a classic fall back. Always good. Great Food. Big portions.  Delicious cheese cake. Stop complaining its a good time.  Go early on weekends long wait times!

I think I have just burned out of this place a long time ago. I really don&#39;t like to wait for an hour or more just to eat at a chain restaurant. But you really can&#39;t go wrong with one plate of food that could feed a small family. I will never understand anyone that eat a huge piece of cheesecake after that much food. But you can definitely get it to go. I am sure I will be back at some location.

That was awful!  My streak was small and ice cold.  Service never came around to refill drinks.  If you want bread it comes after the meal.  Desert maybe if you want to pay $9 for a piece of cake.  Would not eat there.  Over price and small.

The cheesecake is pretty good, I&#39;ll admit. But that&#39;s where it stops. Generic chain food in a shiny package. Also, they accidentally erased our order while we were there so that we had to wait about an hour for our food. Luckily we got free cheesecake.

The food in general is pretty good here, but the service is always less than I expect. I definitely wouldn&#39;t say awful, but the seating and food wait times can be ridiculous. In most of my visits, all my waiters say they&#39;ll be right back with something and it takes close to 5 - 10 minutes, even for something as simple as getting me a steak knife. It might be that they&#39;re always understaffed, whatever it is, it&#39;s frustrating. I tried the Ribeye last week, and after sending it back once for being extremely overcooked, it came back undercooked and it just wasn&#39;t that good. I&#39;ll probably give this CF another try, because it&#39;s right there at City Creek and is convenient when you&#39;re they&#39;re shopping, so hopefully it turns out better.

I have dined at numerous Cheesecake Factory Restaurants across the U.S. and the service has been consistently good and the food has always been of the highest quality. This location was another fine example of the well-developed Cheesecake Factory brand. <br><br>The location of this restaurant was great, right in the middle of the pretty shopping mall and the restaurant itself had beautiful high ceilings and low ambient lighting. We had to wait about 15 minutes for a table, but the weather was nice and we enjoyed a bench near the fountain. <br><br>Our server was a top-notch professional who quickly greeted us and took our drink order. Thankfully, we know how large their portions are and skipped ordering an appetizer. Unfortunately, they ran out of salmon so I couldn&#39;t enjoy my favorite Miso Salmon dinner, but I stepped outside my comfort zone and was pleasantly surprised by the Oven Baked Herb &amp; Lemon Chicken. I would&#39;ve preferred a green vegetable instead of cooked carrots but the Mashed potatoes were yummy and our drinks from the bar were really good too. After dinner, I decided to splurge and order the Strawberry Shortcake a la mode and a cup of coffee. I expected a moist slice of cake but it was more like a biscuit topped with berries, whipped cream and ice cream. The cake was a little on the dry/hard side but still yummy. Perhaps I should&#39;ve stuck with cheesecake, Lol. <br><br>This is where things got bad, hence the 3-star rating. I added the cream and sugar to my coffee and used my unused spoon to stir it up. I then took a sip of coffee from the spoon and licked it, only to discover with my tongue, chunks of dried food on the spoon!!!! YUCK!!! I politely told the server about my surprise discovery and his reaction was honest and professional. He acknowledged the problem and immediately apologized. I asked for a new coffee and he promptly returned with one, along with the manager who also apologized and offered anything to rectify the situation. I&#39;m really not one to try and get free stuff or discounts unless something is really really bad, so I just accepted the apology and finished my coffee. The server returned and once again apologized, and seemed visibly upset about the whole situation. He said that if it were him, he wouldn&#39;t have been as nice as I was.  He returned with the bill and said that he just couldn&#39;t accept my reluctance to ask for compensation, and in order for him to feel good about it, he insisted on at least comping the dessert. What a nice gesture. <br><br>We enjoyed our dinner and the truly professional level of customer service from the server and management, but I guess the dish washing and table setting staff members need to pay closer attention to their jobs. <br><br>Thanks to this experience, I will now closely inspect my silverware before digging in at any restaurant.

this brand new location located in downtown Salt Lake is fantastic.  We started the evening with Chicken lettuce wraps, that would put PF Chang&#39;s to shame.  My main course was the spicy cashew chicken with the sauce on the side and it was delicious.  I am usually not a fan of chains, but I love this place
The service was fantastic and extremely helpful.  Well done Scott!  Food seemed slightly undercooked but probably rushed because we arrived late in the evening.  Great experience overall.

Worst Cheesecake Factory experience I&#39;ve ever had. I&#39;ve been to half a dozen different Cheesecake Factory locations in California, and I&#39;ve always had a positive experience. This location sucks. It took forever to get a glass of iced tea. Right when I was wondering what was taking so long with the tea, our server walks by with a half full glass of iced tea saying he&#39;s looking for more tea. A few minutes later he finally found some and drops it off at the table. As I&#39;m stirring in the sugar I noticed dozens of black specks floating around in my glass. I assumed (and hoped) they were little bits if tea leaves. The glass was also dirty, it had bits of caked on particles. <br>Our server brought us bread, it must have been sitting under a warmer for hours because it was incredibly dry and crusty. No amount of butter could save it. <br>The main course was ok. I had a pasta dish, the pasta was very oily but it tasted ok. <br>The service was also incredibly slow. I think we were there over an hour just for lunch. Our server seemed to want to be our buddy and kept saying things like &#34;cool man&#34; and &#34;whatever you want man&#34;. He even patted my husband on the back as he was leaving the table once. Not very professional at all. <br>We skipped dessert. Normally I love cheesecake, but I just wanted to get out of there ASAP.

My wife and I went to the Cheesecake Factory on a Monday afternoon around 5 pm. While the place was pretty empty we were asked to wait to be seated. That process was extremely slow. It looked like one party was seated every five minutes. So we waited more than 15 minutes for a table in an almost empty restaurant. We asked for an outside table which we got. Unfortunately nobody had closed the sun umbrellas (there was no sun anymore), so getting to a table required some careful maneuvering for people taller than six feet (which included some of the waiters. The service was slow, the food was okay, but nothing special. Overall a very disappointing experience.
This CF is on par with the chain. If you like CF in general, you will not be disappointed. Wait staff is top shelf!

I feel like the Cheesecake Factory&#39;s menu is far to big. But then again, that&#39;s probably why they are as popular as they are. But this location is really awesome. I hadn&#39;t been here before or realized how absolutely HUGE it is. The ceilings must be 30 feet high. It reminded me of being at a Vegas casino honestly. Our server was good. The food is above average like most Cheesecake Factory items. Large wine and liquor selection. Foot rubs offered in the bathroom. But they kicked my gay friend out because he was gay...I&#39;m kidding, I just hear people say City Creek is judgmental and I don&#39;t understand how a building with a bunch of stores in it can be judgmental. In any case, there was no wait, we were let right in, and I&#39;m impressed. I say come here if you&#39;re right between Fashion Place and City Creek, this will probably be a slightly better experience.

Delicious. Good service. Wide variety of food if your group cannot agree on one type of restaurant. Beautiful interior. Smooth operation. Yes restaurants do get busy people, what did you expect? Everyone from the hostess to the chef was efficient. And it was yummy.
Great service, great choices,  the Cajun pasta was awesome and enough food for multiple people. Cheese cake is a must have although you will prob take it to go

the food and service was better couple years ago, but last time i was there our food was late and when i asked the waiter about the reason, he said &#39;&#39;&#39; if you don&#39;t want it ill take it back&#39;&#39;, so rude.<br><br>the two stars because i love their cheesecake

Don&#39;t trust their claims of &#34;a short wait&#34;. That was over an hour. Not cool.<br>The waitress was nice. But the servers helping put a ridiculously hot kids plate of Mac and cheese in front of my 3 year old. I had a burger, it wasn&#39;t very good. <br>I wasn&#39;t terribly impressed with the place. It&#39;s a good things it&#39;s relatively cheap.

DONT USE CURBSIDE SERVICE. I normally love Cheesecake Factory and decided to pick some up after work to take home. I called it in and they offered me curbside service. I had never used it but loved the idea so I agreed. They asked me what kind of car I drove and said nothing about calling when I got there so I assumed they would just look for my car. They told me it would be ready in 30-35 minutes. I showed up at 40 minutes and sat there for 10 minutes watching staff approach all the cars but mine. I finally got out and learned I had to call and tell them I was there. The first staff member approached me thought I was someone else and informed me my order wasn&#39;t ready. By the time I got my order it was over an hour when they said it would be ready in 30-35 minutes. I tried to be patient about it but when I got home I realized they had left out the sides to my entrees. If it&#39;s going to take an extra 25 minutes, the least I expect is my correct order.

We had heard how great Cheesecake Factory was but this was our first time finding out for ourselves. The food was as good as we hoped it would be and then some. <br>I got one of the Skinnylicious Salads on the supplemental menu and it was loaded with yummy beets, asparagus, goat cheese and healthy options. I was going to get the skinny balsamic too but the server brought my husband his ranch dressing early and I had to taste it. It had a stronger that usual garlic flavor, obviously homemade and was fantastic on my salad. <br>Hubby got the Skinnylicious Turkey and Avocado sandwich and he loved it! My daughter ordered the bowties, butter and Parmesan which she practically inhaled. From the fresh, soft bread to the end of the meal, it was all terrific. We unfortunately left no room for the actual dessert but that was okay. <br>Our server was also fantastic, quick to take care of our needs despite the fact that the place was slammed, gave us helpful information and where to go within walking distance and how to get there too. <br>We can&#39;t wait for the one to open in Reno now!
A little overpriced, but still a good meal. Only suggestion I could make would be to fix the soap dispensers in the men&#39;s restroom.

I don&#39;t want to give this place a bad rating, nor do I want to give it a good one. Service is a lot faster than my hometown Cheesecake Factory, but that was pretty much the only good part. I got the soup and salad lunch combo, seeing as most of their portions are huge and smothered in buttery sauces. The texture of the tortilla soup was nasty, and the salad was just a pile of spring mix with a couple tomatoes floating around. Their blue cheese dressing is amazing, I&#39;ll give them that. I don&#39;t go to Cheesecake Factory very often and this was just another reminder of why that is.

I know, I know. It&#39;s a generic, chain restaurant. Hate it! Burn it! Harass the staff for their negligence! Here&#39;s the catch to this review: I ordered to slices of cheesecake to go from their to-go counter by the door. The cashier was helpful and prompt, the slices of cheesecake were delicious, and I didn&#39;t have to wait that long even though people were overflowing out of the lobby to be seated AND to get to-go cheesecake. So, all of those add up to a very pleasant experience and positive review. Naturally I reserve the right to update if I ever dine in at the actual restaurant, but we&#39;ll cross that bridge when we get there.
Great food and atmosphere,  we did have to wait a little while before being sat down. Other than that love it here

Make sure you have your sneakers on before you get here because you will be running from here.  Hour and 1/2 lunch ?  Really?  slow slow ssllooww  ssslllooowww.   Food was slow slow..I mean so so..  Spend your hard earned money at many local better server eateries in the area.  This lunch was a sh*&amp; show

Nasty dirty glass and hair in my food. They didn&#39;t comp my food. I&#39;ve worked in restaurants and never seen that before. Went to celebrate my sons bday, but our waiter wasn&#39;t the most attentive and felt like we were waiting a lot more than necessary. Not a fun place to celebrate a bday. Nothing special done. I would give 1 star but our cheesecake was good. Food was good before finding hair.

Came in with a group of friends around 5pm. The host upon entering rude and made us feel like we were a burden for entering the restaurant.  She may have been the manager come to think about it. Anyway, we were quoted 20 minutes. Five minutes into out wait and after seeing this same host/manager running back and forth from the front without smiling and continuing on with her bad attitude with others we decided to leave.

Pretty good and fast service. I came for a business lunch and ordered a fried chicken salad. It&#39;s lunch menu item but there was plenty of food and I actually didn&#39;t finish it all. Overall for a quick fix for lunch, not a bad choice.

Generic.  Formulaic.  Same in all Cheesecake Factories.  Decent and plentiful food portions.  Pricey slice of cheesecake.  You know what you get before you  go in, and I guess that&#39;s good.  Not a place for gourmands or those wanting an epicurean experience.  More for younger crowds wanting to go where younger crowds go.

Service was poor. Moments after we sat down the waitress tried to hurry us to order  without giving us time to look at menu.
