She stated there was a huge table next to us and wanted to get our order going. Order a salad without tomatoes and a chicken dish. Salad came with tomatoes and chicken was super cold. I let them know and the took it back to heat it up. Instead of new plate they tried to just heat up my plate but was still cold on bottom.  Attitude of staff was poor and food was terrible.

We experienced the best customer service ever last week while visiting this place. We got there and realized we needed to leave quick so we didn&#39;t miss the train home. We asked the server to just box our food as it came out for a to go order.  The manager swooped in and helped and made it happen. They were so nice and even threw in some free cheesecake and free extra bread! I&#39;ll continue to come here every time I&#39;m in town and in city creek! Thank you to the server with &#34;t Rex&#34; arms and to the manager that night!

I have to say that I have never been disappointed in this place! I went about a week ago for a friends birthdays dinner at the Murray location and now came to the City Creek for my own birthday dinner with my husband and son! We were seated fairly quickly on a busy Saturday afternoon and the patio view was perfect on a cloudy, but warm day! The waitress was super nice and friendly and we received our orders in perfect time. I always order the avocado egg rolls appetizer cause with the tamarind-cashew sauce they are just to die for with the perfect amount of flavoring. I also love the ahi tuna tartare which has the perfect mix of tuna and avocado with wonton crisp used as a chip. My husband got the hibachi steak which is made up of certified Angus steak and shiitake mushrooms, onions, bean sprouts and wasabi mashed potatoes and tempura asparagus will make your Mama drool! To celebrate my old age, I decided to take to-go the Blackout Chocolate cake with a side of Carmel sauce because it has almonds on the outside and I must say I was impressed by how rich it tasted! (And it was a huge slice to share!) love this place!!!!!!!

They get one star only because the cheesecake was delicious. That&#39;s it! I ordered a popcorn shrimp appetizer and about 3/4 the way through, I bit into a piece and it was basically battered and fried fish bones. No joke!! I nearly swallowed 6 bones! (Counted) the waitress walked up just as it happened to ask how they were ironically as I was pulling bone after bone out of my mouth attractively on our wedding anniversary. They didn&#39;t comp the appetizer but brought out something we didn&#39;t ask for and the manager came over to tell me that it was so &#34;weird!&#34; Uh... no shit. I wasn&#39;t there for any of that. I was there to spend time with my husband. Totally horrible experience.

Pros:<br>- nice atmosphere<br>- good location<br>- open Sunday<br><br>Cons:<br>- parking difficult on Sunday<br>- service was delayed<br><br>My experiences at the Cheesecake Factory culminate in epic failures on the most basic entrees. This experience ordered fried Mac and cheese balls, they had a burned fry oil taste. The entree fet Alfredo was lacking any flavor (butter, garlic or cheese). <br><br>However the cheesecake was excellent.

My husband and I drive one hour to go to Salt Lake, for the past two years we have been going to this cheesecake factory every couple months, December 9 was a very important day for me and decided to bring some friends with me, the food is always excellent very consistent on the portion and the taste. However the service was horrible the server was not pleasant and she didn&#39;t do any efforts to make it better, so we decided to drive a bit further and to go to Murray, however tonight we needed to go to city creek  and I was craving for cheesecake factory. I am so happy we came back to our restaurant, William was our server he is very professional,  great recommendations excellent service, attention to details without being pushy, so glad. We came back and even decided to go back as early as  next Monday. Thank you for hiring such a great asset to your company. M&amp;M

I&#39;ve decided that for chain restaurants in Utah, The Cheesecake Factory (but only this location; the one at Fashion Place definitely plays second fiddle to this one) is #1.  Great food, great cheesecake, good service, and I&#39;ve finally figured out that you can easily split an entree and a cheesecake if you want to save a few bucks;  yes, they give you that much food!

Cheesecake Factory food is always good. But the waiter ignored me the entire time and directed his attention to my two colleagues. Even they noticed. When the food arrived, mine came out about 20 mins after my colleagues. Mine probably should have been the first since I ordered only a salad. Anyway, the manager came to our table to personally deliver my food, apologized for the delay, and said it was on the house. The waiter still came back with the check. LOL! But my colleagues explained to him since he was ignoring me. I would have given it a 1 but the 2 additional stars are for the manager.

DISASTER EXPERIENCE FROM HELL<br>Long insulting wait to be served Prepackaged not FRESH Food!<br>We were so excited to go to the CF.  Well may I say this was my first and last visit!<br>The greeting and seating!  We were greeted with pleasantly with &#34;we have immediate seating outside (outside temp 98) or it is a 20 minute wait for inside.  We choose to wait and were given a pager and about 20 minutes later the pager alerted us and handed it to the a hostess.  She took another party to their table and overhead the same greeting &#34;we have immediate seating outside...&#34; to a family that just walked in.  They choose to go outside but the hostess and our hostess now escorted us behind the new family.  To our shock their hostess said oh look we have an empty table and sat them at our table right in front of us!  Our hostess apologized and we stood another 10 min in the dining area waiting for a new table to open. <br>We ordered drinks including wine and they came to the table promptly.  We then placed our orders.  Ten minutes later the waitress comes back to inform my niece they just ran out of the small lunch pizza she ordered and said she could order the larger dinner version but it would cost more and would not come with salad.  What does this mean!  Two things come to mind:  1. if the really cared about us they would have just brought the bigger pizza after our disastrous seating experience,  2. that obviously they are serving frozen prepackaged food - otherwise if they had dough to make a large pizza then why would they not have the same dough to make a small pizza!<br>The wait - it was over an hour after my niece graciously said she we would have something else off the menu that our food came and over 1.5 hours after we were seated before we were served!  No drink refills (we had to ask).<br>The disaster!  We had a small catastrophe before we were served in that an ice tea glass was knocked over and broke and glass and ice tea were everywhere.  We managed to clean it up the best we could but sat there in broken glass and tea all over the place with no assistance (although two employees acknowledged the breakage - but did not assist - other than handing us a towel).  We piled up the larger pieces of glass and ice on a spare plate with the towel.  The waitress never took away the mess and we sat and had to eat our lunch in broken glass and water.  She took our lunch plates away but never took the mess away nor called for assistance.  <br>Bottom line!  NEVER AGAIN!  The worst service ever!  Mediocre prepackaged food, long waits and totally insulting experience!  <br>Shame on you Cheesecake Factory!

Awesome food and we had a great waitress she was amazing!! The only reason it is not 5 stars is because the lighting was terrible it was so dark we could not see the menus we had to use the flashlights on our phones to order

McKay is the best waiter we&#39;ve ever had! We&#39;ve eaten at Cheese Cake Factory&#39;s since my daughter was 3 all over the country and we came here for her 18th birthday.  BEST BIRTHDAY DINNER EVER! Thanks to McKay! He went above &amp; beyond by far!

Didn&#39;t care that there is always a wait for tables. Cheesecake a bit pricey and didn&#39;t care to much for it some to sweet and the price for one eh... I can go to Marie Calenders for better cheesecake! An okay restaurant! Cheesecake was a small serving!

Great food, horrible experience. My boyfriend ordered the Cuban sandwhich, his regular, but this time it was horrible. The bottom of the sandwhich was burnt black. So we sent it back. After waiting about ten minutes the new one comes out. Still burnt on the bottom but just a little bit better than the first. Still burnt though! Like seriously?! We were waiting for a new sandwhich so not only did they burn it again, but they could have taken it off the press and we could have gotten it faster as well and we would have been a lot happier. They didn&#39;t take the sandwhich off the bill, but I disputed it. First of all, the second sandwhich came out burnt again and we waited 10 minutes. Second, the manager never came to apologize. Third, they wanted to charge us and the waiter got all snarky when we wanted to talk to a manager about it. They ended up taking the sandwhich off but they were rude about it. Also, he said he took off the &#34;first&#34; sandwhich just not the second. He&#39;s all, &#34;so we took off one sandwhich now you want two sandwhiches taken off?&#34; it&#39;s like uhh we should have never had two to begin with if the cooks made it right the first time. So we order one sandwhich not two. A remake of a horrible sandwhich does not count as two? And if the second sandwhich that came out after 10 minutes of waiting was yummy and perfect -NOT BURNT AGAIN- then we would have nooo problem paying! But $13 for a sandwhich that came back bad again? No way. We used to love going here but never again.

Called for take out and was put on hold for 10 minutes.  Called back and was once again put on hold for 8 minutes.  Called again and told them I had been holding with no answer, and the girl walked over to the bakery to let them know someone was holding.  Finally placed my order.  Received a call back 2 minutes later and missed the call.  Tried calling back to see if everything was fine with my order and they once again put me on hold for 8 minutes.  Called AGAIN and asked to speak to a manager and was on hold for ten minutes.  FML.

Very nice decor, poorly run.  The hostess was quite full of herself.  They told me it would be a 20 min wait.  I was fine with that, so my cranky daughter could run around outside for awhile.  They called us in 5 minutes...  And made us wait by the hostess stand for 10 minutes, with 7 other parties, &#34;waiting for tables to be bussed.&#34;. Meanwhile, my daughter was screaming.  Stuffed mushrooms were dry, server was good.  The food was just mediocre.  The Cheesecake Factory in Thousand Oaks, CA spoiled us, I guess...  Much, much better.

This place is good, they have good food. They also sever cheesecake it is not just a creative name. My big issue is they make their waiters and waitresses wear white shirts. When serving food all day I cannot imagine the stress of worrying about all my tables, the kitchen, and staining my shirt. It is too much. However if you are looking for a good place to eat it is a good choice.Eat the egg roles you will love them.

I usually love the Cheesecake Factory and I&#39;m not typically a harsh critic but my server was an ass. He wouldn&#39;t refill any of our drinks, didn&#39;t get us more bread when we asked and everytime he came to our table he acted annoyed and we would try to joke around with him and thank him for everything and he wouldn&#39;t say anything and just kept a straight face the whole time. The two tables next to him were both talking crap on his horrible customer service skills as well... I got the chopped salad and it tasted horrible... And for dessert I got the Reese cheesecake and it tasted fantastic but I found something blue and gummy in it... (not sure what it was). Very dissatisfied.
Just stopped in for a slice of the original cheesecake at the dessert bar. Friendly service, restaurant wasn&#39;t too full, and cheesecake amazing!

Not wasting my money here again. Service was so slow it was insulting. It&#39;s a MONDAY night. Orders were wrong. Took forever to get acknowledged by sever, even longer to order food, get food, get the wrong food and wait for a new order, try to get a drink refill, try to search for server, wait 20 minutes for a check, LEAVE! Ugh. Seriously, I&#39;d rather order my food at a checkout counter and pick up my own food. Cuz you know I didn&#39;t leave a good tip on this shitty visit. Ugh.

Wow....this was hands down the worst service at a restaurant I have ever had. I&#39;ve been to a number of cheesecake factory&#39;s over the years and understand it is good food with long wait times but the City Creek location took the cake when it comes to poor service. My wife and I expected to have a nice evening while celebrating her birthday and leaving this kids at home but it turned into a terrible evening. We showed up at 7:40 PM and checked in to be told we would need to come back in an hour to view our status in line. We came back precisely one hour later to be told for a party of 2 it would be another 10 minutes before it was our turn. So we sat down next to the front desk only to wait another 35 minutes before we asked again what the status was. We were told that we had already been called and had missed our turn and would need to wait longer. At that point we told them we had been waiting right in front of them the last 35 minutes and our buzzer never went off so they let us up next after complaining. Once we sat at our table our waiter didn&#39;t come for 10 minutes to even greet us. When he finally arrived we told him exactly what we wanted since we had been waiting now to eat for two hours. He said he would bring the bread right out but which took another 15 minutes and then food came out another 10 minutes after that. We ate our whole meal in 15 minutes and did not get checked on once by our waiter for water refills etc. After another 10 minutes of waiting with empty plates the waiter finally came back to ask us if we were done. Another 10 minutes goes by and he finally brings back the check to pay and leave. All in all we showed up at the restaurant at 7:45 PM and didn&#39;t leave until 11:00 at night. If you plan on having a quick meal where someone caters to your needs this is not your place. I&#39;m a frequent diner at many restaurants and we probably would have had a better experience service wise at Taco Bell. Great restaurant, terrible location, and terrible service. I don&#39;t plan on returning.

First of ALL, I want to say that the managers were SUPER accommodating and was soooo nice to cook my son&#39;s special metabolic diet food for us both days (thats priceless). Our other children&#39;s food that we ordered were PERFECT both times. However, my pasta was still half raw not cooked yet the first day, of course they comp that dish, but it seemed as though our server didnt care for us, I had to take my pasta togo because it took soooo long for new pasta. (My husband&#39;s burger was cooked pefectly). On second day, my husbands chicken burger was soooo burnt, he couldnt eat it. Our Server didnt care much about us, they did finally cook us another one but forgot the sauce to FLAVOR the Chipotle chicken burger (hahaha). He ALSO took his burger togo, because it took sooo long (even though resturant was empty). But, all in ALL, the kids were happy, they DID cook my son&#39;s special food for us (much appreciated) and THE avocado rolls were super yummy. Still 4 stars. ;)

Updating review.<br>Months later I tried the chiliquiles  again and they were adequate.<br>I will apologize for being so hard on him the first time<br>Previous review:<br>I used curbside to go today,  and ate a few bites and threw it away =Chiliquiles=. It was obvious the man didn&#39;t know how to assemble them

Love, love, love the Cheesecake Factory. My favorite dish- Louisiana Chicken Pasta. Absolutely amazing. Now if I am trying to be good I go with the Grilled Chicken Tostada Salad which is also amazing and a very generous portion (my husband and I usually split it). The new location downtown is fantastic because it has a lovely outdoor patio - perfect for the summertime.

I have been to The Cheesecake Factory all over this country and have frequented their other franchise Grand Luxe many times.  This,  by far was the worst experience I have ever had.  The food was horrible and the service was worse than the food. My orders were not complicated. According to my server,  the kitchen failed to adhere to my request for light sour cream on my order.  She stated that not only did they forget, the amount on the order was so much that she ordered me another and the manager comped the item. I did not complain,  or request any accommodation.  I had nothing to do and nowhere to go.  I was enjoying an evening with my daughter who has to have their calamari whenever we see a restaurant and I give the option.  The calamari was extremely salty but she enjoyed.  Back to my situation.  When the check came to the table I was charged twice for the items that were comped but only one item was deducted. Basic math suggests that 2-1=1. The tally for the messed up entree should have been 2-2=0. When I pointed this out,  the waitress promptly engaged in a back and forth that included every thing from the kitchen messed up,  to the manager messed up.  Somewhere in the back and forth this sorry excuse for a hospitality industry employee made the mistake of saying. &#34;Well you ate it...&#34;  Zero to 100 real quick. Go get your manager.  Somewhere in there,  there was an offer to fix it and an admission that she had made a mistake by not reviewIng the check.  Too late!  You really messed up when you chastised me for eating the dish I came in to purchase that you charged me twice for after extending the offer to comp the item. Sadly the table next to me had a different problem with the quality of her order.  The waitress reordered the dish.  When the waitress looped back around,  the other patron explained she might just be interested in something else.  In a huff the waitresses tells the lady,  to basically make up her mind because if she doesn&#39;t want the replacement dish she needs to hurry up and cancel the order she submitted. Thanks a bunch.  On a first time trip to Salt Lake City and the state of Utah,  my daughter and I now have a miserable experience to remember. I tried to use it as a teaching experience. I explained to her that this young lady either was really bad at her job or was really having a bad day.  I went on to share almost by default I tip 20% of the check amount.  In cases where the kitchen messes up I don&#39;t penalize the server.  In this case I explained that on the little check we had of $30 and some change I paid $31. When the manager asked did I need change I said no.  #unbelievable We should have gone to IN and Out Burger.

I like the location and ambiance but every time I come here I leave disappointed in the food. It&#39;s just not that good. This is the place to go for a late-night cheesecake and coffee, but the entrees are entirely too bland.

Treated badly by Michael the manager.  Called two days ahead for reservations for our group of 8.  We were all set.  Called again 3 hours before arriving to confirm the reservation, and they told me &#34;Sorry we don&#39;t do reservations on Saturday&#34;.   OK, somebody messed up, what are our options I asked.  Just come on in and if you are here before 4 there will probably not be much of a wait.  So we got there at 3:40. Large group manager (Michael) said &#34;Sorry but there is a three hour wait&#34;.  I explained to Michael all that had happened, but his response was &#34;. . . corporate policy blah, blah&#34;.  Michael was extremely rude.  Michael did not care.  We left.  Their incompetence was superceded only by their rudeness.

This place is over rated. I&#39;ve had three meals at three different locations and I&#39;ve always been disappointed. The food is over priced and the service is marginal. I never complain about food when I eat out and have never sent food back, but I did this time and I will not give this chain a forth try. They have struck out with me.

It was a nightmare! The service is good, but the food is intolerable!<br>First, the shrimp scampi was deep-fried, my first-ever deep-fried shrimp scampi!<br>And shrimp was not processed well, it tasted like shit still inside.<br>For desert, I ordered tiramisu, it came with Five cream flowers, Five! They are much bigger than tiramisu itself.<br>For tiramisu, the lady fingers were soaked up, probably because it had already been made millions years ago.
Love this place! The cheesecake is soooo good! You can walk in to tables they have set up, seat yourself, and get a piece of cake!

I indicated that I wanted seating for eight. I was told this was a large party and that I would have to wait for a manager to &#34;negotiate&#34; for a table. We were kept waiting for nearly ten min (while five other groups were allowed into the queue, one which was for six people) until she arrived at the front and promptly ignored us. When she finally saw fit to acknowledge us there was no apology for the wait she simply curtly asked if there were any children. When I indicated no she replied one min and began ignoring us again. We walked out and were promptly and politely seated at Brio moments later.

This place was great! The food was great, the service was great, the environment was great. They were taking a little longer than usual on my meal so they gave me a complimentary soup. Then 2 minutes later, my meal came out and that was complimentary too! I&#39;ll definitely be back!

I enjoyed my first visit to the City Creek Cheesecake Factory. We ate lunch here around 1:30 pm on a Saturday and there was a 20 minute wait. The server was slow to take our order and slow to bring our check, but the food came quickly and it was prepared well. I enjoyed the cold summer rolls which contained shrimp and asparagus in a rice wrapper as an appetizer. I ordered Sheila&#39;s cashew chicken salad (lunch size) and it turned out to be a very large portion. I wish they used more salad dressing, but the quality of chicken strips was very fresh and tasty. I liked the amount of cashews in the dish. My husband ordered two excellent alcoholic beverages--a mai tai was his favorite as it was large and boozy. The second drink, a margarita, was ok but the mixer tasted of artificial lime powder. I enjoyed a strawberry lemonade, which was decent, but nothing special. My husband&#39;s entree, the lunch-sized shepherd&#39;s pie was too salty. Tasted like it was made with french onion soup mix. We took home half and diluted the leftover with more potatoes so it was more edible. Otherwise, the ambience was nice and we enjoyed the outdoor seating on a warm fall day. Also, beware that Cheesecake Factory does NOT validate parking.
Typical Cheesecake factory fare. Quite a few veggie options. The veggie burger was OK but fries were quite good.

Visited SLC on business recently, and a group of us went to the cheesecake factory for dinner. What a horrible experience that turned out to be! First off, they bought 2 of us at the table, the wrong order, and then when it was corrected, I found a rotten lettuce leaf in my salad! I pointed it out to the manager whose response was, &#34;Well it&#39;s only the tip of the leaf that was rotten&#34;. Really!!!!! What about the rest of the salad I had already eaten! I don&#39;t normallt go to chain restaurants like that....and certainly wont be going back there at all!

Factory food is so accurate! Everything here looks and tastes like it came from the factory to the microwave to the table.  The ridiculous menu is too long; a give away that almost everything is prepared somewhere else and re-heated on site.  Frozen TV dinners probably taste better and cost  a hell of a lot less.  Trying to avoid the microwaveable menu my wife and I ordered egg dishes for lunch.  Her omelet looked like &#34;something special&#34; from the Costco frozen foods section, only it wasn&#39;t as good.  My huevos racnheros also had the unmistakable  texture and taste of a frozen meal.  The over easy eggs might have been cooked on site but the corn tortillas went straight from the package onto the plate and the black beans tasted like they were over microwaved and turned into rabbit pellets.  Our son-in-law had a pizza that was obviously underdone.  Service was marginal.   Never again.
Expect a long wait, slow service and horrible food.  Get the cheesecake to go and choose another restaurant.
